◆ add_squirrel()

static struct squirrel* add_squirrel ( struct squirrel *  sq,
int  fd,
int  avoid_fd 
)
static

Definition at line 7846 of file hush.c.

7847 {
7848  int moved_to;
7849  int i;
7850 
7851  i = 0;
7852  if (sq) for (; sq[i].orig_fd >= 0; i++) {
7853  /* If we collide with an already moved fd... */
7854  if (fd == sq[i].moved_to) {
7855  sq[i].moved_to = dup_CLOEXEC(sq[i].moved_to, avoid_fd);
7856  debug_printf_redir("redirect_fd %d: already busy, moving to %d\n", fd, sq[i].moved_to);
7857  if (sq[i].moved_to < 0) /* what? */
7858  xfunc_die();
7859  return sq;
7860  }
7861  if (fd == sq[i].orig_fd) {
7862  /* Example: echo Hello >/dev/null 1>&2 */
7863  debug_printf_redir("redirect_fd %d: already moved\n", fd);
7864  return sq;
7865  }
7866  }
7867 
7868  /* If this fd is open, we move and remember it; if it's closed, moved_to = -1 */
7869  moved_to = dup_CLOEXEC(fd, avoid_fd);
7870  debug_printf_redir("redirect_fd %d: previous fd is moved to %d (-1 if it was closed)\n", fd, moved_to);
7871  if (moved_to < 0 && errno != EBADF)
7872  xfunc_die();
7873  return append_squirrel(sq, i, fd, moved_to);
7874 }

static struct squirrel* add_squirrel_closed ( struct squirrel *  sq,
int  fd 
)

7877 {
7878  int i;
7879 
7880  i = 0;
7881  if (sq) for (; sq[i].orig_fd >= 0; i++) {
7882  /* If we collide with an already moved fd... */
7883  if (fd == sq[i].orig_fd) {
7884  /* Examples:
7885  * "echo 3>FILE 3>&- 3>FILE"
7886  * "echo 3>&- 3>FILE"
7887  * No need for last redirect to insert
7888  * another "need to close 3" indicator.
7889  */

7891  return sq;
7892  }

10830  /* bash does nothing (exitcode 0) if HOME is ""; if it's unset,

10859

10864  //bb_error_msg("%s: ++x_mode_depth=%d", __func__, G.x_mode_depth);
10865  if (!argv[1]) {
10866  /* bash:
10867  * eval "echo Hi; done" ("done" is syntax error):
10868  * "echo Hi" will not execute too.
10869  */
10870  parse_and_run_string(argv[0]);
10871  } else {
10872  /* "The eval utility shall construct a command by
10873  * concatenating arguments together, separating
10874  * each with a <space> character."
10875  */
10876  char *str, *p;
10877  unsigned len = 0;
10878  char **pp = argv;
10879  do
10880  len += strlen(*pp) + 1;
10881  while (*++pp);
10882  str = p = xmalloc(len);
10883  pp = argv;
10884  for (;;) {
10885  p = stpcpy(p, *pp);
10886  pp++;
10887  if (!*pp)
10888  break;
10889  *p++ = ' ';
10890  }
10891  parse_and_run_string(str);
10892  free(str);
10893  }
10894  IF_HUSH_MODE_X(G.x_mode_depth--;)
10895  //bb_error_msg("%s: --x_mode_depth=%d", __func__, G.x_mode_depth);
10896  return G.last_exitcode;
10897 }

10926 {
10927  debug_printf_exec("%s()\n", __func__);
10928 
10929  /* interactive bash:
10930  * # trap "echo EEE" EXIT
10931  * # exit
10932  * exit
10933  * There are stopped jobs.
10934  * (if there are _stopped_ jobs, running ones don't count)
10935  * # exit
10936  * exit
10937  * EEE (then bash exits)
10938  *
10939  * TODO: we can use G.exiting = -1 as indicator "last cmd was exit"
10940  */
10941 
10942  /* note: EXIT trap is run by hush_exit */
10943  argv = skip_dash_dash(argv);
10944  if (argv[0] == NULL) {
10945 #if ENABLE_HUSH_TRAP
10946  if (G.pre_trap_exitcode >= 0) /* "exit" in trap uses $? from before the trap */
10947  hush_exit(G.pre_trap_exitcode);
10948 #endif
10949  hush_exit(G.last_exitcode);
10950  }
10951  /* mimic bash: exit 123abc == exit 255 + error msg */
10952  xfunc_error_retval = 255;
10953  /* bash: exit -2 == exit 254, no error msg */
10954  hush_exit(xatoi(argv[0]) & 0xff);
10955 }

◆ builtin_shift()

static int FAST_FUNC builtin_shift ( char **  argv)
static

Definition at line 11408 of file hush.c.

11409 {
11410  int n = 1;
11411  argv = skip_dash_dash(argv);
11412  if (argv[0]) {
11413  n = bb_strtou(argv[0], NULL, 10);
11414  if (errno || n < 0) {
11415  /* shared string with ash.c */
11416  bb_error_msg("Illegal number: %s", argv[0]);
11417  /*
11418  * ash aborts in this case.
11419  * bash prints error message and set $? to 1.
11420  * Interestingly, for "shift 99999" bash does not
11421  * print error message, but does set $? to 1
11422  * (and does no shifting at all).
11423  */
11424  }
11425  }
11426  if (n >= 0 && n < G.global_argc) {
11427  if (G_global_args_malloced) {
11428  int m = 1;
11429  while (m <= n)
11430  free(G.global_argv[m++]);
11431  }
11432  G.global_argc -= n;
11433  memmove(&G.global_argv[1], &G.global_argv[n+1],
11434  G.global_argc * sizeof(G.global_argv[0]));
11435  return EXIT_SUCCESS;
11436  }
11437  return EXIT_FAILURE;
11438 }

11566 {

11568  HFILE *input;

11571 #if ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS

11573 #endif
11574 
11575  argv = skip_dash_dash(argv);
11576  filename = argv[0];
11577  if (!filename) {
11578  /* bash says: "bash: .: filename argument required" */
11579  return 2; /* bash compat */
11580  }
11581  arg_path = NULL;
11582  if (!strchr(filename, '/')) {
11583  arg_path = find_in_path(filename);
11584  if (arg_path)
11585  filename = arg_path;
11586  else if (!ENABLE_HUSH_BASH_SOURCE_CURDIR) {
11587  errno = ENOENT;
11588  bb_simple_perror_msg(filename);
11589  return EXIT_FAILURE;
11590  }
11591  }
11592  input = hfopen(filename);
11593  free(arg_path);
11594  if (!input) {
11595  bb_perror_msg("%s", filename);
11596  /* POSIX: non-interactive shell should abort here,
11597  * not merely fail. So far no one complained :)
11598  */
11599  return EXIT_FAILURE;
11600  }
11601 
11602 #if ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
11603  sv_flg = G_flag_return_in_progress;
11604  /* "we are inside sourced file, ok to use return" */
11605  G_flag_return_in_progress = -1;
11606 #endif
11607  args_need_save = argv[1]; /* used as a boolean variable */
11608  if (args_need_save)
11609  save_and_replace_G_args(&sv, argv);
11610 
11611  /* "false; . ./empty_line; echo Zero:$?" should print 0 */
11612  G.last_exitcode = 0;
11613  parse_and_run_file(input);
11614  hfclose(input);
11615 
11616  if (args_need_save) /* can't use argv[1] instead: "shift" can mangle it */
11617  restore_G_args(&sv, argv);
11618 #if ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
11619  G_flag_return_in_progress = sv_flg;
11620 #endif
11621 
11622  return G.last_exitcode;
11623 }

◆ check_and_run_traps()

static int check_and_run_traps ( void  )
static

Definition at line 2119 of file hush.c.

2120 {
2121  int last_sig = 0;
2122 
2123  while (1) {
2124  int sig;
2125 
2126  if (sigisemptyset(&G.pending_set))
2127  break;
2128  sig = 0;
2129  do {
2130  sig++;
2131  if (sigismember(&G.pending_set, sig)) {
2132  sigdelset(&G.pending_set, sig);
2133  goto got_sig;
2134  }
2135  } while (sig < NSIG);
2136  break;
2137  got_sig:
2138 #if ENABLE_HUSH_TRAP
2139  if (G_traps && G_traps[sig]) {
2140  debug_printf_exec("%s: sig:%d handler:'%s'\n", __func__, sig, G.traps[sig]);
2141  if (G_traps[sig][0]) {
2142  /* We have user-defined handler */
2143  smalluint save_rcode;
2144  int save_pre;
2145  char *argv[3];
2146  /* argv[0] is unused */
2147  argv[1] = xstrdup(G_traps[sig]);
2148  /* why strdup? trap can modify itself: trap 'trap "echo oops" INT' INT */
2149  argv[2] = NULL;
2150  save_pre = G.pre_trap_exitcode;
2151  G.pre_trap_exitcode = save_rcode = G.last_exitcode;
2152  builtin_eval(argv);
2153  free(argv[1]);
2154  G.pre_trap_exitcode = save_pre;
2155  G.last_exitcode = save_rcode;
2156 # if ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
2157  if (G.return_exitcode >= 0) {
2158  debug_printf_exec("trap exitcode:%d\n", G.return_exitcode);
2159  G.last_exitcode = G.return_exitcode;
2160  }
2161 # endif
2162  last_sig = sig;
2163  } /* else: "" trap, ignoring signal */
2164  continue;
2165  }
2166 #endif
2167  /* not a trap: special action */
2168  switch (sig) {
2169  case SIGINT:
2170  debug_printf_exec("%s: sig:%d default SIGINT handler\n", __func__, sig);
2171  G.flag_SIGINT = 1;
2172  last_sig = sig;
2173  break;
2174 #if ENABLE_HUSH_JOB
2175  case SIGHUP: {
2176 //TODO: why are we doing this? ash and dash don't do this,
2177 //they have no handler for SIGHUP at all,
2178 //they rely on kernel to send SIGHUP+SIGCONT to orphaned process groups
2179  struct pipe *job;
2180  debug_printf_exec("%s: sig:%d default SIGHUP handler\n", __func__, sig);
2181  /* bash is observed to signal whole process groups,
2182  * not individual processes */
2183  for (job = G.job_list; job; job = job->next) {
2184  if (job->pgrp <= 0)
2185  continue;
2186  debug_printf_exec("HUPing pgrp %d\n", job->pgrp);
2187  if (kill(- job->pgrp, SIGHUP) == 0)
2188  kill(- job->pgrp, SIGCONT);
2189  }
2190  sigexit(SIGHUP);
2191  }
2192 #endif
2193 #if ENABLE_HUSH_FAST
2194  case SIGCHLD:
2195  debug_printf_exec("%s: sig:%d default SIGCHLD handler\n", __func__, sig);
2196  G.count_SIGCHLD++;
2197 //bb_error_msg("[%d] check_and_run_traps: G.count_SIGCHLD:%d G.handled_SIGCHLD:%d", getpid(), G.count_SIGCHLD, G.handled_SIGCHLD);
2198  /* Note:
2199  * We don't do 'last_sig = sig' here -> NOT returning this sig.
2200  * This simplifies wait builtin a bit.
2201  */
2202  break;
2203 #endif
2204  default: /* ignored: */
2205  debug_printf_exec("%s: sig:%d default handling is to ignore\n", __func__, sig);
2206  /* SIGTERM, SIGQUIT, SIGTTIN, SIGTTOU, SIGTSTP */
2207  /* Note:
2208  * We don't do 'last_sig = sig' here -> NOT returning this sig.
2209  * Example: wait is not interrupted by TERM
2210  * in interactive shell, because TERM is ignored.
2211  */
2212  break;
2213  }
2214  }
2215  return last_sig;
2216 }

◆ checkjobs()

static int checkjobs ( struct pipe *  fg_pipe,
pid_t  waitfor_pid 
)
static

Definition at line 9077 of file hush.c.

9078 {
9079  int attributes;
9080  int status;
9081  int rcode = 0;
9082 
9083  debug_printf_jobs("checkjobs %p\n", fg_pipe);
9084 
9085  attributes = WUNTRACED;
9086  if (fg_pipe == NULL)
9087  attributes |= WNOHANG;
9088 
9089  errno = 0;
9090 #if ENABLE_HUSH_FAST
9091  if (G.handled_SIGCHLD == G.count_SIGCHLD) {
9092 //bb_error_msg("[%d] checkjobs: G.count_SIGCHLD:%d G.handled_SIGCHLD:%d children?:%d fg_pipe:%p",
9093 //getpid(), G.count_SIGCHLD, G.handled_SIGCHLD, G.we_have_children, fg_pipe);
9094  /* There was neither fork nor SIGCHLD since last waitpid */
9095  /* Avoid doing waitpid syscall if possible */
9096  if (!G.we_have_children) {
9097  errno = ECHILD;
9098  return -1;
9099  }
9100  if (fg_pipe == NULL) { /* is WNOHANG set? */
9101  /* We have children, but they did not exit
9102  * or stop yet (we saw no SIGCHLD) */
9103  return 0;
9104  }
9105  /* else: !WNOHANG, waitpid will block, can't short-circuit */
9106  }
9107 #endif
9108 
9109 /* Do we do this right?
9110  * bash-3.00# sleep 20 | false
9111  * <ctrl-Z pressed>
9112  * [3]+ Stopped sleep 20 | false
9113  * bash-3.00# echo $?
9114  * 1 <========== bg pipe is not fully done, but exitcode is already known!
9115  * [hush 1.14.0: yes we do it right]
9116  */
9117  while (1) {
9118  pid_t childpid;
9119 #if ENABLE_HUSH_FAST
9120  int i;
9121  i = G.count_SIGCHLD;
9122 #endif
9123  childpid = waitpid(-1, &status, attributes);
9124  if (childpid <= 0) {
9125  if (childpid && errno != ECHILD)
9126  bb_simple_perror_msg("waitpid");
9127 #if ENABLE_HUSH_FAST
9128  else { /* Until next SIGCHLD, waitpid's are useless */
9129  G.we_have_children = (childpid == 0);
9130  G.handled_SIGCHLD = i;
9131 //bb_error_msg("[%d] checkjobs: waitpid returned <= 0, G.count_SIGCHLD:%d G.handled_SIGCHLD:%d", getpid(), G.count_SIGCHLD, G.handled_SIGCHLD);
9132  }
9133 #endif
9134  /* ECHILD (no children), or 0 (no change in children status) */
9135  rcode = childpid;
9136  break;
9137  }
9138  rcode = process_wait_result(fg_pipe, childpid, status);
9139  if (rcode >= 0) {
9140  /* fg_pipe exited or stopped */
9141  break;
9142  }
9143  if (childpid == waitfor_pid) { /* "wait PID" */
9144  debug_printf_exec("childpid==waitfor_pid:%d status:0x%08x\n", childpid, status);
9145  rcode = WEXITSTATUS(status);
9146  if (WIFSIGNALED(status))
9147  rcode = 128 | WTERMSIG(status);
9148  if (WIFSTOPPED(status))
9149  /* bash: "cmd & wait $!" and cmd stops: $? = 128 | stopsig */
9150  rcode = 128 | WSTOPSIG(status);
9151  rcode++;
9152  break; /* "wait PID" called us, give it exitcode+1 */
9153  }
9154 #if ENABLE_HUSH_BASH_COMPAT
9155  if (-1 == waitfor_pid /* "wait -n" (wait for any one job) */
9156  && G.dead_job_exitcode >= 0 /* some job did finish */
9157  ) {
9158  debug_printf_exec("waitfor_pid:-1\n");
9159  rcode = G.dead_job_exitcode + 1;
9160  break;
9161  }
9162 #endif
9163  /* This wasn't one of our processes, or */
9164  /* fg_pipe still has running processes, do waitpid again */
9165  } /* while (waitpid succeeds)... */
9166 
9167  return rcode;
9168 }

3800  /* The command is really already in the pipe structure, so
3801  * advance the pipe counter and make a new, null command. */
3802  struct pipe *pi = ctx->pipe;
3803  struct command *command = ctx->command;
3804

3808  syntax_error("invalid redirect");
3809  ctx->pending_redirect = NULL;
3810  }
3811 #endif

3813  if (command) {
3814  if (IS_NULL_CMD(command)) {
3815  debug_printf_parse("done_command: skipping null cmd, num_cmds=%d\n", pi->num_cmds);
3816  goto clear_and_ret;
3817  }
3818  pi->num_cmds++;
3819  debug_printf_parse("done_command: ++num_cmds=%d\n", pi->num_cmds);
3820  //debug_print_tree(ctx->list_head, 20);
3821  } else {
3822  debug_printf_parse("done_command: initializing, num_cmds=%d\n", pi->num_cmds);
3823  }

3825  /* Only real trickiness here is that the uncommitted
3826  * command structure is not counted in pi->num_cmds. */
3827  pi->cmds = xrealloc(pi->cmds, sizeof(*pi->cmds) * (pi->num_cmds+1));
3828  ctx->command = command = &pi->cmds[pi->num_cmds];

3832  command->lineno = G.parse_lineno;
3833  debug_printf_parse("command->lineno = G.parse_lineno (%u)\n", G.parse_lineno);
3834 #endif
3835  return pi->num_cmds; /* used only for 0/nonzero check */

◆ done_pipe()

static void done_pipe ( struct parse_context *  ctx,
pipe_style  type 
)
static

Definition at line 3838 of file hush.c.

3839 {
3840  int not_null;
3841 
3842  debug_printf_parse("done_pipe entered, followup %d\n", type);
3843  /* Close previous command */
3844  not_null = done_command(ctx);
3845 #if HAS_KEYWORDS
3846  ctx->pipe->pi_inverted = ctx->ctx_inverted;
3847  ctx->ctx_inverted = 0;
3848  ctx->pipe->res_word = ctx->ctx_res_w;
3849 #endif
3850  if (type == PIPE_BG && ctx->list_head != ctx->pipe) {
3851  /* Necessary since && and || have precedence over &:
3852  * "cmd1 && cmd2 &" must spawn both cmds, not only cmd2,
3853  * in a backgrounded subshell.
3854  */
3855  struct pipe *pi;
3856  struct command *command;
3857 
3858  /* Is this actually this construct, all pipes end with && or ||? */
3859  pi = ctx->list_head;
3860  while (pi != ctx->pipe) {
3861  if (pi->followup != PIPE_AND && pi->followup != PIPE_OR)
3862  goto no_conv;
3863  pi = pi->next;
3864  }
3865 
3866  debug_printf_parse("BG with more than one pipe, converting to { p1 &&...pN; } &\n");
3867  pi->followup = PIPE_SEQ; /* close pN _not_ with "&"! */
3868  pi = xzalloc(sizeof(*pi));
3869  pi->followup = PIPE_BG;
3870  pi->num_cmds = 1;
3871  pi->cmds = xzalloc(sizeof(pi->cmds[0]));
3872  command = &pi->cmds[0];
3873  if (CMD_NORMAL != 0) /* "if xzalloc didn't do that already" */
3874  command->cmd_type = CMD_NORMAL;
3875  command->group = ctx->list_head;
3876 #if !BB_MMU
3877  command->group_as_string = xstrndup(
3878  ctx->as_string.data,
3879  ctx->as_string.length - 1 /* do not copy last char, "&" */
3880  );
3881 #endif
3882  /* Replace all pipes in ctx with one newly created */
3883  ctx->list_head = ctx->pipe = pi;
3884  /* for cases like "cmd && &", do not be tricked by last command
3885  * being null - the entire {...} & is NOT null! */
3886  not_null = 1;
3887  } else {
3888  no_conv:
3889  ctx->pipe->followup = type;
3890  }
3891 
3892  /* Without this check, even just <enter> on command line generates
3893  * tree of three NOPs (!). Which is harmless but annoying.
3894  * IOW: it is safe to do it unconditionally. */
3895  if (not_null
3896 #if ENABLE_HUSH_IF
3897  || ctx->ctx_res_w == RES_FI
3898 #endif
3899 #if ENABLE_HUSH_LOOPS
3900  || ctx->ctx_res_w == RES_DONE
3901  || ctx->ctx_res_w == RES_FOR
3902  || ctx->ctx_res_w == RES_IN
3903 #endif
3904 #if ENABLE_HUSH_CASE
3905  || ctx->ctx_res_w == RES_ESAC
3906 #endif
3907  ) {
3908  struct pipe *new_p;
3909  debug_printf_parse("done_pipe: adding new pipe: "
3910  "not_null:%d ctx->ctx_res_w:%d\n",
3911  not_null, ctx->ctx_res_w);
3912  new_p = new_pipe();
3913  ctx->pipe->next = new_p;
3914  ctx->pipe = new_p;
3915  /* RES_THEN, RES_DO etc are "sticky" -
3916  * they remain set for pipes inside if/while.
3917  * This is used to control execution.
3918  * RES_FOR and RES_IN are NOT sticky (needed to support
3919  * cases where variable or value happens to match a keyword):
3920  */
3921 #if ENABLE_HUSH_LOOPS
3922  if (ctx->ctx_res_w == RES_FOR
3923  || ctx->ctx_res_w == RES_IN)
3924  ctx->ctx_res_w = RES_NONE;
3925 #endif
3926 #if ENABLE_HUSH_CASE
3927  if (ctx->ctx_res_w == RES_MATCH)
3928  ctx->ctx_res_w = RES_CASE_BODY;
3929  if (ctx->ctx_res_w == RES_CASE)
3930  ctx->ctx_res_w = RES_CASE_IN;
3931 #endif
3932  ctx->command = NULL; /* trick done_command below */
3933  /* Create the memory for command, roughly:
3934  * ctx->pipe->cmds = new struct command;
3935  * ctx->command = &ctx->pipe->cmds[0];
3936  */
3937  done_command(ctx);
3938  //debug_print_tree(ctx->list_head, 10);
3939  }
3940  debug_printf_parse("done_pipe return\n");
3941 }

4130 
4131  debug_printf_parse("done_word entered: '%s' %p\n", ctx->word.data, command);
4132  if (ctx->word.length == 0 && !ctx->word.has_quoted_part) {
4133  debug_printf_parse("done_word return 0: true null, ignored\n");
4134  return 0;
4135  }
4136 
4137  if (ctx->pending_redirect) {
4138  /* We do not glob in e.g. >*.tmp case. bash seems to glob here
4139  * only if run as "bash", not "sh" */
4140  /* http://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/9699919799/utilities/V3_chap02.html
4141  * "2.7 Redirection
4142  * If the redirection operator is "<<" or "<<-", the word
4143  * that follows the redirection operator shall be
4144  * subjected to quote removal; it is unspecified whether
4145  * any of the other expansions occur. For the other
4146  * redirection operators, the word that follows the
4147  * redirection operator shall be subjected to tilde
4148  * expansion, parameter expansion, command substitution,
4149  * arithmetic expansion, and quote removal.
4150  * Pathname expansion shall not be performed
4151  * on the word by a non-interactive shell; an interactive
4152  * shell may perform it, but shall do so only when
4153  * the expansion would result in one word."
4154  */
4155 //bash does not do parameter/command substitution or arithmetic expansion
4156 //for _heredoc_ redirection word: these constructs look for exact eof marker
4157 // as written:
4158 // <<EOF$t
4159 // <<EOF$((1))
4160 // <<EOF`true` [this case also makes heredoc "quoted", a-la <<"EOF". Probably bash-4.3.43 bug]
4161 
4162  ctx->pending_redirect->rd_filename = xstrdup(ctx->word.data);
4163  /* Cater for >\file case:
4164  * >\a creates file a; >\\a, >"\a", >"\\a" create file \a
4165  * Same with heredocs:
4166  * for <<\H delim is H; <<\\H, <<"\H", <<"\\H" - \H
4167  */
4168  if (ctx->pending_redirect->rd_type == REDIRECT_HEREDOC) {
4169  unbackslash(ctx->pending_redirect->rd_filename);
4170  /* Is it <<"HEREDOC"? */
4171  if (ctx->word.has_quoted_part) {
4172  ctx->pending_redirect->rd_dup |= HEREDOC_QUOTED;
4173  }
4174  }
4175  debug_printf_parse("word stored in rd_filename: '%s'\n", ctx->word.data);
4176  ctx->pending_redirect = NULL;
4177  } else {
4178 #if HAS_KEYWORDS
4179 # if ENABLE_HUSH_CASE
4180  if (ctx->ctx_dsemicolon
4181  && strcmp(ctx->word.data, "esac") != 0 /* not "... pattern) cmd;; esac" */
4182  ) {
4183  /* already done when ctx_dsemicolon was set to 1: */
4184  /* ctx->ctx_res_w = RES_MATCH; */
4185  ctx->ctx_dsemicolon = 0;
4186  } else
4187 # endif
4188 # if defined(CMD_TEST2_SINGLEWORD_NOGLOB)
4189  if (command->cmd_type == CMD_TEST2_SINGLEWORD_NOGLOB
4190  && strcmp(ctx->word.data, "]]") == 0
4191  ) {
4192  /* allow "[[ ]] >file" etc */
4193  command->cmd_type = CMD_SINGLEWORD_NOGLOB;
4194  } else
4195 # endif
4196  if (!command->argv /* if it's the first word... */
4197 # if ENABLE_HUSH_LOOPS
4198  && ctx->ctx_res_w != RES_FOR /* ...not after FOR or IN */
4199  && ctx->ctx_res_w != RES_IN
4200 # endif
4201 # if ENABLE_HUSH_CASE
4202  && ctx->ctx_res_w != RES_CASE
4203 # endif
4204  ) {
4205  const struct reserved_combo *reserved;
4206  reserved = reserved_word(ctx);
4207  debug_printf_parse("checking for reserved-ness: %d\n", !!reserved);
4208  if (reserved) {
4209 # if ENABLE_HUSH_LINENO_VAR
4210 /* Case:
4211  * "while ...; do
4212  * cmd ..."
4213  * If we don't close the pipe _now_, immediately after "do", lineno logic
4214  * sees "cmd" as starting at "do" - i.e., at the previous line.
4215  */
4216  if (0
4217  IF_HUSH_IF(|| reserved->res == RES_THEN)
4218  IF_HUSH_IF(|| reserved->res == RES_ELIF)
4219  IF_HUSH_IF(|| reserved->res == RES_ELSE)
4220  IF_HUSH_LOOPS(|| reserved->res == RES_DO)
4221  ) {
4222  done_pipe(ctx, PIPE_SEQ);
4223  }
4224 # endif
4225  o_reset_to_empty_unquoted(&ctx->word);
4226  debug_printf_parse("done_word return %d\n",
4227  (ctx->ctx_res_w == RES_SNTX));
4228  return (ctx->ctx_res_w == RES_SNTX);
4229  }
4230 # if defined(CMD_TEST2_SINGLEWORD_NOGLOB)
4231  if (strcmp(ctx->word.data, "[[") == 0) {
4232  command->cmd_type = CMD_TEST2_SINGLEWORD_NOGLOB;
4233  } else
4234 # endif
4235 # if defined(CMD_SINGLEWORD_NOGLOB)
4236  if (0
4237  /* In bash, local/export/readonly are special, args
4238  * are assignments and therefore expansion of them
4239  * should be "one-word" expansion:
4240  * $ export i=`echo 'a b'` # one arg: "i=a b"
4241  * compare with:
4242  * $ ls i=`echo 'a b'` # two args: "i=a" and "b"
4243  * ls: cannot access i=a: No such file or directory
4244  * ls: cannot access b: No such file or directory
4245  * Note: bash 3.2.33(1) does this only if export word
4246  * itself is not quoted:
4247  * $ export i=`echo 'aaa bbb'`; echo "$i"
4248  * aaa bbb
4249  * $ "export" i=`echo 'aaa bbb'`; echo "$i"
4250  * aaa
4251  */
4252  IF_HUSH_LOCAL( || strcmp(ctx->word.data, "local") == 0)
4253  IF_HUSH_EXPORT( || strcmp(ctx->word.data, "export") == 0)
4254  IF_HUSH_READONLY(|| strcmp(ctx->word.data, "readonly") == 0)
4255  ) {
4256  command->cmd_type = CMD_SINGLEWORD_NOGLOB;
4257  }
4258 # else
4259  { /* empty block to pair "if ... else" */ }
4260 # endif
4261  }
4262 #endif /* HAS_KEYWORDS */
4263 
4264  if (command->group) {
4265  /* "{ echo foo; } echo bar" - bad */
4266  syntax_error_at(ctx->word.data);
4267  debug_printf_parse("done_word return 1: syntax error, "
4268  "groups and arglists don't mix\n");
4269  return 1;
4270  }
4271 
4272  /* If this word wasn't an assignment, next ones definitely
4273  * can't be assignments. Even if they look like ones. */
4274  if (ctx->is_assignment != DEFINITELY_ASSIGNMENT
4275  && ctx->is_assignment != WORD_IS_KEYWORD
4276  ) {
4277  ctx->is_assignment = NOT_ASSIGNMENT;
4278  } else {
4279  if (ctx->is_assignment == DEFINITELY_ASSIGNMENT) {
4280  command->assignment_cnt++;
4281  debug_printf_parse("++assignment_cnt=%d\n", command->assignment_cnt);
4282  }
4283  debug_printf_parse("ctx->is_assignment was:'%s'\n", assignment_flag[ctx->is_assignment]);
4284  ctx->is_assignment = MAYBE_ASSIGNMENT;
4285  }
4286  debug_printf_parse("ctx->is_assignment='%s'\n", assignment_flag[ctx->is_assignment]);
4287  command->argv = add_string_to_strings(command->argv, xstrdup(ctx->word.data));
4288  debug_print_strings("word appended to argv", command->argv);
4289  }
4290 
4291 #if ENABLE_HUSH_LOOPS
4292  if (ctx->ctx_res_w == RES_FOR) {
4293  if (ctx->word.has_quoted_part
4294  || endofname(command->argv[0])[0] != '\0'
4295  ) {
4296  /* bash says just "not a valid identifier" */
4297  syntax_error("bad variable name in for");
4298  return 1;
4299  }
4300  /* Force FOR to have just one word (variable name) */
4301  /* NB: basically, this makes hush see "for v in ..."
4302  * syntax as if it is "for v; in ...". FOR and IN become
4303  * two pipe structs in parse tree. */
4304  done_pipe(ctx, PIPE_SEQ);
4305  }
4306 #endif
4307 #if ENABLE_HUSH_CASE
4308  /* Force CASE to have just one word */
4309  if (ctx->ctx_res_w == RES_CASE) {
4310  done_pipe(ctx, PIPE_SEQ);
4311  }
4312 #endif
4313 
4314  o_reset_to_empty_unquoted(&ctx->word);
4315 
4316  debug_printf_parse("done_word return 0\n");
4317  return 0;
4318 }

#define strcmp(l, r)

1571  repeat:
1572  newfd = fcntl(fd, F_DUPFD_CLOEXEC, avoid_fd + 1);
1573  if (newfd >= 0) {
1574  if (F_DUPFD_CLOEXEC == F_DUPFD) /* if old libc (w/o F_DUPFD_CLOEXEC) */

1576  } else { /* newfd < 0 */

5336  int next;
5337 
5338  again:
5339  ch = i_getch(input);
5340  if (ch != EOF)
5341  nommu_addchr(as_string, ch);
5342  if (ch == dquote_end) { /* may be only '"' or EOF */
5343  debug_printf_parse("encode_string return 1 (ok)\n");
5344  return 1;
5345  }
5346  /* note: can't move it above ch == dquote_end check! */
5347  if (ch == EOF) {
5348  syntax_error_unterm_ch('"');
5349  return 0; /* error */
5350  }
5351  next = '\0';
5352  if (ch != '\n') {
5353  next = i_peek(input);
5354  }
5355  debug_printf_parse("\" ch=%c (%d) escape=%d\n",
5356  ch, ch, !!(dest->o_expflags & EXP_FLAG_ESC_GLOB_CHARS));
5357  if (ch == '\\') {
5358  if (next == EOF) {
5359  /* Testcase: in interactive shell a file with
5360  * echo "unterminated string<eof>
5361  * is sourced.
5362  */
5363  syntax_error_unterm_ch('"');
5364  return 0; /* error */
5365  }
5366  /* bash:
5367  * "The backslash retains its special meaning [in "..."]
5368  * only when followed by one of the following characters:
5369  * $, `, ", \, or <newline>. A double quote may be quoted
5370  * within double quotes by preceding it with a backslash."
5371  * NB: in (unquoted) heredoc, above does not apply to ",
5372  * therefore we check for it by "next == dquote_end" cond.
5373  */
5374  if (next == dquote_end || strchr("$`\\\n", next)) {
5375  ch = i_getch(input); /* eat next */
5376  if (ch == '\n')
5377  goto again; /* skip <newline> */
5378  } /* else: ch remains == '\\', and we double it below: */
5379  o_addqchr(dest, ch); /* \c if c is a glob char, else just c */
5380  nommu_addchr(as_string, ch);
5381  goto again;
5382  }
5383  if (ch == '$') {
5384  //if (parse_dollar_squote(as_string, dest, input))
5385  // goto again;
5386  if (!parse_dollar(as_string, dest, input, /*quote_mask:*/ 0x80)) {
5387  debug_printf_parse("encode_string return 0: "
5388  "parse_dollar returned 0 (error)\n");
5389  return 0;
5390  }
5391  goto again;
5392  }
5393 #if ENABLE_HUSH_TICK
5394  if (ch == '`') {
5395  //unsigned pos = dest->length;
5396  o_addchr(dest, SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL);
5397  o_addchr(dest, 0x80 | '`');
5398  if (!add_till_backquote(dest, input, /*in_dquote:*/ dquote_end == '"'))
5399  return 0; /* error */
5400  o_addchr(dest, SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL);
5401  //debug_printf_subst("SUBST RES3 '%s'\n", dest->data + pos);
5402  goto again;
5403  }
5404 #endif
5405  o_addQchr(dest, ch);
5406  if (ch == SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL) {
5407  /* Convert "^C" to corresponding special variable reference */
5408  o_addchr(dest, SPECIAL_VAR_QUOTED_SVS);
5409  o_addchr(dest, SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL);
5410  }

6356  * && string has no $IFS chars

6360  * set -- "${notexist-}"; echo $#

6362  output->has_quoted_part = 1;
6363  }
6364  return expand_vars_to_list(output, n, str);

6374  __func__, ch, ch, dest.o_expflags);

6381  * do not assume we are at the start of the word (PREFIX above).

6450  )
6451  ) {
6452  goto ret; /* error */
6453  }
6454  o_addchr(&dest, SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL);
6455  //debug_printf_subst("SUBST RES3 '%s'\n", dest->data + pos);
6456  continue;
6457  }
6458 #endif
6459  if (dquoted) {
6460  /* Always glob-protect if in dquotes:
6461  * x=x; echo "${x:+/bin/c*}" - prints: /bin/c*
6462  * x=x; echo "${x:+"/bin/c*"}" - prints: /bin/c*
6463  */
6464  o_addqchr(&dest, ch);
6465  } else {
6466  /* Glob-protect only if char is quoted:
6467  * x=x; echo ${x:+/bin/c*} - prints many filenames
6468  * x=x; echo ${x:+"/bin/c*"} - prints: /bin/c*
6469  */
6470  o_addQchr(&dest, ch);
6471  }

6199  if (*cp == '\\') break;
6200 #if ENABLE_HUSH_TICK
6201  if (*cp == '`') break;
6202 #endif
6203  cp++;
6204  }
6205 
6206  /* We need to expand. Example:
6207  * echo $(($a + `echo 1`)) $((1 + $((2)) ))
6208  */
6209  setup_string_in_str(&input, str);
6210  encode_string(NULL, &dest, &input, EOF);
6211 //TODO: error check (encode_string returns 0 on error)?
6212  //bb_error_msg("'%s' -> '%s'", str, dest.data);
6213  exp_str = expand_string_to_string(dest.data,
6214  EXP_FLAG_ESC_GLOB_CHARS,
6215  /*unbackslash:*/ 1
6216  );
6217  //bb_error_msg("'%s' -> '%s'", dest.data, exp_str);
6218  o_free(&dest);
6219  return exp_str;
6220 }

static char* encode_then_expand_vararg ( const char *  str,

Definition at line 6253 of file hush.c.

6254 {
6255 #if !BASH_PATTERN_SUBST && ENABLE_HUSH_CASE
6256  const int do_unbackslash = 0;
6257 #endif
6258  char *exp_str;
6259  struct in_str input;
6260  o_string dest = NULL_O_STRING;
6261 
6262  if (!first_special_char_in_vararg(str)) {
6263  /* string has no special chars */
6264  return NULL;
6265  }
6266 
6267  setup_string_in_str(&input, str);
6268  dest.data = xzalloc(1); /* start as "", not as NULL */
6269  exp_str = NULL;
6270 
6271  for (;;) {
6272  int ch;
6273 
6274  ch = i_getch(&input);
6275  debug_printf_parse("%s: ch=%c (%d) escape=%d\n",
6276  __func__, ch, ch, !!dest.o_expflags);
6277 
6278  if (!dest.o_expflags) {
6279  if (ch == EOF)
6280  break;
6281  if (handle_squotes && ch == '\'') {
6282  if (!add_till_single_quote_dquoted(&dest, &input))
6283  goto ret; /* error */
6284  continue;
6285  }
6286  }
6287  if (ch == EOF) {
6288  syntax_error_unterm_ch('"');
6289  goto ret; /* error */
6290  }
6291  if (ch == '"') {
6292  dest.o_expflags ^= EXP_FLAG_ESC_GLOB_CHARS;
6293  continue;
6294  }
6295  if (ch == '\\') {
6296  ch = i_getch(&input);
6297  if (ch == EOF) {
6298 //example? error message? syntax_error_unterm_ch('"');
6299  debug_printf_parse("%s: error: \\<eof>\n", __func__);
6300  goto ret;
6301  }
6302  o_addqchr(&dest, ch);
6303  continue;
6304  }
6305  if (ch == '$') {
6306  if (parse_dollar_squote(NULL, &dest, &input))
6307  continue;
6308  if (!parse_dollar(NULL, &dest, &input, /*quote_mask:*/ 0x80)) {
6309  debug_printf_parse("%s: error: parse_dollar returned 0 (error)\n", __func__);
6310  goto ret;
6311  }
6312  continue;
6313  }
6314 #if ENABLE_HUSH_TICK
6315  if (ch == '`') {
6316  //unsigned pos = dest->length;
6317  o_addchr(&dest, SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL);
6318  o_addchr(&dest, 0x80 | '`');
6319  if (!add_till_backquote(&dest, &input,
6320  /*in_dquote:*/ dest.o_expflags /* nonzero if EXP_FLAG_ESC_GLOB_CHARS set */
6321  )
6322  ) {
6323  goto ret; /* error */
6324  }
6325  o_addchr(&dest, SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL);
6326  //debug_printf_subst("SUBST RES3 '%s'\n", dest->data + pos);
6327  continue;
6328  }
6329 #endif
6330  o_addQchr(&dest, ch);
6331  } /* for (;;) */
6332 
6333  debug_printf_parse("encode: '%s' -> '%s'\n", str, dest.data);
6334  exp_str = expand_string_to_string(dest.data,
6335  do_unbackslash ? EXP_FLAG_ESC_GLOB_CHARS : 0,
6336  do_unbackslash
6337  );
6338  ret:
6339  debug_printf_parse("expand: '%s' -> '%s'\n", dest.data, exp_str);
6340  o_free(&dest);
6341  return exp_str;
6342 }

8238 {
8239  G.var_nest_level++;
8240  debug_printf_env("var_nest_level++ %u\n", G.var_nest_level);
8241 
8242  /* Try: f() { echo -n .; f; }; f
8243  * struct variable::var_nest_level is uint16_t,
8244  * thus limiting recursion to < 2^16.
8245  * In any case, with 8 Mbyte stack SEGV happens
8246  * not too long after 2^16 recursions anyway.
8247  */
8248  if (G.var_nest_level > 0xff00)
8249  bb_error_msg_and_die("fatal recursion (depth %u)", G.var_nest_level);

◆ expand_on_ifs()

static int expand_on_ifs ( o_string *  output,
int  n,
const char *  str 
)
static

Definition at line 6109 of file hush.c.

6110 {
6111  int last_is_ifs = 0;
6112 
6113  while (1) {
6114  int word_len;
6115 
6116  if (!*str) /* EOL - do not finalize word */
6117  break;
6118  word_len = strcspn(str, G.ifs);
6119  if (word_len) {
6120  /* We have WORD_LEN leading non-IFS chars */
6121  if (!(output->o_expflags & EXP_FLAG_GLOB)) {
6122  o_addblock(output, str, word_len);
6123  } else {
6124  /* Protect backslashes against globbing up :)
6125  * Example: "v='\*'; echo b$v" prints "b\*"
6126  * (and does not try to glob on "*")
6127  */
6128  o_addblock_duplicate_backslash(output, str, word_len);
6129  /*/ Why can't we do it easier? */
6130  /*o_addblock(output, str, word_len); - WRONG: "v='\*'; echo Z$v" prints "Z*" instead of "Z\*" */
6131  /*o_addqblock(output, str, word_len); - WRONG: "v='*'; echo Z$v" prints "Z*" instead of Z* files */
6132  }
6133  last_is_ifs = 0;
6134  str += word_len;
6135  if (!*str) /* EOL - do not finalize word */
6136  break;
6137  }
6138 
6139  /* We know str here points to at least one IFS char */
6140  last_is_ifs = 1;
6141  str += strspn(str, G.ifs_whitespace); /* skip IFS whitespace chars */
6142  if (!*str) /* EOL - do not finalize word */
6143  break;
6144 
6145  if (G.ifs_whitespace != G.ifs /* usually false ($IFS is usually all whitespace), */
6146  && strchr(G.ifs, *str) /* the second check would fail */
6147  ) {
6148  /* This is a non-whitespace $IFS char */
6149  /* Skip it and IFS whitespace chars, start new word */
6150  str++;
6151  str += strspn(str, G.ifs_whitespace);
6152  goto new_word;
6153  }
6154 
6155  /* Start new word... but not always! */
6156  /* Case "v=' a'; echo ''$v": we do need to finalize empty word: */
6157  if (output->has_quoted_part
6158  /*
6159  * Case "v=' a'; echo $v":
6160  * here nothing precedes the space in $v expansion,
6161  * therefore we should not finish the word
6162  * (IOW: if there *is* word to finalize, only then do it):
6163  * It's okay if this accesses the byte before first argv[]:
6164  * past call to o_save_ptr() cleared it to zero byte
6165  * (grep for -prev-ifs-check-).
6166  */
6167  || output->data[output->length - 1]
6168  ) {
6169  new_word:
6170  o_addchr(output, '\0');
6171  debug_print_list("expand_on_ifs", output, n);
6172  n = o_save_ptr(output, n);
6173  }
6174  }
6175 
6176  output->ended_in_ifs = last_is_ifs;
6177  debug_print_list("expand_on_ifs[1]", output, n);
6178  return n;
6179 }

◆ expand_one_var()

static NOINLINE int expand_one_var ( o_string *  output,
int  n,
int  first_ch,
char *  arg,
char **  pp 
)
static

Definition at line 6596 of file hush.c.

6598 {
6599  const char *val;
6600  char *to_be_freed;
6601  char *p;
6602  char *var;
6603  char exp_op;
6604  char exp_save = exp_save; /* for compiler */
6605  char *exp_saveptr; /* points to expansion operator */
6606  char *exp_word = exp_word; /* for compiler */
6607  char arg0;
6608 
6609  val = NULL;
6610  to_be_freed = NULL;
6611  p = *pp;
6612  *p = '\0'; /* replace trailing SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL */
6613  var = arg;
6614  exp_saveptr = arg[1] ? strchr(VAR_ENCODED_SUBST_OPS, arg[1]) : NULL;
6615  arg0 = arg[0];
6616  arg[0] = (arg0 & 0x7f);
6617  exp_op = 0;
6618 
6619  if (arg[0] == '#' && arg[1] /* ${#...} but not ${#} */
6620  && (!exp_saveptr /* and ( not(${#<op_char>...}) */
6621  || (arg[2] == '\0' && strchr(SPECIAL_VARS_STR, arg[1])) /* or ${#C} "len of $C" ) */
6622  ) /* NB: skipping ^^^specvar check mishandles ${#::2} */
6623  ) {
6624  /* It must be length operator: ${#var} */
6625  var++;
6626  exp_op = 'L';
6627  } else {
6628  /* Maybe handle parameter expansion */
6629  if (exp_saveptr /* if 2nd char is one of expansion operators */
6630  && strchr(NUMERIC_SPECVARS_STR, arg[0]) /* 1st char is special variable */
6631  ) {
6632  /* ${?:0}, ${#[:]%0} etc */
6633  exp_saveptr = var + 1;
6634  } else {
6635  /* ${?}, ${var}, ${var:0}, ${var[:]%0} etc */
6636  exp_saveptr = var+1 + strcspn(var+1, VAR_ENCODED_SUBST_OPS);
6637  }
6638  exp_op = exp_save = *exp_saveptr;
6639  if (exp_op) {
6640  exp_word = exp_saveptr + 1;
6641  if (exp_op == ':') {
6642  exp_op = *exp_word++;
6643 //TODO: try ${var:} and ${var:bogus} in non-bash config
6644  if (BASH_SUBSTR
6645  && (!exp_op || !strchr(MINUS_PLUS_EQUAL_QUESTION, exp_op))
6646  ) {
6647  /* oops... it's ${var:N[:M]}, not ${var:?xxx} or some such */
6648  exp_op = ':';
6649  exp_word--;
6650  }
6651  }
6652  *exp_saveptr = '\0';
6653  } /* else: it's not an expansion op, but bare ${var} */
6654  }
6655 
6656  /* Look up the variable in question */
6657  if (isdigit(var[0])) {
6658  /* parse_dollar should have vetted var for us */
6659  int nn = xatoi_positive(var);
6660  if (nn < G.global_argc)
6661  val = G.global_argv[nn];
6662  /* else val remains NULL: $N with too big N */
6663  } else {
6664  switch (var[0]) {
6665  case '$': /* pid */
6666  val = utoa(G.root_pid);
6667  break;
6668  case '!': /* bg pid */
6669  val = G.last_bg_pid ? utoa(G.last_bg_pid) : "";
6670  break;
6671  case '?': /* exitcode */
6672  val = utoa(G.last_exitcode);
6673  break;
6674  case '#': /* argc */
6675  val = utoa(G.global_argc ? G.global_argc-1 : 0);
6676  break;
6677  case '-': { /* active options */
6678  /* Check set_mode() to see what option chars we support */
6679  char *cp;
6680  val = cp = G.optstring_buf;
6681  if (G.o_opt[OPT_O_ERREXIT])
6682  *cp++ = 'e';
6683  if (G_interactive_fd)
6684  *cp++ = 'i';
6685  if (G_x_mode)
6686  *cp++ = 'x';
6687  /* If G.o_opt[OPT_O_NOEXEC] is true,
6688  * commands read but are not executed,
6689  * so $- can not execute too, 'n' is never seen in $-.
6690  */
6691  if (G.opt_c)
6692  *cp++ = 'c';
6693  if (G.opt_s)
6694  *cp++ = 's';
6695  *cp = '\0';
6696  break;
6697  }
6698  default:
6699  val = get_local_var_value(var);
6700  }
6701  }
6702 
6703  /* Handle any expansions */
6704  if (exp_op == 'L') {
6705  reinit_unicode_for_hush();
6706  debug_printf_expand("expand: length(%s)=", val);
6707  val = utoa(val ? unicode_strlen(val) : 0);
6708  debug_printf_expand("%s\n", val);
6709  } else if (exp_op) {
6710  if (exp_op == '%' || exp_op == '#') {
6711  /* Standard-mandated substring removal ops:
6712  * ${parameter%word} - remove smallest suffix pattern
6713  * ${parameter%%word} - remove largest suffix pattern
6714  * ${parameter#word} - remove smallest prefix pattern
6715  * ${parameter##word} - remove largest prefix pattern
6716  *
6717  * Word is expanded to produce a glob pattern.
6718  * Then var's value is matched to it and matching part removed.
6719  */
6720  /* bash compat: if x is "" and no shrinking of it is possible,
6721  * inner ${...} is not evaluated. Example:
6722  * unset b; : ${a%${b=B}}; echo $b
6723  * assignment b=B only happens if $a is not "".
6724  */
6725  if (val && val[0]) {
6726  char *t;
6727  char *exp_exp_word;
6728  char *loc;
6729  unsigned scan_flags = pick_scan(exp_op, *exp_word);
6730  if (exp_op == *exp_word) /* ## or %% */
6731  exp_word++;
6732  debug_printf_expand("expand: exp_word:'%s'\n", exp_word);
6733  exp_exp_word = encode_then_expand_vararg(exp_word, /*handle_squotes:*/ 1, /*unbackslash:*/ 0);
6734  if (exp_exp_word)
6735  exp_word = exp_exp_word;
6736  debug_printf_expand("expand: exp_word:'%s'\n", exp_word);
6737  /*
6738  * HACK ALERT. We depend here on the fact that
6739  * G.global_argv and results of utoa and get_local_var_value
6740  * are actually in writable memory:
6741  * scan_and_match momentarily stores NULs there.
6742  */
6743  t = (char*)val;
6744  loc = scan_and_match(t, exp_word, scan_flags);
6745  debug_printf_expand("op:%c str:'%s' pat:'%s' res:'%s'\n", exp_op, t, exp_word, loc);
6746  free(exp_exp_word);
6747  if (loc) { /* match was found */
6748  if (scan_flags & SCAN_MATCH_LEFT_HALF) /* #[#] */
6749  val = loc; /* take right part */
6750  else /* %[%] */
6751  val = to_be_freed = xstrndup(val, loc - val); /* left */
6752  }
6753  }
6754  }
6755 #if BASH_PATTERN_SUBST
6756  else if (exp_op == '/' || exp_op == '\\') {
6757  /* It's ${var/[/]pattern[/repl]} thing.
6758  * Note that in encoded form it has TWO parts:
6759  * var/pattern<SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL>repl<SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL>
6760  * and if // is used, it is encoded as \:
6761  * var\pattern<SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL>repl<SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL>
6762  */
6763  /* bash compat: if var is "", both pattern and repl
6764  * are still evaluated, if it is unset, then not:
6765  * unset b; a=; : ${a/z/${b=3}}; echo $b # b=3
6766  * unset b; unset a; : ${a/z/${b=3}}; echo $b # b not set
6767  */
6768  if (val /*&& val[0]*/) {
6769  /* pattern uses non-standard expansion.
6770  * repl should be unbackslashed and globbed
6771  * by the usual expansion rules:
6772  * >az >bz
6773  * v='a bz'; echo "${v/a*z/a*z}" #prints "a*z"
6774  * v='a bz'; echo "${v/a*z/\z}" #prints "z"
6775  * v='a bz'; echo ${v/a*z/a*z} #prints "az"
6776  * v='a bz'; echo ${v/a*z/\z} #prints "z"
6777  * (note that a*z _pattern_ is never globbed!)
6778  */
6779  char *pattern, *repl, *t;
6780  pattern = encode_then_expand_vararg(exp_word, /*handle_squotes:*/ 1, /*unbackslash:*/ 0);
6781  if (!pattern)
6782  pattern = xstrdup(exp_word);
6783  debug_printf_varexp("pattern:'%s'->'%s'\n", exp_word, pattern);
6784  *p++ = SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL;
6785  exp_word = p;
6786  p = strchr(p, SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL);
6787  *p = '\0';
6788  repl = encode_then_expand_vararg(exp_word, /*handle_squotes:*/ 1, /*unbackslash:*/ 1);
6789  debug_printf_varexp("repl:'%s'->'%s'\n", exp_word, repl);
6790  /* HACK ALERT. We depend here on the fact that
6791  * G.global_argv and results of utoa and get_local_var_value
6792  * are actually in writable memory:
6793  * replace_pattern momentarily stores NULs there. */
6794  t = (char*)val;
6795  to_be_freed = replace_pattern(t,
6796  pattern,
6797  (repl ? repl : exp_word),
6798  exp_op);
6799  if (to_be_freed) /* at least one replace happened */
6800  val = to_be_freed;
6801  free(pattern);
6802  free(repl);
6803  } else {
6804  /* Unset variable always gives nothing */
6805  // a=; echo ${a/*/w} # "w"
6806  // unset a; echo ${a/*/w} # ""
6807  /* Just skip "replace" part */
6808  *p++ = SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL;
6809  p = strchr(p, SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL);
6810  *p = '\0';
6811  }
6812  }
6813 #endif /* BASH_PATTERN_SUBST */
6814  else if (exp_op == ':') {
6815 #if BASH_SUBSTR && ENABLE_FEATURE_SH_MATH
6816  /* It's ${var:N[:M]} bashism.
6817  * Note that in encoded form it has TWO parts:
6818  * var:N<SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL>M<SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL>
6819  */
6820  arith_t beg, len;
6821  unsigned vallen;
6822  const char *errmsg;
6823 
6824  beg = expand_and_evaluate_arith(exp_word, &errmsg);
6825  if (errmsg)
6826  goto empty_result;
6827  debug_printf_varexp("beg:'%s'=%lld\n", exp_word, (long long)beg);
6828  *p++ = SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL;
6829  exp_word = p;
6830  p = strchr(p, SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL);
6831  *p = '\0';
6832  vallen = val ? strlen(val) : 0;
6833  if (beg < 0) {
6834  /* negative beg counts from the end */
6835  beg = (arith_t)vallen + beg;
6836  }
6837  /* If expansion will be empty, do not even evaluate len */
6838  if (!val || beg < 0 || beg > vallen) {
6839  /* Why > vallen, not >=? bash:
6840  * unset b; a=ab; : ${a:2:${b=3}}; echo $b # "", b=3 (!!!)
6841  * unset b; a=a; : ${a:2:${b=3}}; echo $b # "", b not set
6842  */
6843  goto empty_result;
6844  }
6845  len = expand_and_evaluate_arith(exp_word, &errmsg);
6846  if (errmsg)
6847  goto empty_result;
6848  debug_printf_varexp("len:'%s'=%lld\n", exp_word, (long long)len);
6849  debug_printf_varexp("from val:'%s'\n", val);
6850  if (len < 0) {
6851  /* in bash, len=-n means strlen()-n */
6852  len = (arith_t)vallen - beg + len;
6853  if (len < 0) /* bash compat */
6854  msg_and_die_if_script("%s: substring expression < 0", var);
6855  }
6856  if (len <= 0 || !val /*|| beg >= vallen*/) {
6857  empty_result:
6858  val = NULL;
6859  } else {
6860  /* Paranoia. What if user entered 9999999999999
6861  * which fits in arith_t but not int? */
6862  if (len > INT_MAX)
6863  len = INT_MAX;
6864  val = to_be_freed = xstrndup(val + beg, len);
6865  }
6866  debug_printf_varexp("val:'%s'\n", val);
6867 #else /* not (HUSH_SUBSTR_EXPANSION && FEATURE_SH_MATH) */
6868  msg_and_die_if_script("malformed ${%s:...}", var);
6869  val = NULL;
6870 #endif
6871  } else { /* one of "-=+?" */
6872  /* Standard-mandated substitution ops:
6873  * ${var?word} - indicate error if unset
6874  * If var is unset, word (or a message indicating it is unset
6875  * if word is null) is written to standard error
6876  * and the shell exits with a non-zero exit status.
6877  * Otherwise, the value of var is substituted.
6878  * ${var-word} - use default value
6879  * If var is unset, word is substituted.
6880  * ${var=word} - assign and use default value
6881  * If var is unset, word is assigned to var.
6882  * In all cases, final value of var is substituted.
6883  * ${var+word} - use alternative value
6884  * If var is unset, null is substituted.
6885  * Otherwise, word is substituted.
6886  *
6887  * Word is subjected to tilde expansion, parameter expansion,
6888  * command substitution, and arithmetic expansion.
6889  * If word is not needed, it is not expanded.
6890  *
6891  * Colon forms (${var:-word}, ${var:=word} etc) do the same,
6892  * but also treat null var as if it is unset.
6893  *
6894  * Word-splitting and single quote behavior:
6895  *
6896  * $ f() { for i; do echo "|$i|"; done; }
6897  *
6898  * $ x=; f ${x:?'x y' z}; echo $?
6899  * bash: x: x y z # neither f nor "echo $?" executes
6900  * (if interactive, bash does not exit, but merely aborts to prompt. $? is set to 1)
6901  * $ x=; f "${x:?'x y' z}"
6902  * bash: x: x y z # dash prints: dash: x: 'x y' z
6903  *
6904  * $ x=; f ${x:='x y' z}
6905  * |x|
6906  * |y|
6907  * |z|
6908  * $ x=; f "${x:='x y' z}"
6909  * |'x y' z|
6910  *
6911  * $ x=x; f ${x:+'x y' z}
6912  * |x y|
6913  * |z|
6914  * $ x=x; f "${x:+'x y' z}"
6915  * |'x y' z|
6916  *
6917  * $ x=; f ${x:-'x y' z}
6918  * |x y|
6919  * |z|
6920  * $ x=; f "${x:-'x y' z}"
6921  * |'x y' z|
6922  */
6923  int use_word = (!val || ((exp_save == ':') && !val[0]));
6924  if (exp_op == '+')
6925  use_word = !use_word;
6926  debug_printf_expand("expand: op:%c (null:%s) test:%i\n", exp_op,
6927  (exp_save == ':') ? "true" : "false", use_word);
6928  if (use_word) {
6929  if (exp_op == '+' || exp_op == '-') {
6930  /* ${var+word} - use alternative value */
6931  /* ${var-word} - use default value */
6932  n = encode_then_append_var_plusminus(output, n, exp_word,
6933  /*dquoted:*/ (arg0 & 0x80)
6934  );
6935  val = NULL;
6936  } else {
6937  /* ${var?word} - indicate error if unset */
6938  /* ${var=word} - assign and use default value */
6939  to_be_freed = encode_then_expand_vararg(exp_word,
6940  /*handle_squotes:*/ !(arg0 & 0x80),
6941  /*unbackslash:*/ 0
6942  );
6943  if (to_be_freed)
6944  exp_word = to_be_freed;
6945  if (exp_op == '?') {
6946  /* mimic bash message */
6947  msg_and_die_if_script("%s: %s",
6948  var,
6949  exp_word[0]
6950  ? exp_word
6951  : "parameter null or not set"
6952  /* ash has more specific messages, a-la: */
6953  /*: (exp_save == ':' ? "parameter null or not set" : "parameter not set")*/
6954  );
6955 //TODO: how interactive bash aborts expansion mid-command?
6956 //It aborts the entire line, returns to prompt:
6957 // $ f() { for i; do echo "|$i|"; done; }; x=; f "${x:?'x y' z}"; echo YO
6958 // bash: x: x y z
6959 // $
6960 // ("echo YO" is not executed, neither the f function call)
6961  } else {
6962  val = exp_word;
6963  }
6964  if (exp_op == '=') {
6965  /* ${var=[word]} or ${var:=[word]} */
6966  if (isdigit(var[0]) || var[0] == '#') {
6967  /* mimic bash message */
6968  msg_and_die_if_script("$%s: cannot assign in this way", var);
6969  val = NULL;
6970  } else {
6971  char *new_var = xasprintf("%s=%s", var, val);
6972  set_local_var0(new_var);
6973  }
6974  }
6975  }
6976  }
6977  } /* one of "-=+?" */
6978 
6979  *exp_saveptr = exp_save;
6980  } /* if (exp_op) */
6981 
6982  arg[0] = arg0;
6983  *pp = p;
6984 
6985  n = append_str_maybe_ifs_split(output, n, first_ch, val);
6986 
6987  free(to_be_freed);
6988  return n;
6989 }
arg0

7234  const int EXP_flags = EXP_FLAG_ESC_GLOB_CHARS;
7235 #endif
7236  char *argv[2], **list;
7237 
7238  debug_printf_expand("string_to_string<='%s'\n", str);
7239  /* This is generally an optimization, but it also
7240  * handles "", which otherwise trips over !list[0] check below.
7241  * (is this ever happens that we actually get str="" here?)
7242  */
7243  if (!strchr(str, SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL) && !strchr(str, '\\')) {
7244  //TODO: Can use on strings with \ too, just unbackslash() them?
7245  debug_printf_expand("string_to_string(fast)=>'%s'\n", str);
7246  return xstrdup(str);

7265  }

7183 {
7184  int n;
7185  char **list;
7186  o_string output = NULL_O_STRING;
7187 
7188  output.o_expflags = expflags;
7189 
7190  n = 0;
7191  for (;;) {
7192  /* go to next list[n] */
7193  output.ended_in_ifs = 0;
7194  n = o_save_ptr(&output, n);
7195 
7196  if (!*argv)
7197  break;

◆ expand_vars_to_list()

static NOINLINE int expand_vars_to_list ( o_string *  output,
int  n,
char *  arg 
)
static

Definition at line 6996 of file hush.c.

6997 {
6998  /* output->o_expflags & EXP_FLAG_SINGLEWORD (0x80) if we are in
6999  * expansion of right-hand side of assignment == 1-element expand.
7000  */
7001  char cant_be_null = 0; /* only bit 0x80 matters */
7002  char *p;
7003 
7004  debug_printf_expand("expand_vars_to_list: arg:'%s' singleword:%x\n", arg,
7005  !!(output->o_expflags & EXP_FLAG_SINGLEWORD));
7006  debug_print_list("expand_vars_to_list[0]", output, n);
7007 
7008  while ((p = strchr(arg, SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL)) != NULL) {
7009  char first_ch;
7010 #if ENABLE_FEATURE_SH_MATH
7011  char arith_buf[sizeof(arith_t)*3 + 2];
7012 #endif
7013 
7014  if (output->ended_in_ifs) {
7015  o_addchr(output, '\0');
7016  n = o_save_ptr(output, n);
7017  output->ended_in_ifs = 0;
7018  }
7019 
7020  o_addblock(output, arg, p - arg);
7021  debug_print_list("expand_vars_to_list[1]", output, n);
7022  arg = ++p;
7023  p = strchr(p, SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL);
7024 
7025  /* Fetch special var name (if it is indeed one of them)
7026  * and quote bit, force the bit on if singleword expansion -
7027  * important for not getting v=$@ expand to many words. */
7028  first_ch = arg[0] | (output->o_expflags & EXP_FLAG_SINGLEWORD);
7029 
7030  /* Is this variable quoted and thus expansion can't be null?
7031  * "$@" is special. Even if quoted, it can still
7032  * expand to nothing (not even an empty string),
7033  * thus it is excluded. */
7034  if ((first_ch & 0x7f) != '@')
7035  cant_be_null |= first_ch;
7036 
7037  switch (first_ch & 0x7f) {
7038  /* Highest bit in first_ch indicates that var is double-quoted */
7039  case '*':
7040  case '@': {
7041  int i;
7042  if (!G.global_argv[1])
7043  break;
7044  i = 1;
7045  cant_be_null |= first_ch; /* do it for "$@" _now_, when we know it's not empty */
7046  if (!(first_ch & 0x80)) { /* unquoted $* or $@ */
7047  while (G.global_argv[i]) {
7048  n = expand_on_ifs(output, n, G.global_argv[i]);
7049  debug_printf_expand("expand_vars_to_list: argv %d (last %d)\n", i, G.global_argc - 1);
7050  if (G.global_argv[i++][0] && G.global_argv[i]) {
7051  /* this argv[] is not empty and not last:
7052  * put terminating NUL, start new word */
7053  o_addchr(output, '\0');
7054  debug_print_list("expand_vars_to_list[2]", output, n);
7055  n = o_save_ptr(output, n);
7056  debug_print_list("expand_vars_to_list[3]", output, n);
7057  }
7058  }
7059  } else
7060  /* If EXP_FLAG_SINGLEWORD, we handle assignment 'a=....$@.....'
7061  * and in this case should treat it like '$*' - see 'else...' below */
7062  if (first_ch == (char)('@'|0x80) /* quoted $@ */
7063  && !(output->o_expflags & EXP_FLAG_SINGLEWORD) /* not v="$@" case */
7064  ) {
7065  while (1) {
7066  o_addQstr(output, G.global_argv[i]);
7067  if (++i >= G.global_argc)
7068  break;
7069  o_addchr(output, '\0');
7070  debug_print_list("expand_vars_to_list[4]", output, n);
7071  n = o_save_ptr(output, n);
7072  }
7073  } else { /* quoted $* (or v="$@" case): add as one word */
7074  while (1) {
7075  o_addQstr(output, G.global_argv[i]);
7076  if (!G.global_argv[++i])
7077  break;
7078  if (G.ifs[0])
7079  o_addchr(output, G.ifs[0]);
7080  }
7081  output->has_quoted_part = 1;
7082  }
7083  break;
7084  }
7085  case SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL: {
7086  /* <SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL><SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL> */
7087  /* "Empty variable", used to make "" etc to not disappear */
7088  output->has_quoted_part = 1;
7089  cant_be_null = 0x80;
7090  arg++;
7091  break;
7092  }
7093  case SPECIAL_VAR_QUOTED_SVS:
7094  /* <SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL><SPECIAL_VAR_QUOTED_SVS><SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL> */
7095  /* "^C variable", represents literal ^C char (possible in scripts) */
7096  o_addchr(output, SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL);
7097  arg++;
7098  break;
7099 #if ENABLE_HUSH_TICK
7100  case '`': {
7101  /* <SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL>`cmd<SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL> */
7102  o_string subst_result = NULL_O_STRING;
7103 
7104  *p = '\0'; /* replace trailing <SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL> */
7105  arg++;
7106  /* Can't just stuff it into output o_string,
7107  * expanded result may need to be globbed
7108  * and $IFS-split */
7109  debug_printf_subst("SUBST '%s' first_ch %x\n", arg, first_ch);
7110  G.last_exitcode = process_command_subs(&subst_result, arg);
7111  G.expand_exitcode = G.last_exitcode;
7112  debug_printf_subst("SUBST RES:%d '%s'\n", G.last_exitcode, subst_result.data);
7113  n = append_str_maybe_ifs_split(output, n, first_ch, subst_result.data);
7114  o_free(&subst_result);
7115  break;
7116  }
7117 #endif
7118 #if ENABLE_FEATURE_SH_MATH
7119  case '+': {
7120  /* <SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL>+arith<SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL> */
7121  arith_t res;
7122 
7123  arg++; /* skip '+' */
7124  *p = '\0'; /* replace trailing <SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL> */
7125  debug_printf_subst("ARITH '%s' first_ch %x\n", arg, first_ch);
7126  res = expand_and_evaluate_arith(arg, NULL);
7127  debug_printf_subst("ARITH RES '"ARITH_FMT"'\n", res);
7128  sprintf(arith_buf, ARITH_FMT, res);
7129  if (res < 0
7130  && first_ch == (char)('+'|0x80)
7131  /* && (output->o_expflags & EXP_FLAG_ESC_GLOB_CHARS) */
7132  ) {
7133  /* Quoted negative ariths, like filename[0"$((-9))"],
7134  * should not be interpreted as glob ranges.
7135  * Convert leading '-' to '\-':
7136  */
7137  o_grow_by(output, 1);
7138  output->data[output->length++] = '\\';
7139  }
7140  o_addstr(output, arith_buf);
7141  break;
7142  }
7143 #endif
7144  default:
7145  /* <SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL>varname[ops]<SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL> */
7146  n = expand_one_var(output, n, first_ch, arg, &p);
7147  break;
7148  } /* switch (char after <SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL>) */
7149 
7150  /* Restore NULL'ed SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL.
7151  * Do the check to avoid writing to a const string. */
7152  if (*p != SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL)
7153  *p = SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL;
7154  arg = ++p;
7155  } /* end of "while (SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL is found) ..." */
7156 
7157  if (*arg) {
7158  /* handle trailing string */
7159  if (output->ended_in_ifs) {
7160  o_addchr(output, '\0');
7161  n = o_save_ptr(output, n);
7162  }
7163  debug_print_list("expand_vars_to_list[a]", output, n);
7164  /* this part is literal, and it was already pre-quoted
7165  * if needed (much earlier), do not use o_addQstr here!
7166  */
7167  o_addstr(output, arg);
7168  debug_print_list("expand_vars_to_list[b]", output, n);
7169  } else
7170  if (output->length == o_get_last_ptr(output, n) /* expansion is empty */
7171  && !(cant_be_null & 0x80) /* and all vars were not quoted */
7172  && !output->has_quoted_part
7173  ) {
7174  n--;
7175  /* allow to reuse list[n] later without re-growth */
7176  output->has_empty_slot = 1;
7177  }
7178 
7179  return n;
7180 }

◆ fetch_till_str()

static char* fetch_till_str ( o_string *  as_string,
struct in_str *  input,
const char *  word,
int  heredoc_flags 
)
static

Definition at line 4478 of file hush.c.

4482 {
4483  o_string heredoc = NULL_O_STRING;
4484  unsigned past_EOL;
4485  int prev = 0; /* not \ */
4486  int ch;
4487 
4488  /* Starting with "" is necessary for this case:
4489  * cat <<EOF
4490  *
4491  * xxx
4492  * EOF
4493  */
4494  heredoc.data = xzalloc(1); /* start as "", not as NULL */
4495 
4496  goto jump_in;
4497 
4498  while (1) {
4499  ch = i_getch(input);
4500  if (ch != EOF)
4501  nommu_addchr(as_string, ch);
4502  if (ch == '\n' || ch == EOF) {
4503  check_heredoc_end:
4504  if ((heredoc_flags & HEREDOC_QUOTED) || prev != '\\') {
4505  /* End-of-line, and not a line continuation */
4506  if (strcmp(heredoc.data + past_EOL, word) == 0) {
4507  heredoc.data[past_EOL] = '\0';
4508  debug_printf_heredoc("parsed '%s' heredoc '%s'\n", word, heredoc.data);
4509  return heredoc.data;
4510  }
4511  if (ch == '\n') {
4512  /* This is a new line.
4513  * Remember position and backslash-escaping status.
4514  */
4515  o_addchr(&heredoc, ch);
4516  prev = ch;
4517  jump_in:
4518  past_EOL = heredoc.length;
4519  /* Get 1st char of next line, possibly skipping leading tabs */
4520  do {
4521  ch = i_getch(input);
4522  if (ch != EOF)
4523  nommu_addchr(as_string, ch);
4524  } while ((heredoc_flags & HEREDOC_SKIPTABS) && ch == '\t');
4525  /* If this immediately ended the line,
4526  * go back to end-of-line checks.
4527  */
4528  if (ch == '\n')
4529  goto check_heredoc_end;
4530  }
4531  } else {
4532  /* Backslash-line continuation in an unquoted
4533  * heredoc. This does not need special handling
4534  * for heredoc body (unquoted heredocs are
4535  * expanded on "execution" and that would take
4536  * care of this case too), but not the case
4537  * of line continuation *in terminator*:
4538  * cat <<EOF
4539  * Ok1
4540  * EO\
4541  * F
4542  */
4543  heredoc.data[--heredoc.length] = '\0';
4544  prev = 0; /* not '\' */
4545  continue;
4546  }
4547  }
4548  if (ch == EOF) {
4549  o_free(&heredoc);
4550  return NULL; /* error */
4551  }
4552  o_addchr(&heredoc, ch);
4553  nommu_addchr(as_string, ch);
4554  if (prev == '\\' && ch == '\\')
4555  /* Correctly handle foo\<eol> (not a line cont.) */
4556  prev = 0; /* not '\' */
4557  else
4558  prev = ch;
4559  }
4560 }
heredoc
Definition: ash.c:11761

10279  if (value) { /* paranoia */

10289  debug_printf_env("putenv '%s'\n", shell_ver->varstr);
10290  putenv(shell_ver->varstr);

10292  /* Export PWD */
10293  set_pwd_var(SETFLAG_EXPORT);
10294 
10295 #if BASH_HOSTNAME_VAR
10296  /* Set (but not export) HOSTNAME unless already set */
10297  if (!get_local_var_value("HOSTNAME")) {
10298  struct utsname uts;
10299  uname(&uts);
10300  set_local_var_from_halves("HOSTNAME", uts.nodename);
10301  }
10302 #endif
10303  /* IFS is not inherited from the parent environment */
10304  set_local_var_from_halves("IFS", defifs);
10305 
10306  if (!get_local_var_value("PATH"))
10307  set_local_var_from_halves("PATH", bb_default_root_path);
10308 
10309  /* PS1/PS2 are set later, if we determine that we are interactive */
10310 
10311  /* bash also exports SHLVL and _,
10312  * and sets (but doesn't export) the following variables:
10313  * BASH=/bin/bash
10314  * BASH_VERSINFO=([0]="3" [1]="2" [2]="0" [3]="1" [4]="release" [5]="i386-pc-linux-gnu")
10315  * BASH_VERSION='3.2.0(1)-release'
10316  * HOSTTYPE=i386
10317  * MACHTYPE=i386-pc-linux-gnu
10318  * OSTYPE=linux-gnu
10319  * PPID=<NNNNN> - we also do it elsewhere
10320  * EUID=<NNNNN>

10334  * MAILCHECK=60
10335  * PATH=/usr/gnu/bin:/usr/local/bin:/bin:/usr/bin:.
10336  * SHELL=/bin/bash

10338  * TERM=dumb
10339  * OPTERR=1
10340  * OPTIND=1
10341  * PS4='+ '
10342  */
10343 
10344 #if NUM_SCRIPTS > 0
10345  if (argc < 0) {
10346  char *script = get_script_content(-argc - 1);
10347  G.global_argv = argv;
10348  G.global_argc = string_array_len(argv);
10349  //install_special_sighandlers(); - needed?
10350  parse_and_run_string(script);
10351  goto final_return;
10352  }
10353 #endif
10354 
10355  /* Initialize some more globals to non-zero values */
10356  die_func = restore_ttypgrp_and__exit;
10357 
10358  /* Shell is non-interactive at first. We need to call
10359  * install_special_sighandlers() if we are going to execute "sh <script>",
10360  * "sh -c <cmds>" or login shell's /etc/profile and friends.
10361  * If we later decide that we are interactive, we run install_special_sighandlers()
10362  * in order to intercept (more) signals.
10363  */
10364 
10365  /* Parse options */
10366  /* http://www.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/9699919799/utilities/sh.html */
10367  flags = (argv[0] && argv[0][0] == '-') ? OPT_login : 0;
10368  while (1) {
10369  int opt = getopt(argc, argv, "+" /* stop at 1st non-option */
10370  "cexinsl"
10371 #if !BB_MMU
10372  "<:$:R:V:"
10373 # if ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
10374  "F:"
10375 # endif
10376 #endif
10377  );
10378  if (opt <= 0)
10379  break;
10380  switch (opt) {
10381  case 'c':
10382  /* Note: -c is not an option with param!
10383  * "hush -c -l SCRIPT" is valid. "hush -cSCRIPT" is not.
10384  */
10385  G.opt_c = 1;
10386  break;
10387  case 'i':
10388  /* Well, we cannot just declare interactiveness,
10389  * we have to have some stuff (ctty, etc) */
10390  /* G_interactive_fd++; */
10391 //There are a few cases where bash -i -c 'SCRIPT'
10392 //has visible effect (differs from bash -c 'SCRIPT'):
10393 //it ignores TERM:
10394 // bash -i -c 'kill $$; echo ALIVE'
10395 // ALIVE
10396 //it resets SIG_IGNed HUP to SIG_DFL:
10397 // trap '' hup; bash -i -c 'kill -hup $$; echo ALIVE'
10398 // Hangup [the message is not printed by bash, it's the shell which started it]
10399 //is talkative about jobs and exiting:
10400 // bash -i -c 'sleep 1 & exit'
10401 // [1] 16170
10402 // exit
10403 //includes $ENV file (only if run as "sh"):
10404 // echo last >/tmp/ENV; ENV=/tmp/ENV sh -i -c 'echo HERE'
10405 // last: cannot open /var/log/wtmp: No such file or directory
10406 // HERE
10407 //(under "bash", it's the opposite: it runs $BASH_ENV file only *without* -i).
10408 //
10409 //ash -i -c 'sleep 3; sleep 3', on ^C, drops into a prompt instead of exiting
10410 //(this may be a bug, bash does not do this).
10411 //(ash -i -c 'sleep 3' won't show this, the last command gets auto-"exec"ed)
10412 //
10413 //None of the above feel like useful features people would rely on.
10414  break;
10415  case 's':
10416  G.opt_s = 1;
10417  break;
10418  case 'l':
10419  flags |= OPT_login;
10420  break;
10421 #if !BB_MMU
10422  case '<': /* "big heredoc" support */
10423  full_write1_str(optarg);
10424  _exit(0);
10425  case '$': {
10426  unsigned long long empty_trap_mask;
10427 
10428  G.root_pid = bb_strtou(optarg, &optarg, 16);
10429  optarg++;
10430  G.root_ppid = bb_strtou(optarg, &optarg, 16);
10431  optarg++;
10432  G.last_bg_pid = bb_strtou(optarg, &optarg, 16);
10433  optarg++;
10434  G.last_exitcode = bb_strtou(optarg, &optarg, 16);
10435  optarg++;
10436  builtin_argc = bb_strtou(optarg, &optarg, 16);
10437  optarg++;
10438  empty_trap_mask = bb_strtoull(optarg, &optarg, 16);
10439  if (empty_trap_mask != 0) {
10440  IF_HUSH_TRAP(int sig;)
10441  install_special_sighandlers();
10442 # if ENABLE_HUSH_TRAP
10443  G_traps = xzalloc(sizeof(G_traps[0]) * NSIG);
10444  for (sig = 1; sig < NSIG; sig++) {
10445  if (empty_trap_mask & (1LL << sig)) {
10446  G_traps[sig] = xzalloc(1); /* == xstrdup(""); */
10447  install_sighandler(sig, SIG_IGN);
10448  }
10449  }
10450 # endif
10451  }
10452 # if ENABLE_HUSH_LOOPS
10453  optarg++;
10454  G.depth_of_loop = bb_strtou(optarg, &optarg, 16);
10455 # endif
10456  /* Suppress "killed by signal" message, -$ hack is used
10457  * for subshells: echo `sh -c 'kill -9 $$'`
10458  * should be silent.
10459  */
10460  IF_HUSH_JOB(G.run_list_level = 1;)
10461 # if ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
10462  /* nommu uses re-exec trick for "... | func | ...",
10463  * should allow "return".
10464  * This accidentally allows returns in subshells.
10465  */
10466  G_flag_return_in_progress = -1;
10467 # endif
10468  break;
10469  }
10470  case 'R':
10471  case 'V':
10472  set_local_var(xstrdup(optarg), opt == 'R' ? SETFLAG_MAKE_RO : 0);
10473  break;
10474 # if ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
10475  case 'F': {
10476  struct function *funcp = new_function(optarg);
10477  /* funcp->name is already set to optarg */
10478  /* funcp->body is set to NULL. It's a special case. */
10479  funcp->body_as_string = argv[optind];
10480  optind++;
10481  break;
10482  }
10483 # endif
10484 #endif
10485  /*case '?': invalid option encountered (set_mode('?') will fail) */
10486  /*case 'n':*/
10487  /*case 'x':*/
10488  /*case 'e':*/
10489  default:
10490  if (set_mode(1, opt, NULL) == 0) /* no error */
10491  break;
10492  bb_show_usage();
10493  }
10494  } /* option parsing loop */
10495 
10496  /* Skip options. Try "hush -l": $1 should not be "-l"! */
10497  G.global_argc = argc - (optind - 1);
10498  G.global_argv = argv + (optind - 1);
10499  G.global_argv[0] = argv[0];
10500 
10501  /* If we are login shell... */
10502  if (flags & OPT_login) {
10503  const char *hp = NULL;
10504  HFILE *input;
10505 
10506  debug_printf("sourcing /etc/profile\n");
10507  input = hfopen("/etc/profile");
10508  run_profile:
10509  if (input != NULL) {
10510  install_special_sighandlers();
10511  parse_and_run_file(input);
10512  hfclose(input);
10513  }
10514  /* bash: after sourcing /etc/profile,
10515  * tries to source (in the given order):
10516  * ~/.bash_profile, ~/.bash_login, ~/.profile,
10517  * stopping on first found. --noprofile turns this off.
10518  * bash also sources ~/.bash_logout on exit.
10519  * If called as sh, skips .bash_XXX files.
10520  */
10521  if (!hp) { /* unless we looped on the "goto" already */
10522  hp = get_local_var_value("HOME");
10523  if (hp && hp[0]) {
10524  debug_printf("sourcing ~/.profile\n");
10525  hp = concat_path_file(hp, ".profile");
10526  input = hfopen(hp);
10527  free((char*)hp);
10528  goto run_profile;
10529  }
10530  }
10531  }
10532 
10533  /* -c takes effect *after* -l */
10534  if (G.opt_c) {
10535  /* Possibilities:
10536  * sh ... -c 'script'
10537  * sh ... -c 'script' ARG0 [ARG1...]
10538  * On NOMMU, if builtin_argc != 0,
10539  * sh ... -c 'builtin' BARGV... "" ARG0 [ARG1...]
10540  * "" needs to be replaced with NULL
10541  * and BARGV vector fed to builtin function.
10542  * Note: the form without ARG0 never happens:
10543  * sh ... -c 'builtin' BARGV... ""
10544  */
10545  char *script;
10546 
10547  install_special_sighandlers();
10548 
10549  G.global_argc--;
10550  G.global_argv++;
10551 #if !BB_MMU
10552  if (builtin_argc) {
10553  /* -c 'builtin' [BARGV...] "" ARG0 [ARG1...] */
10554  const struct built_in_command *x;
10555  x = find_builtin(G.global_argv[0]);
10556  if (x) { /* paranoia */
10557  argv = G.global_argv;
10558  G.global_argc -= builtin_argc + 1; /* skip [BARGV...] "" */
10559  G.global_argv += builtin_argc + 1;
10560  G.global_argv[-1] = NULL; /* replace "" */
10561  G.last_exitcode = x->b_function(argv);
10562  }
10563  goto final_return;
10564  }
10565 #endif
10566 
10567  script = G.global_argv[0];
10568  if (!script)
10569  bb_error_msg_and_die(bb_msg_requires_arg, "-c");
10570  if (!G.global_argv[1]) {
10571  /* -c 'script' (no params): prevent empty $0 */
10572  G.global_argv[0] = argv[0];
10573  } else { /* else -c 'script' ARG0 [ARG1...]: $0 is ARG0 */
10574  G.global_argc--;
10575  G.global_argv++;
10576  }
10577  parse_and_run_string(script);
10578  goto final_return;
10579  }
10580 
10581  /* -s is: hush -s ARGV1 ARGV2 (no SCRIPT) */
10582  if (!G.opt_s && G.global_argv[1]) {
10583  HFILE *input;
10584  /*
10585  * "bash <script>" (which is never interactive (unless -i?))
10586  * sources $BASH_ENV here (without scanning $PATH).
10587  * If called as sh, does the same but with $ENV.
10588  * Also NB, per POSIX, $ENV should undergo parameter expansion.
10589  */
10590  G.global_argc--;
10591  G.global_argv++;
10592  debug_printf("running script '%s'\n", G.global_argv[0]);
10593  xfunc_error_retval = 127; /* for "hush /does/not/exist" case */
10594  input = hfopen(G.global_argv[0]);
10595  if (!input) {
10596  bb_simple_perror_msg_and_die(G.global_argv[0]);
10597  }
10598  xfunc_error_retval = 1;
10599  install_special_sighandlers();
10600  parse_and_run_file(input);
10601 #if ENABLE_FEATURE_CLEAN_UP
10602  hfclose(input);
10603 #endif
10604  goto final_return;
10605  }
10606  /* "implicit" -s: bare interactive hush shows 's' in $- */
10607  G.opt_s = 1;
10608 
10609  /* Up to here, shell was non-interactive. Now it may become one.
10610  * NB: don't forget to (re)run install_special_sighandlers() as needed.
10611  */
10612 
10613  /* A shell is interactive if the '-i' flag was given,
10614  * or if all of the following conditions are met:
10615  * no -c command
10616  * no arguments remaining or the -s flag given
10617  * standard input is a terminal
10618  * standard output is a terminal
10619  * Refer to Posix.2, the description of the 'sh' utility.
10620  */
10621 #if ENABLE_HUSH_JOB
10622  if (isatty(STDIN_FILENO) && isatty(STDOUT_FILENO)) {
10623  G_saved_tty_pgrp = tcgetpgrp(STDIN_FILENO);
10624  debug_printf("saved_tty_pgrp:%d\n", G_saved_tty_pgrp);
10625  if (G_saved_tty_pgrp < 0)
10626  G_saved_tty_pgrp = 0;
10627 
10628  /* try to dup stdin to high fd#, >= 255 */
10629  G_interactive_fd = dup_CLOEXEC(STDIN_FILENO, 254);
10630  if (G_interactive_fd < 0) {
10631  /* try to dup to any fd */
10632  G_interactive_fd = dup(STDIN_FILENO);
10633  if (G_interactive_fd < 0) {
10634  /* give up */
10635  G_interactive_fd = 0;
10636  G_saved_tty_pgrp = 0;
10637  }
10638  }
10639  }
10640  debug_printf("interactive_fd:%d\n", G_interactive_fd);
10641  if (G_interactive_fd) {
10642  close_on_exec_on(G_interactive_fd);
10643 
10644  if (G_saved_tty_pgrp) {
10645  /* If we were run as 'hush &', sleep until we are
10646  * in the foreground (tty pgrp == our pgrp).
10647  * If we get started under a job aware app (like bash),
10648  * make sure we are now in charge so we don't fight over
10649  * who gets the foreground */
10650  while (1) {
10651  pid_t shell_pgrp = getpgrp();
10652  G_saved_tty_pgrp = tcgetpgrp(G_interactive_fd);
10653  if (G_saved_tty_pgrp == shell_pgrp)
10654  break;
10655  /* send TTIN to ourself (should stop us) */
10656  kill(- shell_pgrp, SIGTTIN);
10657  }
10658  }
10659 
10660  /* Install more signal handlers */
10661  install_special_sighandlers();
10662 
10663  if (G_saved_tty_pgrp) {
10664  /* Set other signals to restore saved_tty_pgrp */
10665  install_fatal_sighandlers();
10666  /* Put ourselves in our own process group
10667  * (bash, too, does this only if ctty is available) */
10668  bb_setpgrp(); /* is the same as setpgid(our_pid, our_pid); */
10669  /* Grab control of the terminal */
10670  tcsetpgrp(G_interactive_fd, cached_getpid);
10671  }
10672  enable_restore_tty_pgrp_on_exit();
10673 
10674 # if ENABLE_FEATURE_EDITING
10675  G.line_input_state = new_line_input_t(FOR_SHELL);
10676 # if ENABLE_FEATURE_TAB_COMPLETION
10677  G.line_input_state->get_exe_name = get_builtin_name;
10678 # endif
10679 # if EDITING_HAS_sh_get_var
10680  G.line_input_state->sh_get_var = get_local_var_value;
10681 # endif
10682 # endif
10683 # if ENABLE_HUSH_SAVEHISTORY && MAX_HISTORY > 0
10684  {
10685  const char *hp = get_local_var_value("HISTFILE");
10686  if (!hp) {
10687  hp = get_local_var_value("HOME");
10688  if (hp)
10689  hp = concat_path_file(hp, ".hush_history");
10690  } else {
10691  hp = xstrdup(hp);
10692  }
10693  if (hp) {
10694  G.line_input_state->hist_file = hp;
10695  //set_local_var(xasprintf("HISTFILE=%s", ...));
10696  }
10697 # if ENABLE_FEATURE_SH_HISTFILESIZE
10698  hp = get_local_var_value("HISTFILESIZE");
10699  G.line_input_state->max_history = size_from_HISTFILESIZE(hp);
10700 # endif
10701  }
10702 # endif
10703  } else {
10704  install_special_sighandlers();
10705  }
10706 #elif ENABLE_HUSH_INTERACTIVE
10707  /* No job control compiled in, only prompt/line editing */
10708  if (isatty(STDIN_FILENO) && isatty(STDOUT_FILENO)) {
10709  G_interactive_fd = dup_CLOEXEC(STDIN_FILENO, 254);
10710  if (G_interactive_fd < 0) {
10711  /* try to dup to any fd */
10712  G_interactive_fd = dup_CLOEXEC(STDIN_FILENO, -1);
10713  if (G_interactive_fd < 0)
10714  /* give up */
10715  G_interactive_fd = 0;
10716  }
10717  }
10718  if (G_interactive_fd) {
10719  close_on_exec_on(G_interactive_fd);
10720  }
10721  install_special_sighandlers();
10722 #else
10723  /* We have interactiveness code disabled */
10724  install_special_sighandlers();
10725 #endif
10726  /* bash:
10727  * if interactive but not a login shell, sources ~/.bashrc
10728  * (--norc turns this off, --rcfile <file> overrides)
10729  */
10730 
10731  if (G_interactive_fd) {
10732 #if ENABLE_HUSH_INTERACTIVE && ENABLE_FEATURE_EDITING_FANCY_PROMPT
10733  /* Set (but not export) PS1/2 unless already set */
10734  if (!get_local_var_value("PS1"))
10735  set_local_var_from_halves("PS1", "\\w \\$ ");
10736  if (!get_local_var_value("PS2"))
10737  set_local_var_from_halves("PS2", "> ");
10738 #endif
10739  if (!ENABLE_FEATURE_SH_EXTRA_QUIET) {
10740  /* note: ash and hush share this string */
10741  printf("\n\n%s %s\n"
10742  IF_HUSH_HELP("Enter 'help' for a list of built-in commands.\n")
10743  "\n",
10744  bb_banner,
10745  "hush - the humble shell"
10746  );
10747  }
10748  }
10749 
10750  parse_and_run_file(hfopen(NULL)); /* stdin */
10751 
10752  final_return:
10753  hush_exit(G.last_exitcode);
10754 }

2779 {
2780  int ch;
2781 
2782  if (!i->file) {
2783  /* string-based in_str */
2784  ch = (unsigned char)*i->p;
2785  if (ch != '\0') {
2786  i->p++;
2787  i->last_char = ch;
2788 #if ENABLE_HUSH_LINENO_VAR
2789  if (ch == '\n') {
2790  G.parse_lineno++;
2791  debug_printf_parse("G.parse_lineno++ = %u\n", G.parse_lineno);
2792  }
2793 #endif
2794  return ch;
2795  }
2796  return EOF;
2797  }
2798 
2799  /* FILE-based in_str */
2800 
2801 #if ENABLE_FEATURE_EDITING
2802  /* This can be stdin, check line editing char[] buffer */
2803  if (i->p && *i->p != '\0') {
2804  ch = (unsigned char)*i->p++;
2805  goto out;
2806  }
2807 #endif
2808  /* peek_buf[] is an int array, not char. Can contain EOF. */
2809  ch = i->peek_buf[0];
2810  if (ch != 0) {
2811  int ch2 = i->peek_buf[1];
2812  i->peek_buf[0] = ch2;
2813  if (ch2 == 0) /* very likely, avoid redundant write */
2814  goto out;
2815  i->peek_buf[1] = 0;
2816  goto out;
2817  }
2818 
2819  ch = fgetc_interactive(i);
2820  out:
2821  debug_printf("file_get: got '%c' %d\n", ch, ch);
2822  i->last_char = ch;
2823 #if ENABLE_HUSH_LINENO_VAR
2824  if (ch == '\n') {
2825  G.parse_lineno++;
2826  debug_printf_parse("G.parse_lineno++ = %u\n", G.parse_lineno);
2827  }
2828 #endif
2829  return ch;
2830 }

◆ i_peek()

2833 {
2834  int ch;
2835 
2836  if (!i->file) {
2837  /* string-based in_str */
2838  /* Doesn't report EOF on NUL. None of the callers care. */
2839  return (unsigned char)*i->p;
2840  }
2841 
2842  /* FILE-based in_str */
2843 
2844 #if ENABLE_FEATURE_EDITING && ENABLE_HUSH_INTERACTIVE
2845  /* This can be stdin, check line editing char[] buffer */
2846  if (i->p && *i->p != '\0')
2847  return (unsigned char)*i->p;
2848 #endif
2849  /* peek_buf[] is an int array, not char. Can contain EOF. */
2850  ch = i->peek_buf[0];
2851  if (ch != 0)
2852  return ch;
2853 
2854  /* Need to get a new char */
2855  ch = fgetc_interactive(i);
2856  debug_printf("file_peek: got '%c' %d\n", ch, ch);
2857

2859 #if ENABLE_FEATURE_EDITING && ENABLE_HUSH_INTERACTIVE
2860  if (i->p) {
2861  i->p -= 1;
2862  return ch;
2863  }
2864 #endif
2865  i->peek_buf[0] = ch;
2866  /*i->peek_buf[1] = 0; - already is */
2867  return ch;
2868 }

◆ i_peek2()

Definition at line 2874 of file hush.c.

2875 {
2876  int ch;
2877 
2878  /* There are two cases when i->p[] buffer exists.
2879  * (1) it's a string in_str.
2880  * (2) It's a file, and we have a saved line editing buffer.
2881  * In both cases, we know that i->p[0] exists and not NUL, and
2882  * the peek2 result is in i->p[1].
2883  */
2884  if (i->p)
2885  return (unsigned char)i->p[1];
2886 
2887  /* Now we know it is a file-based in_str. */
2888 
2889  /* peek_buf[] is an int array, not char. Can contain EOF. */
2890  /* Is there 2nd char? */
2891  ch = i->peek_buf[1];
2892  if (ch == 0) {
2893  /* We did not read it yet, get it now */
2894  do ch = hfgetc(i->file); while (ch == '\0');
2895  i->peek_buf[1] = ch;
2896  }
2897 
2898  debug_printf("file_peek2: got '%c' %d\n", ch, ch);
2899  return ch;
2900 }

◆ install_sighandler()

static sighandler_t install_sighandler ( int  sig,
sighandler_t  handler 
)
static

Definition at line 1959 of file hush.c.

1960 {
1961  struct sigaction old_sa;
1962 
1963  /* We could use signal() to install handlers... almost:
1964  * except that we need to mask ALL signals while handlers run.
1965  * I saw signal nesting in strace, race window isn't small.
1966  * SA_RESTART is also needed, but in Linux, signal()
1967  * sets SA_RESTART too.
1968  */
1969  /* memset(&G.sa, 0, sizeof(G.sa)); - already done */
1970  /* sigfillset(&G.sa.sa_mask); - already done */
1971  /* G.sa.sa_flags = SA_RESTART; - already done */
1972  G.sa.sa_handler = handler;
1973  sigaction(sig, &G.sa, &old_sa);
1974  return old_sa.sa_handler;
1975 }
handler
static void handler(int sig)
Definition: synccall.c:20

References G, and handler().

◆ install_sighandlers()

static void install_sighandlers ( unsigned  mask)
static

Definition at line 10091 of file hush.c.

10092 {
10093  sighandler_t old_handler;
10094  unsigned sig = 0;
10095  while ((mask >>= 1) != 0) {
10096  sig++;
10097  if (!(mask & 1))
10098  continue;
10099  old_handler = install_sighandler(sig, pick_sighandler(sig));
10100  /* POSIX allows shell to re-enable SIGCHLD
10101  * even if it was SIG_IGN on entry.
10102  * Therefore we skip IGN check for it:
10103  */
10104  if (sig == SIGCHLD)
10105  continue;
10106  /* Interactive bash re-enables SIGHUP which is SIG_IGNed on entry.
10107  * Try:
10108  * trap '' hup; bash; echo RET # type "kill -hup $$", see SIGHUP having effect
10109  * trap '' hup; bash -c 'kill -hup $$; echo ALIVE' # here SIGHUP is SIG_IGNed
10110  */
10111  if (sig == SIGHUP && G_interactive_fd)
10112  continue;
10113  /* Unless one of the above signals, is it SIG_IGN? */
10114  if (old_handler == SIG_IGN) {
10115  /* oops... restore back to IGN, and record this fact */
10116  install_sighandler(sig, old_handler);
10117 #if ENABLE_HUSH_TRAP
10118  if (!G_traps)
10119  G_traps = xzalloc(sizeof(G_traps[0]) * NSIG);
10120  free(G_traps[sig]);
10121  G_traps[sig] = xzalloc(1); /* == xstrdup(""); */
10122 #endif
10123  }
10124  }
10125 }
pick_sighandler
static sighandler_t pick_sighandler(unsigned sig)
Definition: hush.c:2047

◆ install_special_sighandlers()

static void install_special_sighandlers ( void  )
static

Definition at line 10128 of file hush.c.

10129 {
10130  unsigned mask;
10131 
10132  /* Which signals are shell-special? */
10133  mask = (1 << SIGQUIT) | (1 << SIGCHLD);
10134  if (G_interactive_fd) {
10135  mask |= SPECIAL_INTERACTIVE_SIGS;
10136  if (G_saved_tty_pgrp) /* we have ctty, job control sigs work */
10137  mask |= SPECIAL_JOBSTOP_SIGS;
10138  }
10139  /* Careful, do not re-install handlers we already installed */
10140  if (G.special_sig_mask != mask) {
10141  unsigned diff = mask & ~G.special_sig_mask;
10142  G.special_sig_mask = mask;
10143  install_sighandlers(diff);
10144  }
10145 }

static int job_exited_or_stopped ( struct pipe *  pi)

8903 {
8904  int rcode, i;
8905 
8906  if (pi->alive_cmds != pi->stopped_cmds)
8907  return -1;
8908 
8909  /* All processes in fg pipe have exited or stopped */
8910  rcode = 0;
8911  i = pi->num_cmds;
8912  while (--i >= 0) {
8913  rcode = pi->cmds[i].cmd_exitcode;
8914  /* usually last process gives overall exitstatus,
8915  * but with "set -o pipefail", last *failed* process does */

1701  HFILE *fl = G.HFILE_list;
