1704  /* We use it only on script files, they are all CLOEXEC */
1705  fl->fd = xdup_CLOEXEC_and_close(fd, avoid_fd);
1706  debug_printf_redir("redirect_fd %d: matches a script fd, moving it to %d\n", fd, fl->fd);
1707  return 1; /* "found and moved" */
1708  }
1709  fl = fl->next_hfile;
1710  }
1711 #if ENABLE_HUSH_MODE_X
1712  if (G.x_mode_fd > 0 && fd == G.x_mode_fd) {
1713  G.x_mode_fd = xdup_CLOEXEC_and_close(fd, avoid_fd);
1714  return 1; /* "found and moved" */
1715  }
1716 #endif
1717  return 0; /* "not in the list" */
1718 }

3214  string_start = ((n + 0xf) & ~0xf) * sizeof(list[0]);
3215  string_len = o->length - string_start;
3216  if (!(n & 0xf)) { /* 0, 0x10, 0x20...? */
3217  debug_printf_list("list[%d]=%d string_start=%d (growing)\n", n, string_len, string_start);
3218  /* list[n] points to string_start, make space for 16 more pointers */
3219  o->maxlen += 0x10 * sizeof(list[0]);
3220  o->data = xrealloc(o->data, o->maxlen + 1);
3221  list = (char**)o->data;
3222  memmove(list + n + 0x10, list + n, string_len);
3223  /*
3224  * expand_on_ifs() has a "previous argv[] ends in IFS?"
3225  * check. (grep for -prev-ifs-check-).
3226  * Ensure that argv[-1][last] is not garbage
3227  * but zero bytes, to save index check there.

3233  n, string_len, string_start);
3234  }

3236  /* We have empty slot at list[n], reuse without growth */
3237  string_start = ((n+1 + 0xf) & ~0xf) * sizeof(list[0]); /* NB: n+1! */

◆ parse_and_run_stream()

static void parse_and_run_stream ( struct in_str *  inp,
int  end_trigger 
)
static

Definition at line 7534 of file hush.c.

7535 {
7536  /* Why we need empty flag?
7537  * An obscure corner case "false; ``; echo $?":
7538  * empty command in `` should still set $? to 0.
7539  * But we can't just set $? to 0 at the start,
7540  * this breaks "false; echo `echo $?`" case.
7541  */
7542  bool empty = 1;
7543  while (1) {
7544  struct pipe *pipe_list;
7545 
7546 #if ENABLE_HUSH_INTERACTIVE
7547  if (end_trigger == ';') {
7548  G.promptmode = 0; /* PS1 */
7549  debug_printf_prompt("%s promptmode=%d\n", __func__, G.promptmode);
7550  }
7551 #endif
7552  pipe_list = parse_stream(NULL, NULL, inp, end_trigger);
7553  if (!pipe_list || pipe_list == ERR_PTR) { /* EOF/error */
7554  /* If we are in "big" script
7555  * (not in `cmd` or something similar)...
7556  */
7557  if (pipe_list == ERR_PTR && end_trigger == ';') {
7558  /* Discard cached input (rest of line) */
7559  int ch = inp->last_char;
7560  while (ch != EOF && ch != '\n') {
7561  //bb_error_msg("Discarded:'%c'", ch);
7562  ch = i_getch(inp);
7563  }
7564  /* Force prompt */
7565  inp->p = NULL;
7566  /* This stream isn't empty */
7567  empty = 0;
7568  continue;
7569  }
7570  if (!pipe_list && empty)
7571  G.last_exitcode = 0;
7572  break;
7573  }
7574  debug_print_tree(pipe_list, 0);
7575  debug_printf_exec("parse_and_run_stream: run_and_free_list\n");
7576  run_and_free_list(pipe_list);
7577  empty = 0;
7578  if (G_flag_return_in_progress == 1)
7579  break;
7580  }
7581 }
in_str::p
const char * p
Definition: hush.c:591
debug_print_tree
#define debug_print_tree(a, b)
Definition: hush.c:462

#define ERR_PTR
Definition: hush.c:475

◆ parse_dollar()

static int parse_dollar ( o_string *  as_string,

unsigned char  quote_mask 
)
static

Definition at line 5062 of file hush.c.

5065 {
5066  int ch = i_peek_and_eat_bkslash_nl(input); /* first character after the $ */
5067 
5068  debug_printf_parse("parse_dollar entered: ch='%c' quote_mask:0x%x\n", ch, quote_mask);
5069  if (isalpha(ch)) {
5070  make_var:
5071  ch = i_getch(input);
5072  nommu_addchr(as_string, ch);
5073  /*make_var1:*/
5074  o_addchr(dest, SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL);
5075  while (1) {
5076  debug_printf_parse(": '%c'\n", ch);
5077  o_addchr(dest, ch | quote_mask);
5078  quote_mask = 0;
5079  ch = i_peek_and_eat_bkslash_nl(input);
5080  if (!isalnum(ch) && ch != '_') {
5081  /* End of variable name reached */
5082  break;
5083  }
5084  ch = i_getch(input);
5085  nommu_addchr(as_string, ch);
5086  }
5087  o_addchr(dest, SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL);
5088  } else if (isdigit(ch)) {
5089  make_one_char_var:
5090  ch = i_getch(input);
5091  nommu_addchr(as_string, ch);
5092  o_addchr(dest, SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL);
5093  debug_printf_parse(": '%c'\n", ch);
5094  o_addchr(dest, ch | quote_mask);
5095  o_addchr(dest, SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL);
5096  } else switch (ch) {
5097  case '$': /* pid */
5098  case '!': /* last bg pid */
5099  case '?': /* last exit code */
5100  case '#': /* number of args */
5101  case '*': /* args */
5102  case '@': /* args */
5103  case '-': /* $- option flags set by set builtin or shell options (-i etc) */
5104  goto make_one_char_var;
5105  case '{': {
5106  char len_single_ch;
5107 
5108  o_addchr(dest, SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL);
5109 
5110  ch = i_getch(input); /* eat '{' */
5111  nommu_addchr(as_string, ch);
5112 
5113  ch = i_getch_and_eat_bkslash_nl(input); /* first char after '{' */
5114  /* It should be ${?}, or ${#var},
5115  * or even ${?+subst} - operator acting on a special variable,
5116  * or the beginning of variable name.
5117  */
5118  if (ch == EOF
5119  || (!strchr(_SPECIAL_VARS_STR, ch) && !isalnum(ch)) /* not one of those */
5120  ) {
5121  bad_dollar_syntax:
5122  syntax_error_unterm_str("${name}");
5123  debug_printf_parse("parse_dollar return 0: unterminated ${name}\n");
5124  return 0;
5125  }
5126  nommu_addchr(as_string, ch);
5127  len_single_ch = ch;
5128  ch |= quote_mask;
5129 
5130  /* It's possible to just call add_till_closing_bracket() at this point.
5131  * However, this regresses some of our testsuite cases
5132  * which check invalid constructs like ${%}.
5133  * Oh well... let's check that the var name part is fine... */
5134 
5135  if (isdigit(len_single_ch)
5136  || (len_single_ch == '#' && isdigit(i_peek_and_eat_bkslash_nl(input)))
5137  ) {
5138  /* Execution engine uses plain xatoi_positive()
5139  * to interpret ${NNN} and {#NNN},
5140  * check syntax here in the parser.
5141  * (bash does not support expressions in ${#NN},
5142  * e.g. ${#$var} and {#1:+WORD} are not supported).
5143  */
5144  unsigned cnt = 9; /* max 9 digits for ${NN} and 8 for {#NN} */
5145  while (1) {
5146  o_addchr(dest, ch);
5147  debug_printf_parse(": '%c'\n", ch);
5148  ch = i_getch_and_eat_bkslash_nl(input);
5149  nommu_addchr(as_string, ch);
5150  if (ch == '}')
5151  break;
5152  if (--cnt == 0)
5153  goto bad_dollar_syntax;
5154  if (len_single_ch != '#' && strchr(VAR_SUBST_OPS, ch))
5155  /* ${NN<op>...} is valid */
5156  goto eat_until_closing;
5157  if (!isdigit(ch))
5158  goto bad_dollar_syntax;
5159  }
5160  } else
5161  while (1) {
5162  unsigned pos;
5163 
5164  o_addchr(dest, ch);
5165  debug_printf_parse(": '%c'\n", ch);
5166 
5167  ch = i_getch(input);
5168  nommu_addchr(as_string, ch);
5169  if (ch == '}')
5170  break;
5171  if (!isalnum(ch) && ch != '_') {
5172  unsigned end_ch;
5173  unsigned char last_ch;
5174  /* handle parameter expansions
5175  * http://www.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/009695399/utilities/xcu_chap02.html#tag_02_06_02
5176  */
5177  if (!strchr(VAR_SUBST_OPS, ch)) { /* ${var<bad_char>... */
5178  if (len_single_ch != '#'
5179  /*|| !strchr(SPECIAL_VARS_STR, ch) - disallow errors like ${#+} ? */
5180  || i_peek(input) != '}'
5181  ) {
5182  goto bad_dollar_syntax;
5183  }
5184  /* else: it's "length of C" ${#C} op,
5185  * where C is a single char
5186  * special var name, e.g. ${#!}.
5187  */
5188  }
5189  eat_until_closing:
5190  /* Eat everything until closing '}' (or ':') */
5191  end_ch = '}';
5192  if (BASH_SUBSTR
5193  && ch == ':'
5194  && !strchr(MINUS_PLUS_EQUAL_QUESTION, i_peek(input))
5195  ) {
5196  /* It's ${var:N[:M]} thing */
5197  end_ch = '}' * 0x100 + ':';
5198  }
5199  if (BASH_PATTERN_SUBST
5200  && ch == '/'
5201  ) {
5202  /* It's ${var/[/]pattern[/repl]} thing */
5203  if (i_peek(input) == '/') { /* ${var//pattern[/repl]}? */
5204  i_getch(input);
5205  nommu_addchr(as_string, '/');
5206  ch = '\\';
5207  }
5208  end_ch = '}' * 0x100 + '/';
5209  }
5210  o_addchr(dest, ch);
5211  /* The pattern can't be empty.
5212  * IOW: if the first char after "${v//" is a slash,
5213  * it does not terminate the pattern - it's the first char of the pattern:
5214  * v=/dev/ram; echo ${v////-} prints -dev-ram (pattern is "/")
5215  * v=/dev/ram; echo ${v///r/-} prints /dev-am (pattern is "/r")
5216  */
5217  if (i_peek(input) == '/') {
5218  o_addchr(dest, i_getch(input));
5219  }
5220  again:
5221  if (!BB_MMU)
5222  pos = dest->length;
5223 #if ENABLE_HUSH_DOLLAR_OPS
5224  last_ch = add_till_closing_bracket(dest, input, end_ch);
5225  if (last_ch == 0) /* error? */
5226  return 0;
5227 #else
5228 # error Simple code to only allow ${var} is not implemented
5229 #endif
5230  if (as_string) {
5231  o_addstr(as_string, dest->data + pos);
5232  o_addchr(as_string, last_ch);
5233  }
5234 
5235  if ((BASH_SUBSTR || BASH_PATTERN_SUBST)
5236  && (end_ch & 0xff00)
5237  ) {
5238  /* close the first block: */
5239  o_addchr(dest, SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL);
5240  /* while parsing N from ${var:N[:M]}
5241  * or pattern from ${var/[/]pattern[/repl]} */
5242  if ((end_ch & 0xff) == last_ch) {
5243  /* got ':' or '/'- parse the rest */
5244  end_ch = '}';
5245  goto again;
5246  }
5247  /* got '}' */
5248  if (BASH_SUBSTR && end_ch == '}' * 0x100 + ':') {
5249  /* it's ${var:N} - emulate :999999999 */
5250  o_addstr(dest, "999999999");
5251  } /* else: it's ${var/[/]pattern} */
5252  }
5253  break;
5254  }
5255  len_single_ch = 0; /* it can't be ${#C} op */
5256  }
5257  o_addchr(dest, SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL);
5258  break;
5259  }
5260 #if ENABLE_FEATURE_SH_MATH || ENABLE_HUSH_TICK
5261  case '(': {
5262  unsigned pos;
5263 
5264  ch = i_getch(input);
5265  nommu_addchr(as_string, ch);
5266 # if ENABLE_FEATURE_SH_MATH
5267  if (i_peek_and_eat_bkslash_nl(input) == '(') {
5268  ch = i_getch(input);
5269  nommu_addchr(as_string, ch);
5270  o_addchr(dest, SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL);
5271  o_addchr(dest, quote_mask | '+');
5272  if (!BB_MMU)
5273  pos = dest->length;
5274  if (!add_till_closing_bracket(dest, input, ')' | DOUBLE_CLOSE_CHAR_FLAG))
5275  return 0; /* error */
5276  if (as_string) {
5277  o_addstr(as_string, dest->data + pos);
5278  o_addchr(as_string, ')');
5279  o_addchr(as_string, ')');
5280  }
5281  o_addchr(dest, SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL);
5282  break;
5283  }
5284 # endif
5285 # if ENABLE_HUSH_TICK
5286  o_addchr(dest, SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL);
5287  o_addchr(dest, quote_mask | '`');
5288  if (!BB_MMU)
5289  pos = dest->length;
5290  if (!add_till_closing_bracket(dest, input, ')'))
5291  return 0; /* error */
5292  if (as_string) {
5293  o_addstr(as_string, dest->data + pos);
5294  o_addchr(as_string, ')');
5295  }
5296  o_addchr(dest, SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL);
5297 # endif
5298  break;
5299  }
5300 #endif
5301  case '_':
5302  goto make_var;
5303 #if 0
5304  /* TODO: $_: */
5305  /* $_ Shell or shell script name; or last argument of last command
5306  * (if last command wasn't a pipe; if it was, bash sets $_ to "");
5307  * but in command's env, set to full pathname used to invoke it */
5308  ch = i_getch(input);
5309  nommu_addchr(as_string, ch);
5310  ch = i_peek_and_eat_bkslash_nl(input);
5311  if (isalnum(ch)) { /* it's $_name or $_123 */
5312  ch = '_';
5313  goto make_var1;
5314  }
5315  /* else: it's $_ */
5316 #endif
5317  default:
5318  o_addQchr(dest, '$');
5319  }
5320  debug_printf_parse("parse_dollar return 1 (ok)\n");
5321  return 1;
5322 #undef as_string
5323 }
pos
static int pos
Definition: test.c:108

4634  * Typically it's empty, but for function defs,
4635  * it contains function name (without '()'). */
4636 #if BB_MMU
4637 # define as_string NULL
4638 #else
4639  char *as_string = NULL;
4640 #endif

4642  int heredoc_cnt = 0;
4643  int endch;

4645

4647 #if ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS

4649  if (ctx->word.length)
4650  if (done_word(ctx))
4651  return -1;
4652  if (!command->argv)
4653  goto skip; /* (... */

4655  syntax_error_unexpected_ch('(');

4690 #endif

4693

4696  endch = ')';

4698  command->cmd_type = CMD_SUBSHELL;
4699  } else {
4700  /* bash does not allow "{echo...", requires whitespace */
4701  ch = i_peek(input);
4702  if (ch != ' ' && ch != '\t' && ch != '\n'
4703  && ch != '(' /* but "{(..." is allowed (without whitespace) */
4704  ) {
4705  syntax_error_unexpected_ch(ch);
4706  return -1;
4707  }

4709  ch = i_getch(input);

4717 #if !BB_MMU
4718  if (as_string)
4719  o_addstr(&ctx->as_string, as_string);
4720 #endif
4721

4724  /* parse_stream already emitted error msg */

4728  "parse_stream returned %p\n", pipe_list);
4729  return -1;
4730  }

4733  command->group_as_string = as_string;
4734  debug_printf_parse("end of group, remembering as:'%s'\n",
4735  command->group_as_string);
4736 #endif
4737 
4738 #if ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS

4741  struct command *cmd2;
4742

4744  cmd2->cmd_type = CMD_SUBSHELL;

4336 
4337  ch = i_peek(input);
4338  if (ch != '&')
4339  return REDIRFD_TO_FILE;

4382  if (dup_num == REDIRFD_SYNTAX_ERR)
4383  return 1;
4384  } else {

4423  * is legit; I postpone that to "run time"

Definition at line 5423 of file hush.c.

5427 {
5428  struct parse_context ctx;
5429  int heredoc_cnt;
5430 
5431  /* Single-quote triggers a bypass of the main loop until its mate is
5432  * found. When recursing, quote state is passed in via ctx.word.o_expflags.
5433  */
5434  debug_printf_parse("parse_stream entered, end_trigger='%c'\n",
5435  end_trigger ? end_trigger : 'X');
5436  debug_enter();
5437 
5438  initialize_context(&ctx);
5439 
5440  /* If very first arg is "" or '', ctx.word.data may end up NULL.
5441  * Preventing this:
5442  */
5443  ctx.word.data = xzalloc(1); /* start as "", not as NULL */
5444 
5445  /* We used to separate words on $IFS here. This was wrong.
5446  * $IFS is used only for word splitting when $var is expanded,
5447  * here we should use blank chars as separators, not $IFS
5448  */
5449 
5450  heredoc_cnt = 0;
5451  while (1) {
5452  const char *is_blank;
5453  const char *is_special;
5454  int ch;
5455  int next;
5456  int redir_fd;
5457  redir_type redir_style;
5458 
5459  ch = i_getch(input);
5460  debug_printf_parse(": ch=%c (%d) escape=%d\n",
5461  ch, ch, !!(ctx.word.o_expflags & EXP_FLAG_ESC_GLOB_CHARS));
5462  if (ch == EOF) {
5463  struct pipe *pi;
5464 
5465  if (heredoc_cnt) {
5466  syntax_error_unterm_str("here document");
5467  goto parse_error_exitcode1;
5468  }
5469  if (end_trigger == ')') {
5470  syntax_error_unterm_ch('(');
5471  goto parse_error_exitcode1;
5472  }
5473  if (end_trigger == '}') {
5474  syntax_error_unterm_ch('{');
5475  goto parse_error_exitcode1;
5476  }
5477 
5478  if (done_word(&ctx)) {
5479  goto parse_error_exitcode1;
5480  }
5481  o_free_and_set_NULL(&ctx.word);
5482  done_pipe(&ctx, PIPE_SEQ);
5483  pi = ctx.list_head;
5484  /* If we got nothing... */
5485  /* (this makes bare "&" cmd a no-op.
5486  * bash says: "syntax error near unexpected token '&'") */
5487  if (pi->num_cmds == 0
5488  IF_HAS_KEYWORDS(&& pi->res_word == RES_NONE)
5489  ) {
5490  free_pipe_list(pi);
5491  pi = NULL;
5492  }
5493 #if !BB_MMU
5494  debug_printf_parse("as_string1 '%s'\n", ctx.as_string.data);
5495  if (pstring)
5496  *pstring = ctx.as_string.data;
5497  else
5498  o_free(&ctx.as_string);
5499 #endif
5500  // heredoc_cnt must be 0 here anyway
5501  //if (heredoc_cnt_ptr)
5502  // *heredoc_cnt_ptr = heredoc_cnt;
5503  debug_leave();
5504  debug_printf_heredoc("parse_stream return heredoc_cnt:%d\n", heredoc_cnt);
5505  debug_printf_parse("parse_stream return %p\n", pi);
5506  return pi;
5507  }
5508 
5509  /* Handle "'" and "\" first, as they won't play nice with
5510  * i_peek_and_eat_bkslash_nl() anyway:
5511  * echo z\\
5512  * and
5513  * echo '\
5514  * '
5515  * would break.
5516  */
5517  if (ch == '\\') {
5518  ch = i_getch(input);
5519  if (ch == '\n')
5520  continue; /* drop <newline>, get next char */
5521  nommu_addchr(&ctx.as_string, '\\');
5522  if (ch == SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL) {
5523  nommu_addchr(&ctx.as_string, ch);
5524  /* Convert \^C to corresponding special variable reference */
5525  goto case_SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL;
5526  }
5527  o_addchr(&ctx.word, '\\');
5528  if (ch == EOF) {
5529  /* Testcase: eval 'echo Ok\' */
5530  /* bash-4.3.43 was removing backslash,
5531  * but 4.4.19 retains it, most other shells too
5532  */
5533  continue; /* get next char */
5534  }
5535  /* Example: echo Hello \2>file
5536  * we need to know that word 2 is quoted
5537  */
5538  ctx.word.has_quoted_part = 1;
5539  nommu_addchr(&ctx.as_string, ch);
5540  o_addchr(&ctx.word, ch);
5541  continue; /* get next char */
5542  }
5543  nommu_addchr(&ctx.as_string, ch);
5544  if (ch == '\'') {
5545  ctx.word.has_quoted_part = 1;
5546  next = i_getch(input);
5547  if (next == '\'' && !ctx.pending_redirect)
5548  goto insert_empty_quoted_str_marker;
5549 
5550  ch = next;
5551  while (1) {
5552  if (ch == EOF) {
5553  syntax_error_unterm_ch('\'');
5554  goto parse_error_exitcode1;
5555  }
5556  nommu_addchr(&ctx.as_string, ch);
5557  if (ch == '\'')
5558  break;
5559  if (ch == SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL) {
5560  /* Convert raw ^C to corresponding special variable reference */
5561  o_addchr(&ctx.word, SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL);
5562  o_addchr(&ctx.word, SPECIAL_VAR_QUOTED_SVS);
5563  }
5564  o_addqchr(&ctx.word, ch);
5565  ch = i_getch(input);
5566  }
5567  continue; /* get next char */
5568  }
5569 
5570  next = '\0';
5571  if (ch != '\n')
5572  next = i_peek_and_eat_bkslash_nl(input);
5573 
5574  is_special = "{}<>&|();#" /* special outside of "str" */
5575  "$\"" IF_HUSH_TICK("`") /* always special */
5576  SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL_STR;
5577 #if defined(CMD_TEST2_SINGLEWORD_NOGLOB)
5578  if (ctx.command->cmd_type == CMD_TEST2_SINGLEWORD_NOGLOB) {
5579  /* In [[ ]], {}<>&|() are not special */
5580  is_special += 8;
5581  } else
5582 #endif
5583  /* Are { and } special here? */
5584  if (ctx.command->argv /* word [word]{... - non-special */
5585  || ctx.word.length /* word{... - non-special */
5586  || ctx.word.has_quoted_part /* ""{... - non-special */
5587  || (next != ';' /* }; - special */
5588  && next != ')' /* }) - special */
5589  && next != '(' /* {( - special */
5590  && next != '&' /* }& and }&& ... - special */
5591  && next != '|' /* }|| ... - special */
5592  && !strchr(defifs, next) /* {word - non-special */
5593  )
5594  ) {
5595  /* They are not special, skip "{}" */
5596  is_special += 2;
5597  }
5598  is_special = strchr(is_special, ch);
5599  is_blank = strchr(defifs, ch);
5600 
5601  if (!is_special && !is_blank) { /* ordinary char */
5602  ordinary_char:
5603  o_addQchr(&ctx.word, ch);
5604  if ((ctx.is_assignment == MAYBE_ASSIGNMENT
5605  || ctx.is_assignment == WORD_IS_KEYWORD)
5606  && ch == '='
5607  && endofname(ctx.word.data)[0] == '='
5608  ) {
5609  ctx.is_assignment = DEFINITELY_ASSIGNMENT;
5610  debug_printf_parse("ctx.is_assignment='%s'\n", assignment_flag[ctx.is_assignment]);
5611  }
5612  continue;
5613  }
5614 
5615  if (is_blank) {
5616 #if ENABLE_HUSH_LINENO_VAR
5617 /* Case:
5618  * "while ...; do<whitespace><newline>
5619  * cmd ..."
5620  * would think that "cmd" starts in <whitespace> -
5621  * i.e., at the previous line.
5622  * We need to skip all whitespace before newlines.
5623  */
5624  while (ch != '\n') {
5625  next = i_peek(input);
5626  if (next != ' ' && next != '\t' && next != '\n')
5627  break; /* next char is not ws */
5628  ch = i_getch(input);
5629  }
5630  /* ch == last eaten whitespace char */
5631 #endif
5632  if (done_word(&ctx)) {
5633  goto parse_error_exitcode1;
5634  }
5635  if (ch == '\n') {
5636  /* Is this a case when newline is simply ignored?
5637  * Some examples:
5638  * "cmd | <newline> cmd ..."
5639  * "case ... in <newline> word) ..."
5640  */
5641  if (IS_NULL_CMD(ctx.command)
5642  && ctx.word.length == 0
5643  && !ctx.word.has_quoted_part
5644  && heredoc_cnt == 0
5645  ) {
5646  /* This newline can be ignored. But...
5647  * Without check #1, interactive shell
5648  * ignores even bare <newline>,
5649  * and shows the continuation prompt:
5650  * ps1_prompt$ <enter>
5651  * ps2> _ <=== wrong, should be ps1
5652  * Without check #2, "cmd & <newline>"
5653  * is similarly mistreated.
5654  * (BTW, this makes "cmd & cmd"
5655  * and "cmd && cmd" non-orthogonal.
5656  * Really, ask yourself, why
5657  * "cmd && <newline>" doesn't start
5658  * cmd but waits for more input?
5659  * The only reason is that it might be
5660  * a "cmd1 && <nl> cmd2 &" construct,
5661  * cmd1 may need to run in BG).
5662  */
5663  struct pipe *pi = ctx.list_head;
5664  if (pi->num_cmds != 0 /* check #1 */
5665  && pi->followup != PIPE_BG /* check #2 */
5666  ) {
5667  continue;
5668  }
5669  }
5670  /* Treat newline as a command separator. */
5671  done_pipe(&ctx, PIPE_SEQ);
5672  debug_printf_heredoc("heredoc_cnt:%d\n", heredoc_cnt);
5673  if (heredoc_cnt) {
5674  heredoc_cnt = fetch_heredocs(&ctx.as_string, ctx.list_head, heredoc_cnt, input);
5675  if (heredoc_cnt != 0)
5676  goto parse_error_exitcode1;
5677  }
5678  ctx.is_assignment = MAYBE_ASSIGNMENT;
5679  debug_printf_parse("ctx.is_assignment='%s'\n", assignment_flag[ctx.is_assignment]);
5680  ch = ';';
5681  /* note: if (is_blank) continue;
5682  * will still trigger for us */
5683  }
5684  }
5685 
5686  /* "cmd}" or "cmd }..." without semicolon or &:
5687  * } is an ordinary char in this case, even inside { cmd; }
5688  * Pathological example: { ""}; } should exec "}" cmd
5689  */
5690  if (ch == '}') {
5691  if (ctx.word.length != 0 /* word} */
5692  || ctx.word.has_quoted_part /* ""} */
5693  ) {
5694  goto ordinary_char;
5695  }
5696  if (!IS_NULL_CMD(ctx.command)) { /* cmd } */
5697  /* Generally, there should be semicolon: "cmd; }"
5698  * However, bash allows to omit it if "cmd" is
5699  * a group. Examples:
5700  * { { echo 1; } }
5701  * {(echo 1)}
5702  * { echo 0 >&2 | { echo 1; } }
5703  * { while false; do :; done }
5704  * { case a in b) ;; esac }
5705  */
5706  if (ctx.command->group)
5707  goto term_group;
5708  goto ordinary_char;
5709  }
5710  if (!IS_NULL_PIPE(ctx.pipe)) /* cmd | } */
5711  /* Can't be an end of {cmd}, skip the check */
5712  goto skip_end_trigger;
5713  /* else: } does terminate a group */
5714  }
5715  term_group:
5716  if (end_trigger && end_trigger == ch
5717  && (ch != ';' || heredoc_cnt == 0)
5718 #if ENABLE_HUSH_CASE
5719  && (ch != ')'
5720  || ctx.ctx_res_w != RES_MATCH
5721  || (!ctx.word.has_quoted_part && strcmp(ctx.word.data, "esac") == 0)
5722  )
5723 #endif
5724  ) {
5725  if (done_word(&ctx)) {
5726  goto parse_error_exitcode1;
5727  }
5728  done_pipe(&ctx, PIPE_SEQ);
5729  ctx.is_assignment = MAYBE_ASSIGNMENT;
5730  debug_printf_parse("ctx.is_assignment='%s'\n", assignment_flag[ctx.is_assignment]);
5731  /* Do we sit outside of any if's, loops or case's? */
5732  if (!HAS_KEYWORDS
5733  IF_HAS_KEYWORDS(|| (ctx.ctx_res_w == RES_NONE && ctx.old_flag == 0))
5734  ) {
5735  o_free_and_set_NULL(&ctx.word);
5736 #if !BB_MMU
5737  debug_printf_parse("as_string2 '%s'\n", ctx.as_string.data);
5738  if (pstring)
5739  *pstring = ctx.as_string.data;
5740  else
5741  o_free(&ctx.as_string);
5742 #endif
5743  if (ch != ';' && IS_NULL_PIPE(ctx.list_head)) {
5744  /* Example: bare "{ }", "()" */
5745  G.last_exitcode = 2; /* bash compat */
5746  syntax_error_unexpected_ch(ch);
5747  goto parse_error;
5748  }
5749  if (heredoc_cnt_ptr)
5750  *heredoc_cnt_ptr = heredoc_cnt;
5751  debug_printf_heredoc("parse_stream return heredoc_cnt:%d\n", heredoc_cnt);
5752  debug_printf_parse("parse_stream return %p: "
5753  "end_trigger char found\n",
5754  ctx.list_head);
5755  debug_leave();
5756  return ctx.list_head;
5757  }
5758  }
5759 
5760  if (is_blank)
5761  continue;
5762 
5763  /* Catch <, > before deciding whether this word is
5764  * an assignment. a=1 2>z b=2: b=2 is still assignment */
5765  switch (ch) {
5766  case '>':
5767  redir_fd = redirect_opt_num(&ctx.word);
5768  if (done_word(&ctx)) {
5769  goto parse_error_exitcode1;
5770  }
5771  redir_style = REDIRECT_OVERWRITE;
5772  if (next == '>') {
5773  redir_style = REDIRECT_APPEND;
5774  ch = i_getch(input);
5775  nommu_addchr(&ctx.as_string, ch);
5776  }
5777 #if 0
5778  else if (next == '(') {
5779  syntax_error(">(process) not supported");
5780  goto parse_error_exitcode1;
5781  }
5782 #endif
5783  if (parse_redirect(&ctx, redir_fd, redir_style, input))
5784  goto parse_error_exitcode1;
5785  continue; /* get next char */
5786  case '<':
5787  redir_fd = redirect_opt_num(&ctx.word);
5788  if (done_word(&ctx)) {
5789  goto parse_error_exitcode1;
5790  }
5791  redir_style = REDIRECT_INPUT;
5792  if (next == '<') {
5793  redir_style = REDIRECT_HEREDOC;
5794  heredoc_cnt++;
5795  debug_printf_heredoc("++heredoc_cnt=%d\n", heredoc_cnt);
5796  ch = i_getch(input);
5797  nommu_addchr(&ctx.as_string, ch);
5798  } else if (next == '>') {
5799  redir_style = REDIRECT_IO;
5800  ch = i_getch(input);
5801  nommu_addchr(&ctx.as_string, ch);
5802  }
5803 #if 0
5804  else if (next == '(') {
5805  syntax_error("<(process) not supported");
5806  goto parse_error_exitcode1;
5807  }
5808 #endif
5809  if (parse_redirect(&ctx, redir_fd, redir_style, input))
5810  goto parse_error_exitcode1;
5811  continue; /* get next char */
5812  case '#':
5813  if (ctx.word.length == 0 && !ctx.word.has_quoted_part) {
5814  /* skip "#comment" */
5815  /* note: we do not add it to &ctx.as_string */
5816 /* TODO: in bash:
5817  * comment inside $() goes to the next \n, even inside quoted string (!):
5818  * cmd "$(cmd2 #comment)" - syntax error
5819  * cmd "`cmd2 #comment`" - ok
5820  * We accept both (comment ends where command subst ends, in both cases).
5821  */
5822  while (1) {
5823  ch = i_peek(input);
5824  if (ch == '\n') {
5825  nommu_addchr(&ctx.as_string, '\n');
5826  break;
5827  }
5828  ch = i_getch(input);
5829  if (ch == EOF)
5830  break;
5831  }
5832  continue; /* get next char */
5833  }
5834  break;
5835  }
5836  skip_end_trigger:
5837 
5838  if (ctx.is_assignment == MAYBE_ASSIGNMENT
5839  /* check that we are not in word in "a=1 2>word b=1": */
5840  && !ctx.pending_redirect
5841  ) {
5842  /* ch is a special char and thus this word
5843  * cannot be an assignment */
5844  ctx.is_assignment = NOT_ASSIGNMENT;
5845  debug_printf_parse("ctx.is_assignment='%s'\n", assignment_flag[ctx.is_assignment]);
5846  }
5847 
5848  /* Note: nommu_addchr(&ctx.as_string, ch) is already done */
5849 
5850  switch (ch) {
5851  case_SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL:
5852  case SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL:
5853  /* Convert raw ^C to corresponding special variable reference */
5854  o_addchr(&ctx.word, SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL);
5855  o_addchr(&ctx.word, SPECIAL_VAR_QUOTED_SVS);
5856  /* fall through */
5857  case '#':
5858  /* non-comment #: "echo a#b" etc */
5859  o_addchr(&ctx.word, ch);
5860  continue; /* get next char */
5861  case '$':
5862  if (parse_dollar_squote(&ctx.as_string, &ctx.word, input))
5863  continue; /* get next char */
5864  if (!parse_dollar(&ctx.as_string, &ctx.word, input, /*quote_mask:*/ 0)) {
5865  debug_printf_parse("parse_stream parse error: "
5866  "parse_dollar returned 0 (error)\n");
5867  goto parse_error_exitcode1;
5868  }
5869  continue; /* get next char */
5870  case '"':
5871  ctx.word.has_quoted_part = 1;
5872  if (next == '"' && !ctx.pending_redirect) {
5873  i_getch(input); /* eat second " */
5874  insert_empty_quoted_str_marker:
5875  nommu_addchr(&ctx.as_string, next);
5876  o_addchr(&ctx.word, SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL);
5877  o_addchr(&ctx.word, SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL);
5878  continue; /* get next char */
5879  }
5880  if (ctx.is_assignment == NOT_ASSIGNMENT)
5881  ctx.word.o_expflags |= EXP_FLAG_ESC_GLOB_CHARS;
5882  if (!encode_string(&ctx.as_string, &ctx.word, input, '"'))
5883  goto parse_error_exitcode1;
5884  ctx.word.o_expflags &= ~EXP_FLAG_ESC_GLOB_CHARS;
5885  continue; /* get next char */
5886 #if ENABLE_HUSH_TICK
5887  case '`': {
5888  USE_FOR_NOMMU(unsigned pos;)
5889 
5890  o_addchr(&ctx.word, SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL);
5891  o_addchr(&ctx.word, '`');
5892  USE_FOR_NOMMU(pos = ctx.word.length;)
5893  if (!add_till_backquote(&ctx.word, input, /*in_dquote:*/ 0))
5894  goto parse_error_exitcode1;
5895 # if !BB_MMU
5896  o_addstr(&ctx.as_string, ctx.word.data + pos);
5897  o_addchr(&ctx.as_string, '`');
5898 # endif
5899  o_addchr(&ctx.word, SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL);
5900  //debug_printf_subst("SUBST RES3 '%s'\n", ctx.word.data + pos);
5901  continue; /* get next char */
5902  }
5903 #endif
5904  case ';':
5905 #if ENABLE_HUSH_CASE
5906  case_semi:
5907 #endif
5908  if (done_word(&ctx)) {
5909  goto parse_error_exitcode1;
5910  }
5911  done_pipe(&ctx, PIPE_SEQ);
5912 #if ENABLE_HUSH_CASE
5913  /* Eat multiple semicolons, detect
5914  * whether it means something special */
5915  while (1) {
5916  ch = i_peek_and_eat_bkslash_nl(input);
5917  if (ch != ';')
5918  break;
5919  ch = i_getch(input);
5920  nommu_addchr(&ctx.as_string, ch);
5921  if (ctx.ctx_res_w == RES_CASE_BODY) {
5922  ctx.ctx_dsemicolon = 1;
5923  ctx.ctx_res_w = RES_MATCH;
5924  break;
5925  }
5926  }
5927 #endif
5928  new_cmd:
5929  /* We just finished a cmd. New one may start
5930  * with an assignment */
5931  ctx.is_assignment = MAYBE_ASSIGNMENT;
5932  debug_printf_parse("ctx.is_assignment='%s'\n", assignment_flag[ctx.is_assignment]);
5933  continue; /* get next char */
5934  case '&':
5935  if (done_word(&ctx)) {
5936  goto parse_error_exitcode1;
5937  }
5938  if (next == '&') {
5939  ch = i_getch(input);
5940  nommu_addchr(&ctx.as_string, ch);
5941  done_pipe(&ctx, PIPE_AND);
5942  } else {
5943  done_pipe(&ctx, PIPE_BG);
5944  }
5945  goto new_cmd;
5946  case '|':
5947  if (done_word(&ctx)) {
5948  goto parse_error_exitcode1;
5949  }
5950 #if ENABLE_HUSH_CASE
5951  if (ctx.ctx_res_w == RES_MATCH)
5952  break; /* we are in case's "word | word)" */
5953 #endif
5954  if (next == '|') { /* || */
5955  ch = i_getch(input);
5956  nommu_addchr(&ctx.as_string, ch);
5957  done_pipe(&ctx, PIPE_OR);
5958  } else {
5959  /* we could pick up a file descriptor choice here
5960  * with redirect_opt_num(), but bash doesn't do it.
5961  * "echo foo 2| cat" yields "foo 2". */
5962  done_command(&ctx);
5963  }
5964  goto new_cmd;
5965  case '(':
5966 #if ENABLE_HUSH_CASE
5967  /* "case... in [(]word)..." - skip '(' */
5968  if (ctx.ctx_res_w == RES_MATCH
5969  && ctx.command->argv == NULL /* not (word|(... */
5970  && ctx.word.length == 0 /* not word(... */
5971  && ctx.word.has_quoted_part == 0 /* not ""(... */
5972  ) {
5973  continue; /* get next char */
5974  }
5975 #endif
5976  /* fall through */
5977  case '{': {
5978  int n = parse_group(&ctx, input, ch);
5979  if (n < 0) {
5980  goto parse_error_exitcode1;
5981  }
5982  debug_printf_heredoc("parse_group done, needs heredocs:%d\n", n);
5983  heredoc_cnt += n;
5984  goto new_cmd;
5985  }
5986  case ')':
5987 #if ENABLE_HUSH_CASE
5988  if (ctx.ctx_res_w == RES_MATCH)
5989  goto case_semi;
5990 #endif
5991  case '}':
5992  /* proper use of this character is caught by end_trigger:
5993  * if we see {, we call parse_group(..., end_trigger='}')
5994  * and it will match } earlier (not here). */
5995  G.last_exitcode = 2;
5996  syntax_error_unexpected_ch(ch);
5997  goto parse_error;
5998  default:
5999  if (HUSH_DEBUG)
6000  bb_error_msg_and_die("BUG: unexpected %c", ch);
6001  }
6002  } /* while (1) */
6003 
6004  parse_error_exitcode1:
6005  G.last_exitcode = 1;
6006  parse_error:
6007  {
6008  struct parse_context *pctx;
6009  IF_HAS_KEYWORDS(struct parse_context *p2;)
6010 
6011  /* Clean up allocated tree.
6012  * Sample for finding leaks on syntax error recovery path.
6013  * Run it from interactive shell, watch pmap `pidof hush`.
6014  * while if false; then false; fi; do break; fi
6015  * Samples to catch leaks at execution:
6016  * while if (true | { true;}); then echo ok; fi; do break; done
6017  * while if (true | { true;}); then echo ok; fi; do (if echo ok; break; then :; fi) | cat; break; done
6018  */
6019  pctx = &ctx;
6020  do {
6021  /* Update pipe/command counts,
6022  * otherwise freeing may miss some */
6023  done_pipe(pctx, PIPE_SEQ);
6024  debug_printf_clean("freeing list %p from ctx %p\n",
6025  pctx->list_head, pctx);
6026  debug_print_tree(pctx->list_head, 0);
6027  free_pipe_list(pctx->list_head);
6028  debug_printf_clean("freed list %p\n", pctx->list_head);
6029 #if !BB_MMU
6030  o_free(&pctx->as_string);
6031 #endif
6032  IF_HAS_KEYWORDS(p2 = pctx->stack;)
6033  if (pctx != &ctx) {
6034  free(pctx);
6035  }
6036  IF_HAS_KEYWORDS(pctx = p2;)
6037  } while (HAS_KEYWORDS && pctx);
6038 
6039  o_free(&ctx.word);
6040 #if !BB_MMU
6041  if (pstring)
6042  *pstring = NULL;
6043 #endif
6044  debug_leave();
6045  return ERR_PTR;
6046  }
6047 }

◆ perform_glob()

static int perform_glob ( o_string *  o,
int  n 
)
static

Definition at line 3509 of file hush.c.

3510 {
3511  glob_t globdata;
3512  int gr;
3513  char *pattern;
3514 
3515  debug_printf_glob("start perform_glob: n:%d o->data:%p\n", n, o->data);
3516  if (!o->data)
3517  return o_save_ptr_helper(o, n);
3518  pattern = o->data + o_get_last_ptr(o, n);
3519  debug_printf_glob("glob pattern '%s'\n", pattern);
3520  if (!glob_needed(pattern)) {
3521  literal:
3522  /* unbackslash last string in o in place, fix length */
3523  o->length = unbackslash(pattern) - o->data;
3524  debug_printf_glob("glob pattern '%s' is literal\n", pattern);
3525  return o_save_ptr_helper(o, n);
3526  }
3527 
3528  memset(&globdata, 0, sizeof(globdata));
3529  /* Can't use GLOB_NOCHECK: it does not unescape the string.
3530  * If we glob "*.\*" and don't find anything, we need
3531  * to fall back to using literal "*.*", but GLOB_NOCHECK
3532  * will return "*.\*"!
3533  */
3534  gr = glob(pattern, 0, NULL, &globdata);
3535  debug_printf_glob("glob('%s'):%d\n", pattern, gr);
3536  if (gr != 0) {
3537  if (gr == GLOB_NOMATCH) {
3538  globfree(&globdata);
3539  goto literal;
3540  }
3541  if (gr == GLOB_NOSPACE)
3542  bb_die_memory_exhausted();
3543  /* GLOB_ABORTED? Only happens with GLOB_ERR flag,
3544  * but we didn't specify it. Paranoia again. */
3545  bb_error_msg_and_die("glob error %d on '%s'", gr, pattern);
3546  }
3547  if (globdata.gl_pathv && globdata.gl_pathv[0]) {
3548  char **argv = globdata.gl_pathv;
3549  /* "forget" pattern in o */
3550  o->length = pattern - o->data;
3551  while (1) {
3552  o_addstr_with_NUL(o, *argv);
3553  n = o_save_ptr_helper(o, n);
3554  argv++;
3555  if (!*argv)
3556  break;
3557  }
3558  }
3559  globfree(&globdata);
3560  if (DEBUG_GLOB)
3561  debug_print_list("perform_glob returning", o, n);
3562  return n;
3563 }

static sighandler_t pick_sighandler ( unsigned  sig)
static

Definition at line 2047 of file hush.c.

2048 {
2049  sighandler_t handler = SIG_DFL;
2050  if (sig < sizeof(unsigned)*8) {
2051  unsigned sigmask = (1 << sig);
2052 
2053 #if ENABLE_HUSH_JOB
2054  /* is sig fatal? */
2055  if (G_fatal_sig_mask & sigmask)
2056  handler = sigexit;
2057  else
2058 #endif
2059  /* sig has special handling? */
2060  if (G.special_sig_mask & sigmask) {
2061  handler = record_pending_signo;
2062  /* TTIN/TTOU/TSTP can't be set to record_pending_signo
2063  * in order to ignore them: they will be raised
2064  * in an endless loop when we try to do some
2065  * terminal ioctls! We do have to _ignore_ these.
2066  */
2067  if (SPECIAL_JOBSTOP_SIGS & sigmask)
2068  handler = SIG_IGN;
2069  }
2070  }
2071  return handler;
2072 }

◆ process_wait_result()

static int process_wait_result ( struct pipe *  fg_pipe,
pid_t  childpid,
int  status 
)
static

Definition at line 8923 of file hush.c.

8924 {
8925 #if ENABLE_HUSH_JOB
8926  struct pipe *pi;
8927 #endif
8928  int i, dead;
8929 
8930  dead = WIFEXITED(status) || WIFSIGNALED(status);
8931 
8932 #if DEBUG_JOBS
8933  if (WIFSTOPPED(status))
8934  debug_printf_jobs("pid %d stopped by sig %d (exitcode %d)\n",
8935  childpid, WSTOPSIG(status), WEXITSTATUS(status));
8936  if (WIFSIGNALED(status))
8937  debug_printf_jobs("pid %d killed by sig %d (exitcode %d)\n",
8938  childpid, WTERMSIG(status), WEXITSTATUS(status));
8939  if (WIFEXITED(status))
8940  debug_printf_jobs("pid %d exited, exitcode %d\n",
8941  childpid, WEXITSTATUS(status));
8942 #endif
8943  /* Were we asked to wait for a fg pipe? */
8944  if (fg_pipe) {
8945  i = fg_pipe->num_cmds;
8946 
8947  while (--i >= 0) {
8948  int rcode;
8949 
8950  debug_printf_jobs("check pid %d\n", fg_pipe->cmds[i].pid);
8951  if (fg_pipe->cmds[i].pid != childpid)
8952  continue;
8953  if (dead) {
8954  int ex;
8955  fg_pipe->cmds[i].pid = 0;
8956  fg_pipe->alive_cmds--;
8957  ex = WEXITSTATUS(status);
8958  /* bash prints killer signal's name for *last*
8959  * process in pipe (prints just newline for SIGINT/SIGPIPE).
8960  * Mimic this. Example: "sleep 5" + (^\ or kill -QUIT)
8961  */
8962  if (WIFSIGNALED(status)) {
8963  int sig = WTERMSIG(status);
8964 #if ENABLE_HUSH_JOB
8965  if (G.run_list_level == 1
8966  /* ^^^^^ Do not print in nested contexts, example:
8967  * echo `sleep 1; sh -c 'kill -9 $$'` - prints "137", NOT "Killed 137"
8968  */
8969  && i == fg_pipe->num_cmds-1
8970  ) {
8971  /* strsignal() is for bash compat. ~600 bloat versus bbox's get_signame() */
8972  puts(sig == SIGINT || sig == SIGPIPE ? "" : strsignal(sig));
8973  }
8974 #endif
8975  /* TODO: if (WCOREDUMP(status)) + " (core dumped)"; */
8976  /* MIPS has 128 sigs (1..128), if sig==128,
8977  * 128 + sig would result in exitcode 256 -> 0!
8978  */
8979  ex = 128 | sig;
8980  }
8981  fg_pipe->cmds[i].cmd_exitcode = ex;
8982  } else {
8983  fg_pipe->stopped_cmds++;
8984  }
8985  debug_printf_jobs("fg_pipe: alive_cmds %d stopped_cmds %d\n",
8986  fg_pipe->alive_cmds, fg_pipe->stopped_cmds);
8987  rcode = job_exited_or_stopped(fg_pipe);
8988  if (rcode >= 0) {
8989 /* Note: *non-interactive* bash does not continue if all processes in fg pipe
8990  * are stopped. Testcase: "cat | cat" in a script (not on command line!)
8991  * and "killall -STOP cat" */
8992  if (G_interactive_fd) {
8993 #if ENABLE_HUSH_JOB
8994  if (fg_pipe->alive_cmds != 0)
8995  insert_job_into_table(fg_pipe);
8996 #endif
8997  return rcode;
8998  }
8999  if (fg_pipe->alive_cmds == 0)
9000  return rcode;
9001  }
9002  /* There are still running processes in the fg_pipe */
9003  return -1;
9004  }
9005  /* It wasn't in fg_pipe, look for process in bg pipes */
9006  }
9007 
9008 #if ENABLE_HUSH_JOB
9009  /* We were asked to wait for bg or orphaned children */
9010  /* No need to remember exitcode in this case */
9011  for (pi = G.job_list; pi; pi = pi->next) {
9012  for (i = 0; i < pi->num_cmds; i++) {
9013  if (pi->cmds[i].pid == childpid)
9014  goto found_pi_and_prognum;
9015  }
9016  }
9017  /* Happens when shell is used as init process (init=/bin/sh) */
9018  debug_printf("checkjobs: pid %d was not in our list!\n", childpid);
9019  return -1; /* this wasn't a process from fg_pipe */
9020 
9021  found_pi_and_prognum:
9022  if (dead) {
9023  /* child exited */
9024  int rcode = WEXITSTATUS(status);
9025  if (WIFSIGNALED(status))
9026  /* NB: not 128 + sig, MIPS has sig 128 */
9027  rcode = 128 | WTERMSIG(status);
9028  pi->cmds[i].cmd_exitcode = rcode;
9029  if (G.last_bg_pid == pi->cmds[i].pid)
9030  G.last_bg_pid_exitcode = rcode;
9031  pi->cmds[i].pid = 0;
9032  pi->alive_cmds--;
9033  if (!pi->alive_cmds) {
9034 # if ENABLE_HUSH_BASH_COMPAT
9035  G.dead_job_exitcode = job_exited_or_stopped(pi);
9036 # endif
9037  if (G_interactive_fd) {
9038  printf(JOB_STATUS_FORMAT, pi->jobid,
9039  "Done", pi->cmdtext);
9040  delete_finished_job(pi);
9041  } else {
9042 /*
9043  * bash deletes finished jobs from job table only in interactive mode,
9044  * after "jobs" cmd, or if pid of a new process matches one of the old ones
9045  * (see cleanup_dead_jobs(), delete_old_job(), J_NOTIFIED in bash source).
9046  * Testcase script: "(exit 3) & sleep 1; wait %1; echo $?" prints 3 in bash.
9047  * We only retain one "dead" job, if it's the single job on the list.
9048  * This covers most of real-world scenarios where this is useful.
9049  */
9050  if (pi != G.job_list)
9051  delete_finished_job(pi);
9052  }
9053  }
9054  } else {
9055  /* child stopped */
9056  pi->stopped_cmds++;
9057  }
9058 #endif
9059  return -1; /* this wasn't a process from fg_pipe */
9060 }

◆ pseudo_exec_argv()

static NOINLINE void pseudo_exec_argv ( nommu_save_t *  nommu_save,
char **  argv,
int  assignment_cnt,
char **  argv_expanded 
)
static

Definition at line 8603 of file hush.c.

8606 {
8607  const struct built_in_command *x;
8608  struct variable **sv_shadowed;
8609  char **new_env;
8610  IF_HUSH_COMMAND(char opt_vV = 0;)
8611  IF_HUSH_FUNCTIONS(const struct function *funcp;)
8612 
8613  new_env = expand_assignments(argv, assignment_cnt);
8614  dump_cmd_in_x_mode(new_env);
8615 
8616  if (!argv[assignment_cnt]) {
8617  /* Case when we are here: ... | var=val | ...
8618  * (note that we do not exit early, i.e., do not optimize out
8619  * expand_assignments(): think about ... | var=`sleep 1` | ...
8620  */
8621  free_strings(new_env);
8622  _exit_SUCCESS();
8623  }
8624 
8625  sv_shadowed = G.shadowed_vars_pp;
8626 #if BB_MMU
8627  G.shadowed_vars_pp = NULL; /* "don't save, free them instead" */
8628 #else
8629  G.shadowed_vars_pp = &nommu_save->old_vars;
8630  G.var_nest_level++;
8631 #endif
8632  set_vars_and_save_old(new_env);
8633  G.shadowed_vars_pp = sv_shadowed;
8634 
8635  if (argv_expanded) {
8636  argv = argv_expanded;
8637  } else {
8638  argv = expand_strvec_to_strvec(argv + assignment_cnt);
8639 #if !BB_MMU
8640  nommu_save->argv = argv;
8641 #endif
8642  }
8643  dump_cmd_in_x_mode(argv);
8644 
8645 #if ENABLE_FEATURE_SH_STANDALONE || BB_MMU
8646  if (strchr(argv[0], '/') != NULL)
8647  goto skip;
8648 #endif
8649 
8650 #if ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
8651  /* Check if the command matches any functions (this goes before bltins) */
8652  funcp = find_function(argv[0]);
8653  if (funcp)
8654  exec_function(&nommu_save->argv_from_re_execing, funcp, argv);
8655 #endif
8656 
8657 #if ENABLE_HUSH_COMMAND
8658  /* "command BAR": run BAR without looking it up among functions
8659  * "command -v BAR": print "BAR" or "/path/to/BAR"; or exit 1
8660  * "command -V BAR": print "BAR is {a function,a shell builtin,/path/to/BAR}"
8661  */
8662  while (strcmp(argv[0], "command") == 0 && argv[1]) {
8663  char *p;
8664 
8665  argv++;
8666  p = *argv;
8667  if (p[0] != '-' || !p[1])
8668  continue; /* bash allows "command command command [-OPT] BAR" */
8669 
8670  for (;;) {
8671  p++;
8672  switch (*p) {
8673  case '\0':
8674  argv++;
8675  p = *argv;
8676  if (p[0] != '-' || !p[1])
8677  goto after_opts;
8678  continue; /* next arg is also -opts, process it too */
8679  case 'v':
8680  case 'V':
8681  opt_vV = *p;
8682  continue;
8683  default:
8684  bb_error_msg_and_die("%s: %s: invalid option", "command", argv[0]);
8685  }
8686  }
8687  }
8688  after_opts:
8689 # if ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
8690  if (opt_vV && find_function(argv[0]))
8691  if_command_vV_print_and_exit(opt_vV, argv[0], "a function");
8692 # endif
8693 #endif
8694 
8695  /* Check if the command matches any of the builtins.
8696  * Depending on context, this might be redundant. But it's
8697  * easier to waste a few CPU cycles than it is to figure out
8698  * if this is one of those cases.
8699  */
8700  /* Why "BB_MMU ? :" difference in logic? -
8701  * On NOMMU, it is more expensive to re-execute shell
8702  * just in order to run echo or test builtin.
8703  * It's better to skip it here and run corresponding
8704  * non-builtin later. */
8705  x = BB_MMU ? find_builtin(argv[0]) : find_builtin1(argv[0]);
8706  if (x) {
8707  if_command_vV_print_and_exit(opt_vV, argv[0], "a shell builtin");
8708  exec_builtin(&nommu_save->argv_from_re_execing, x, argv);
8709  }
8710 
8711 #if ENABLE_FEATURE_SH_STANDALONE
8712  /* Check if the command matches any busybox applets */
8713  {
8714  int a = find_applet_by_name(argv[0]);
8715  if (a >= 0) {
8716  if_command_vV_print_and_exit(opt_vV, argv[0], "an applet");
8717 # if BB_MMU /* see above why on NOMMU it is not allowed */
8718  if (APPLET_IS_NOEXEC(a)) {
8719  /* Do not leak open fds from opened script files etc.
8720  * Testcase: interactive "ls -l /proc/self/fd"
8721  * should not show tty fd open.
8722  */
8723  close_saved_fds_and_FILE_fds();
8724 //FIXME: should also close saved redir fds
8725 //This casuses test failures in
8726 //redir_children_should_not_see_saved_fd_2.tests
8727 //redir_children_should_not_see_saved_fd_3.tests
8728 //if you replace "busybox find" with just "find" in them
8729  /* Without this, "rm -i FILE" can't be ^C'ed: */
8730  switch_off_special_sigs(G.special_sig_mask);
8731  debug_printf_exec("running applet '%s'\n", argv[0]);
8732  run_noexec_applet_and_exit(a, argv[0], argv);
8733  }
8734 # endif
8735  /* Re-exec ourselves */
8736  debug_printf_exec("re-execing applet '%s'\n", argv[0]);
8737  /* Don't propagate SIG_IGN to the child */
8738  if (SPECIAL_JOBSTOP_SIGS != 0)
8739  switch_off_special_sigs(G.special_sig_mask & SPECIAL_JOBSTOP_SIGS);
8740  execv(bb_busybox_exec_path, argv);
8741  /* If they called chroot or otherwise made the binary no longer
8742  * executable, fall through */
8743  }
8744  }
8745 #endif
8746 
8747 #if ENABLE_FEATURE_SH_STANDALONE || BB_MMU
8748  skip:
8749 #endif
8750  if_command_vV_print_and_exit(opt_vV, argv[0], NULL);
8751  execvp_or_die(argv);
8752 }

◆ re_execute_shell()

static void re_execute_shell ( char ***  to_free,
const char *  s,

char **  builtin_argv 
)

Definition at line 7394 of file hush.c.

7397 {
7398 # define NOMMU_HACK_FMT ("-$%x:%x:%x:%x:%x:%llx" IF_HUSH_LOOPS(":%x"))
7399  /* delims + 2 * (number of bytes in printed hex numbers) */
7400  char param_buf[sizeof(NOMMU_HACK_FMT) + 2 * (sizeof(int)*6 + sizeof(long long)*1)];
7401  char *heredoc_argv[4];
7402  struct variable *cur;
7403 # if ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
7404  struct function *funcp;
7405 # endif
7406  char **argv, **pp;
7407  unsigned cnt;
7408  unsigned long long empty_trap_mask;
7409 
7410  if (!g_argv0) { /* heredoc */
7411  argv = heredoc_argv;
7412  argv[0] = (char *) G.argv0_for_re_execing;
7413  argv[1] = (char *) "-<";
7414  argv[2] = (char *) s;
7415  argv[3] = NULL;
7416  pp = &argv[3]; /* used as pointer to empty environment */
7417  goto do_exec;
7418  }
7419 
7420  cnt = 0;
7421  pp = builtin_argv;
7422  if (pp) while (*pp++)
7423  cnt++;
7424 
7425  empty_trap_mask = 0;
7426  if (G_traps) {
7427  int sig;
7428  for (sig = 1; sig < NSIG; sig++) {
7429  if (G_traps[sig] && !G_traps[sig][0])
7430  empty_trap_mask |= 1LL << sig;
7431  }
7432  }
7433 
7434  sprintf(param_buf, NOMMU_HACK_FMT
7435  , (unsigned) G.root_pid
7436  , (unsigned) G.root_ppid
7437  , (unsigned) G.last_bg_pid
7438  , (unsigned) G.last_exitcode
7439  , cnt
7440  , empty_trap_mask
7441  IF_HUSH_LOOPS(, G.depth_of_loop)
7442  );
7443 # undef NOMMU_HACK_FMT
7444  /* 1:hush 2:-$<pid>:<pid>:<exitcode>:<etc...> <vars...> <funcs...>
7445  * 3:-c 4:<cmd> 5:<arg0> <argN...> 6:NULL
7446  */
7447  cnt += 6;
7448  for (cur = G.top_var; cur; cur = cur->next) {
7449  if (!cur->flg_export || cur->flg_read_only)
7450  cnt += 2;
7451  }
7452 # if ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
7453  for (funcp = G.top_func; funcp; funcp = funcp->next)
7454  cnt += 3;
7455 # endif
7456  pp = g_argv;
7457  while (*pp++)
7458  cnt++;
7459  *to_free = argv = pp = xzalloc(sizeof(argv[0]) * cnt);
7460  *pp++ = (char *) G.argv0_for_re_execing;
7461  *pp++ = param_buf;
7462  for (cur = G.top_var; cur; cur = cur->next) {
7463  if (strcmp(cur->varstr, hush_version_str) == 0)
7464  continue;
7465  if (cur->flg_read_only) {
7466  *pp++ = (char *) "-R";
7467  *pp++ = cur->varstr;
7468  } else if (!cur->flg_export) {
7469  *pp++ = (char *) "-V";
7470  *pp++ = cur->varstr;
7471  }
7472  }
7473 # if ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
7474  for (funcp = G.top_func; funcp; funcp = funcp->next) {
7475  *pp++ = (char *) "-F";
7476  *pp++ = funcp->name;
7477  *pp++ = funcp->body_as_string;
7478  }
7479 # endif
7480  /* We can pass activated traps here. Say, -Tnn:trap_string
7481  *
7482  * However, POSIX says that subshells reset signals with traps
7483  * to SIG_DFL.
7484  * I tested bash-3.2 and it not only does that with true subshells
7485  * of the form ( list ), but with any forked children shells.
7486  * I set trap "echo W" WINCH; and then tried:
7487  *
7488  * { echo 1; sleep 20; echo 2; } &
7489  * while true; do echo 1; sleep 20; echo 2; break; done &
7490  * true | { echo 1; sleep 20; echo 2; } | cat
7491  *
7492  * In all these cases sending SIGWINCH to the child shell
7493  * did not run the trap. If I add trap "echo V" WINCH;
7494  * _inside_ group (just before echo 1), it works.
7495  *
7496  * I conclude it means we don't need to pass active traps here.
7497  */
7498  *pp++ = (char *) "-c";
7499  *pp++ = (char *) s;
7500  if (builtin_argv) {
7501  while (*++builtin_argv)
7502  *pp++ = *builtin_argv;
7503  *pp++ = (char *) "";
7504  }
7505  *pp++ = g_argv0;
7506  while (*g_argv)
7507  *pp++ = *g_argv++;
7508  /* *pp = NULL; - is already there */
7509  pp = environ;
7510 
7511  do_exec:
7512  debug_printf_exec("re_execute_shell pid:%d cmd:'%s'\n", getpid(), s);
7513  /* Don't propagate SIG_IGN to the child */
7514  if (SPECIAL_JOBSTOP_SIGS != 0)
7515  switch_off_special_sigs(G.special_sig_mask & SPECIAL_JOBSTOP_SIGS);
7516  execve(bb_busybox_exec_path, argv, pp);
7517  /* Fallback. Useful for init=/bin/hush usage etc */
7518  if (argv[0][0] == '/')
7519  execve(argv[0], argv, pp);
7520  xfunc_error_retval = 127;
7521  bb_simple_error_msg_and_die("can't re-execute the shell");
7522 }

#define NOMMU_HACK_FMT

◆ refill_HFILE_and_getc()

static int refill_HFILE_and_getc ( HFILE *  fp)

Definition at line 1646 of file hush.c.

1647 {
1648  int n;
1649 
1650  if (fp->fd < 0) {
1651  /* Already saw EOF */
1652  return EOF;
1653  }
1654 #if ENABLE_HUSH_INTERACTIVE && !ENABLE_FEATURE_EDITING
1655  /* If user presses ^C, read() restarts after SIGINT (we use SA_RESTART).
1656  * IOW: ^C will not immediately stop line input.
1657  * But poll() is different: it does NOT restart after signals.
1658  */
1659  if (fp == G.HFILE_stdin) {
1660  struct pollfd pfd[1];
1661  pfd[0].fd = fp->fd;
1662  pfd[0].events = POLLIN;
1663  n = poll(pfd, 1, -1);
1664  if (n < 0
1665  /*&& errno == EINTR - assumed true */
1666  && sigismember(&G.pending_set, SIGINT)
1667  ) {
1668  return '\0';
1669  }
1670  }
1671 #else
1672 /* if FEATURE_EDITING=y, we do not use this routine for interactive input */
1673 #endif
1674  /* Try to buffer more input */
1675  n = safe_read(fp->fd, fp->buf, sizeof(fp->buf));
1676  if (n < 0) {
1677  bb_simple_perror_msg("read error");
1678  n = 0;
1679  }
1680  fp->cur = fp->buf;
1681  fp->end = fp->buf + n;
1682  if (n == 0) {
1683  /* EOF/error */
1684  close(fp->fd);
1685  fp->fd = -1;
1686  return EOF;
1687  }
1688  return (unsigned char)(*fp->cur++);
1689 }

7973 {
7974  if (sq) {
7975  int i;
7976  for (i = 0; sq[i].orig_fd >= 0; i++) {
7977  if (sq[i].moved_to >= 0) {
7978  /* We simply die on error */
7979  debug_printf_redir("restoring redirected fd from %d to %d\n", sq[i].moved_to, sq[i].orig_fd);
7980  xmove_fd(sq[i].moved_to, sq[i].orig_fd);
7981  } else {
7982  /* cmd1 9>FILE; cmd2_should_see_fd9_closed */
7983  debug_printf_redir("restoring redirected fd %d: closing it\n", sq[i].orig_fd);
7984  close(sq[i].orig_fd);
7985  }
7986  }
7987  free(sq);
7988  }
7989  if (G.HFILE_stdin
7990  && G.HFILE_stdin->fd > STDIN_FILENO
7991  /* we compare > STDIN, not == STDIN, since hfgetc()
7992  * closes fd and sets ->fd to -1 if EOF is reached.
7993  * Testcase: echo 'pwd' | hush
7994  */
7995  ) {
7996  /* Testcase: interactive "read r <FILE; echo $r; read r; echo $r".
7997  * Redirect moves ->fd to e.g. 10,
7998  * and it is not restored above (we do not restore script fds
7999  * after redirects, we just use new, "moved" fds).
8000  * However for stdin, get_user_input() -> read_line_input(),
8001  * and read builtin, depend on fd == STDIN_FILENO.
8002  */
8003  debug_printf_redir("restoring %d to stdin\n", G.HFILE_stdin->fd);
8004  xmove_fd(G.HFILE_stdin->fd, STDIN_FILENO);
8005  G.HFILE_stdin->fd = STDIN_FILENO;
8006  }

◆ run_list()

static int run_list ( struct pipe *  pi)
static

Definition at line 9694 of file hush.c.

9695 {
9696 #if ENABLE_HUSH_CASE
9697  char *case_word = NULL;
9698 #endif
9699 #if ENABLE_HUSH_LOOPS
9700  struct pipe *loop_top = NULL;
9701  char **for_lcur = NULL;
9702  char **for_list = NULL;
9703 #endif
9704  smallint last_followup;
9705  smalluint rcode;
9706 #if ENABLE_HUSH_IF || ENABLE_HUSH_CASE
9707  smalluint cond_code = 0;
9708 #else
9709  enum { cond_code = 0 };
9710 #endif
9711 #if HAS_KEYWORDS
9712  smallint rword; /* RES_foo */
9713  smallint last_rword; /* ditto */
9714 #endif
9715 
9716  debug_printf_exec("run_list start lvl %d\n", G.run_list_level);
9717  debug_enter();
9718 
9719 #if ENABLE_HUSH_LOOPS
9720  /* Check syntax for "for" */
9721  {
9722  struct pipe *cpipe;
9723  for (cpipe = pi; cpipe; cpipe = cpipe->next) {
9724  if (cpipe->res_word != RES_FOR && cpipe->res_word != RES_IN)
9725  continue;
9726  /* current word is FOR or IN (BOLD in comments below) */
9727  if (cpipe->next == NULL) {
9728  syntax_error("malformed for");
9729  debug_leave();
9730  debug_printf_exec("run_list lvl %d return 1\n", G.run_list_level);
9731  return 1;
9732  }
9733  /* "FOR v; do ..." and "for v IN a b; do..." are ok */
9734  if (cpipe->next->res_word == RES_DO)
9735  continue;
9736  /* next word is not "do". It must be "in" then ("FOR v in ...") */
9737  if (cpipe->res_word == RES_IN /* "for v IN a b; not_do..."? */
9738  || cpipe->next->res_word != RES_IN /* FOR v not_do_and_not_in..."? */
9739  ) {
9740  syntax_error("malformed for");
9741  debug_leave();
9742  debug_printf_exec("run_list lvl %d return 1\n", G.run_list_level);
9743  return 1;
9744  }
9745  }
9746  }
9747 #endif
9748 
9749  /* Past this point, all code paths should jump to ret: label
9750  * in order to return, no direct "return" statements please.
9751  * This helps to ensure that no memory is leaked. */
9752 
9753 #if ENABLE_HUSH_JOB
9754  G.run_list_level++;
9755 #endif
9756 
9757 #if HAS_KEYWORDS
9758  rword = RES_NONE;
9759  last_rword = RES_XXXX;
9760 #endif
9761  last_followup = PIPE_SEQ;
9762  rcode = G.last_exitcode;
9763 
9764  /* Go through list of pipes, (maybe) executing them. */
9765  for (; pi; pi = IF_HUSH_LOOPS(rword == RES_DONE ? loop_top : ) pi->next) {
9766  int r;
9767  int sv_errexit_depth;
9768 
9769  if (G.flag_SIGINT)
9770  break;
9771  if (G_flag_return_in_progress == 1)
9772  break;
9773 
9774  IF_HAS_KEYWORDS(rword = pi->res_word;)
9775  debug_printf_exec(": rword=%d cond_code=%d last_rword=%d\n",
9776  rword, cond_code, last_rword);
9777 
9778  sv_errexit_depth = G.errexit_depth;
9779  if (
9780 #if ENABLE_HUSH_IF
9781  rword == RES_IF || rword == RES_ELIF ||
9782 #endif
9783  pi->followup != PIPE_SEQ
9784  ) {
9785  G.errexit_depth++;
9786  }
9787 #if ENABLE_HUSH_LOOPS
9788  if ((rword == RES_WHILE || rword == RES_UNTIL || rword == RES_FOR)
9789  && loop_top == NULL /* avoid bumping G.depth_of_loop twice */
9790  ) {
9791  /* start of a loop: remember where loop starts */
9792  loop_top = pi;
9793  G.depth_of_loop++;
9794  }
9795 #endif
9796  /* Still in the same "if...", "then..." or "do..." branch? */
9797  if (IF_HAS_KEYWORDS(rword == last_rword &&) 1) {
9798  if ((rcode == 0 && last_followup == PIPE_OR)
9799  || (rcode != 0 && last_followup == PIPE_AND)
9800  ) {
9801  /* It is "<true> || CMD" or "<false> && CMD"
9802  * and we should not execute CMD */
9803  debug_printf_exec("skipped cmd because of || or &&\n");
9804  last_followup = pi->followup;
9805  goto dont_check_jobs_but_continue;
9806  }
9807  }
9808  last_followup = pi->followup;
9809  IF_HAS_KEYWORDS(last_rword = rword;)
9810 #if ENABLE_HUSH_IF
9811  if (cond_code) {
9812  if (rword == RES_THEN) {
9813  /* if false; then ... fi has exitcode 0! */
9814  G.last_exitcode = rcode = EXIT_SUCCESS;
9815  /* "if <false> THEN cmd": skip cmd */
9816  continue;
9817  }
9818  } else {
9819  if (rword == RES_ELSE || rword == RES_ELIF) {
9820  /* "if <true> then ... ELSE/ELIF cmd":
9821  * skip cmd and all following ones */
9822  break;
9823  }
9824  }
9825 #endif
9826 #if ENABLE_HUSH_LOOPS
9827  if (rword == RES_FOR) { /* && pi->num_cmds - always == 1 */
9828  if (!for_lcur) {
9829  /* first loop through for */
9830 
9831  static const char encoded_dollar_at[] ALIGN1 = {
9832  SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL, '@' | 0x80, SPECIAL_VAR_SYMBOL, '\0'
9833  }; /* encoded representation of "$@" */
9834  static const char *const encoded_dollar_at_argv[] ALIGN_PTR = {
9835  encoded_dollar_at, NULL
9836  }; /* argv list with one element: "$@" */
9837  char **vals;
9838 
9839  G.last_exitcode = rcode = EXIT_SUCCESS;
9840  vals = (char**)encoded_dollar_at_argv;
9841  if (pi->next->res_word == RES_IN) {
9842  /* if no variable values after "in" we skip "for" */
9843  if (!pi->next->cmds[0].argv) {
9844  debug_printf_exec(": null FOR: exitcode EXIT_SUCCESS\n");
9845  break;
9846  }
9847  vals = pi->next->cmds[0].argv;
9848  } /* else: "for var; do..." -> assume "$@" list */
9849  /* create list of variable values */
9850  debug_print_strings("for_list made from", vals);
9851  for_list = expand_strvec_to_strvec(vals);
9852  for_lcur = for_list;
9853  debug_print_strings("for_list", for_list);
9854  }
9855  if (!*for_lcur) {
9856  /* "for" loop is over, clean up */
9857  free(for_list);
9858  for_list = NULL;
9859  for_lcur = NULL;
9860  break;
9861  }
9862  /* Insert next value from for_lcur */
9863  /* note: *for_lcur already has quotes removed, $var expanded, etc */
9864  set_local_var_from_halves(pi->cmds[0].argv[0], *for_lcur++);
9865  continue;
9866  }
9867  if (rword == RES_IN) {
9868  continue; /* "for v IN list;..." - "in" has no cmds anyway */
9869  }
9870  if (rword == RES_DONE) {
9871  continue; /* "done" has no cmds too */
9872  }
9873 #endif
9874 #if ENABLE_HUSH_CASE
9875  if (rword == RES_CASE) {
9876  debug_printf_exec("CASE cond_code:%d\n", cond_code);
9877  case_word = expand_string_to_string(pi->cmds->argv[0],
9878  EXP_FLAG_ESC_GLOB_CHARS, /*unbackslash:*/ 1);
9879  debug_printf_exec("CASE word1:'%s'\n", case_word);
9880  //unbackslash(case_word);
9881  //debug_printf_exec("CASE word2:'%s'\n", case_word);
9882  continue;
9883  }
9884  if (rword == RES_MATCH) {
9885  char **argv;
9886 
9887  debug_printf_exec("MATCH cond_code:%d\n", cond_code);
9888  if (!case_word) /* "case ... matched_word) ... WORD)": we executed selected branch, stop */
9889  break;
9890  /* all prev words didn't match, does this one match? */
9891  argv = pi->cmds->argv;
9892  while (*argv) {
9893  char *pattern;
9894  debug_printf_exec("expand_string_to_string('%s')\n", *argv);
9895  pattern = expand_string_to_string(*argv,
9896  EXP_FLAG_ESC_GLOB_CHARS,
9897  /*unbackslash:*/ 0
9898  );
9899  /* TODO: which FNM_xxx flags to use? */
9900  cond_code = (fnmatch(pattern, case_word, /*flags:*/ 0) != 0);
9901  debug_printf_exec("fnmatch(pattern:'%s',str:'%s'):%d\n",
9902  pattern, case_word, cond_code);
9903  free(pattern);
9904  if (cond_code == 0) {
9905  /* match! we will execute this branch */
9906  free(case_word);
9907  case_word = NULL; /* make future "word)" stop */
9908  break;
9909  }
9910  argv++;
9911  }
9912  continue;
9913  }
9914  if (rword == RES_CASE_BODY) { /* inside of a case branch */
9915  debug_printf_exec("CASE_BODY cond_code:%d\n", cond_code);
9916  if (cond_code != 0)
9917  continue; /* not matched yet, skip this pipe */
9918  }
9919  if (rword == RES_ESAC) {
9920  debug_printf_exec("ESAC cond_code:%d\n", cond_code);
9921  if (case_word) {
9922  /* "case" did not match anything: still set $? (to 0) */
9923  G.last_exitcode = rcode = EXIT_SUCCESS;
9924  }
9925  }
9926 #endif
9927  /* Just pressing <enter> in shell should check for jobs.
9928  * OTOH, in non-interactive shell this is useless
9929  * and only leads to extra job checks */
9930  if (pi->num_cmds == 0) {
9931  if (G_interactive_fd)
9932  goto check_jobs_and_continue;
9933  continue;
9934  }
9935 
9936  /* After analyzing all keywords and conditions, we decided
9937  * to execute this pipe. NB: have to do checkjobs(NULL)
9938  * after run_pipe to collect any background children,
9939  * even if list execution is to be stopped. */
9940  debug_printf_exec(": run_pipe with %d members\n", pi->num_cmds);
9941 #if ENABLE_HUSH_LOOPS
9942  G.flag_break_continue = 0;
9943 #endif
9944  rcode = r = G.o_opt[OPT_O_NOEXEC] ? 0 : run_pipe(pi);
9945  /* NB: rcode is a smalluint, r is int */
9946  if (r != -1) {
9947  /* We ran a builtin, function, or group.
9948  * rcode is already known
9949  * and we don't need to wait for anything. */
9950  debug_printf_exec(": builtin/func exitcode %d\n", rcode);
9951  G.last_exitcode = rcode;
9952  check_and_run_traps();
9953 #if ENABLE_HUSH_TRAP && ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
9954  rcode = G.last_exitcode; /* "return" in trap can change it, read back */
9955 #endif
9956 #if ENABLE_HUSH_LOOPS
9957  /* Was it "break" or "continue"? */
9958  if (G.flag_break_continue) {
9959  smallint fbc = G.flag_break_continue;
9960  /* We might fall into outer *loop*,
9961  * don't want to break it too */
9962  if (loop_top) {
9963  G.depth_break_continue--;
9964  if (G.depth_break_continue == 0)
9965  G.flag_break_continue = 0;
9966  /* else: e.g. "continue 2" should *break* once, *then* continue */
9967  } /* else: "while... do... { we are here (innermost list is not a loop!) };...done" */
9968  if (G.depth_break_continue != 0 || fbc == BC_BREAK) {
9969  checkjobs(NULL, 0 /*(no pid to wait for)*/);
9970  break;
9971  }
9972  /* "continue": simulate end of loop */
9973  rword = RES_DONE;
9974  continue;
9975  }
9976 #endif
9977  if (G_flag_return_in_progress == 1) {
9978  checkjobs(NULL, 0 /*(no pid to wait for)*/);
9979  break;
9980  }
9981  } else if (pi->followup == PIPE_BG) {
9982  /* What does bash do with attempts to background builtins? */
9983  /* even bash 3.2 doesn't do that well with nested bg:
9984  * try "{ { sleep 10; echo DEEP; } & echo HERE; } &".
9985  * I'm NOT treating inner &'s as jobs */
9986 #if ENABLE_HUSH_JOB
9987  if (G.run_list_level == 1)
9988  insert_job_into_table(pi);
9989 #endif
9990  /* Last command's pid goes to $! */
9991  G.last_bg_pid = pi->cmds[pi->num_cmds - 1].pid;
9992  G.last_bg_pid_exitcode = 0;
9993  debug_printf_exec(": cmd&: exitcode EXIT_SUCCESS\n");
9994 /* Check pi->pi_inverted? "! sleep 1 & echo $?": bash says 1. dash and ash say 0 */
9995  rcode = EXIT_SUCCESS;
9996  goto check_traps;
9997  } else {
9998 #if ENABLE_HUSH_JOB
9999  if (G.run_list_level == 1 && G_interactive_fd) {
10000  /* Waits for completion, then fg's main shell */
10001  rcode = checkjobs_and_fg_shell(pi);
10002  debug_printf_exec(": checkjobs_and_fg_shell exitcode %d\n", rcode);
10003  goto check_traps;
10004  }
10005 #endif
10006  /* This one just waits for completion */
10007  rcode = checkjobs(pi, 0 /*(no pid to wait for)*/);
10008  debug_printf_exec(": checkjobs exitcode %d\n", rcode);
10009  check_traps:
10010  G.last_exitcode = rcode;
10011  check_and_run_traps();
10012 #if ENABLE_HUSH_TRAP && ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
10013  rcode = G.last_exitcode; /* "return" in trap can change it, read back */
10014 #endif
10015  }
10016 
10017  /* Handle "set -e" */
10018  if (rcode != 0 && G.o_opt[OPT_O_ERREXIT]) {
10019  debug_printf_exec("ERREXIT:1 errexit_depth:%d\n", G.errexit_depth);
10020  if (G.errexit_depth == 0)
10021  hush_exit(rcode);
10022  }
10023  G.errexit_depth = sv_errexit_depth;
10024 
10025  /* Analyze how result affects subsequent commands */
10026 #if ENABLE_HUSH_IF
10027  if (rword == RES_IF || rword == RES_ELIF)
10028  cond_code = rcode;
10029 #endif
10030  check_jobs_and_continue:
10031  checkjobs(NULL, 0 /*(no pid to wait for)*/);
10032  dont_check_jobs_but_continue: ;
10033 #if ENABLE_HUSH_LOOPS
10034  /* Beware of "while false; true; do ..."! */
10035  if (pi->next
10036  && (pi->next->res_word == RES_DO || pi->next->res_word == RES_DONE)
10037  /* check for RES_DONE is needed for "while ...; do \n done" case */
10038  ) {
10039  if (rword == RES_WHILE) {
10040  if (rcode) {
10041  /* "while false; do...done" - exitcode 0 */
10042  G.last_exitcode = rcode = EXIT_SUCCESS;
10043  debug_printf_exec(": while expr is false: breaking (exitcode:EXIT_SUCCESS)\n");
10044  break;
10045  }
10046  }
10047  if (rword == RES_UNTIL) {
10048  if (!rcode) {
10049  debug_printf_exec(": until expr is true: breaking\n");
10050  break;
10051  }
10052  }
10053  }
10054 #endif
10055  } /* for (pi) */
10056 
10057 #if ENABLE_HUSH_JOB
10058  G.run_list_level--;
10059 #endif
10060 #if ENABLE_HUSH_LOOPS
10061  if (loop_top)
10062  G.depth_of_loop--;
10063  free(for_list);
10064 #endif
10065 #if ENABLE_HUSH_CASE
10066  free(case_word);
10067 #endif
10068  debug_leave();
10069  debug_printf_exec("run_list lvl %d return %d\n", G.run_list_level + 1, rcode);
10070  return rcode;
10071 }

int fnmatch(const char *, const char *, int)

9248  * Result should be 3 lines: q w e, qwe, q w e
9249  */
9250  if (G.ifs_whitespace != G.ifs)
9251  free(G.ifs_whitespace);
9252  G.ifs = get_local_var_value("IFS");
9253  if (G.ifs) {
9254  char *p;
9255  G.ifs_whitespace = (char*)G.ifs;
9256  p = skip_whitespace(G.ifs);
9257  if (*p) {
9258  /* Not all $IFS is whitespace */
9259  char *d;
9260  int len = p - G.ifs;
9261  p = skip_non_whitespace(p);
9262  G.ifs_whitespace = xmalloc(len + strlen(p) + 1); /* can overestimate */
9263  d = mempcpy(G.ifs_whitespace, G.ifs, len);
9264  while (*p) {
9265  if (isspace(*p))
9266  *d++ = *p;
9267  p++;
9268  }
9269  *d = '\0';
9270  }
9271  } else {
9272  G.ifs = defifs;
9273  G.ifs_whitespace = (char*)G.ifs;
9274  }
9275 
9276  IF_HUSH_JOB(pi->pgrp = -1;)
9277  pi->stopped_cmds = 0;
9278  command = &pi->cmds[0];
9279  argv_expanded = NULL;
9280

9282  || pi->followup == PIPE_BG
9283  || command->cmd_type == CMD_SUBSHELL
9284  ) {
9285  goto must_fork;
9286  }
9287 
9288  pi->alive_cmds = 1;
9289 
9290  debug_printf_exec(": group:%p argv:'%s'\n",
9291  command->group, command->argv ? command->argv[0] : "NONE");
9292

9294 #if ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
9295  if (command->cmd_type == CMD_FUNCDEF) {
9296  /* "executing" func () { list } */
9297  struct function *funcp;
9298 
9299  funcp = new_function(command->argv[0]);

9301  funcp->body = command->group;

9305 # endif

9313  debug_leave();

9315  }
9316 #endif
9317  /* { list } */
9318  debug_printf_exec("non-subshell group\n");
9319  rcode = 1; /* exitcode if redir failed */
9320  if (setup_redirects(command, &squirrel) == 0) {
9321  debug_printf_exec(": run_list\n");
9322 //FIXME: we need to pass squirrel down into run_list()
9323 //for SH_STANDALONE case, or else this construct:
9324 // { find /proc/self/fd; true; } >FILE; cmd2
9325 //has no way of closing saved fd#1 for "find",
9326 //and in SH_STANDALONE mode, "find" is not execed,
9327 //therefore CLOEXEC on saved fd does not help.
9328  rcode = run_list(command->group) & 0xff;
9329  }
9330  restore_redirects(squirrel);
9331  IF_HAS_KEYWORDS(if (pi->pi_inverted) rcode = !rcode;)
9332  debug_leave();
9333  debug_printf_exec("run_pipe: return %d\n", rcode);
9334  return rcode;
9335  }
9336 
9337  argv = command->argv ? command->argv : (char **) &null_ptr;
9338  {
9339  const struct built_in_command *x;
9340  IF_HUSH_FUNCTIONS(const struct function *funcp;)
9341  IF_NOT_HUSH_FUNCTIONS(enum { funcp = 0 };)
9342  struct variable **sv_shadowed;
9343  struct variable *old_vars;
9344 
9345 #if ENABLE_HUSH_LINENO_VAR
9346  G.execute_lineno = command->lineno;
9347 #endif
9348 
9349  if (argv[command->assignment_cnt] == NULL) {
9350  /* Assignments, but no command.
9351  * Ensure redirects take effect (that is, create files).
9352  * Try "a=t >file"
9353  */
9354  unsigned i;
9355  G.expand_exitcode = 0;
9356  only_assignments:
9357  rcode = setup_redirects(command, &squirrel);
9358  restore_redirects(squirrel);
9359 
9360  /* Set shell variables */
9361  i = 0;
9362  while (i < command->assignment_cnt) {
9363  char *p = expand_string_to_string(argv[i],
9364  EXP_FLAG_ESC_GLOB_CHARS,
9365  /*unbackslash:*/ 1
9366  );
9367 #if ENABLE_HUSH_MODE_X
9368  if (G_x_mode) {
9369  char *eq;
9370  if (i == 0)
9371  x_mode_prefix();
9372  x_mode_addchr(' ');
9373  eq = strchrnul(p, '=');
9374  if (*eq) eq++;
9375  x_mode_addblock(p, (eq - p));
9376  x_mode_print_optionally_squoted(eq);
9377  x_mode_flush();
9378  }
9379 #endif
9380  debug_printf_env("set shell var:'%s'->'%s'\n", *argv, p);
9381  if (set_local_var0(p)) {
9382  /* assignment to readonly var / putenv error? */
9383  rcode = 1;
9384  }
9385  i++;
9386  }
9387  /* Redirect error sets $? to 1. Otherwise,
9388  * if evaluating assignment value set $?, retain it.
9389  * Else, clear $?:
9390  * false; q=`exit 2`; echo $? - should print 2
9391  * false; x=1; echo $? - should print 0
9392  * Because of the 2nd case, we can't just use G.last_exitcode.
9393  */
9394  if (rcode == 0)
9395  rcode = G.expand_exitcode;
9396  IF_HAS_KEYWORDS(if (pi->pi_inverted) rcode = !rcode;)
9397  debug_leave();
9398  debug_printf_exec("run_pipe: return %d\n", rcode);
9399  return rcode;
9400  }
9401 
9402  /* Expand the rest into (possibly) many strings each */
9403 #if defined(CMD_TEST2_SINGLEWORD_NOGLOB)
9404  if (command->cmd_type == CMD_TEST2_SINGLEWORD_NOGLOB)
9405  argv_expanded = expand_strvec_to_strvec_singleword_noglob(argv + command->assignment_cnt);
9406  else
9407 #endif
9408 #if defined(CMD_SINGLEWORD_NOGLOB)
9409  if (command->cmd_type == CMD_SINGLEWORD_NOGLOB)
9410  argv_expanded = expand_strvec_to_strvec_singleword_noglob(argv + command->assignment_cnt);
9411  else
9412 #endif
9413  argv_expanded = expand_strvec_to_strvec(argv + command->assignment_cnt);
9414 
9415  /* If someone gives us an empty string: `cmd with empty output` */
9416  if (!argv_expanded[0]) {
9417  free(argv_expanded);
9418  /* `false` still has to set exitcode 1 */
9419  G.expand_exitcode = G.last_exitcode;
9420  goto only_assignments;
9421  }
9422 
9423  old_vars = NULL;
9424  sv_shadowed = G.shadowed_vars_pp;
9425 
9426  /* Check if argv[0] matches any functions (this goes before bltins) */
9427  IF_HUSH_FUNCTIONS(funcp = find_function(argv_expanded[0]);)
9428  IF_HUSH_FUNCTIONS(x = NULL;)
9429  IF_HUSH_FUNCTIONS(if (!funcp))
9430  x = find_builtin(argv_expanded[0]);
9431  if (x || funcp) {
9432  if (x && x->b_function == builtin_exec && argv_expanded[1] == NULL) {
9433  debug_printf("exec with redirects only\n");
9434  /*
9435  * Variable assignments are executed, but then "forgotten":
9436  * a=`sleep 1;echo A` exec 3>&-; echo $a
9437  * sleeps, but prints nothing.
9438  */
9439  enter_var_nest_level();

9441  rcode = redirect_and_varexp_helper(command,
9442  /*squirrel:*/ ERR_PTR,
9443  argv_expanded
9444  );
9445  G.shadowed_vars_pp = sv_shadowed;
9446  /* rcode=1 can be if redir file can't be opened */
9447 
9448  goto clean_up_and_ret1;
9449  }
9450 
9451  /* Bump var nesting, or this will leak exported $a:
9452  * a=b true; env | grep ^a=
9453  */
9454  enter_var_nest_level();
9455  /* Collect all variables "shadowed" by helper
9456  * (IOW: old vars overridden by "var1=val1 var2=val2 cmd..." syntax)
9457  * into old_vars list:
9458  */
9459  G.shadowed_vars_pp = &old_vars;
9460  rcode = redirect_and_varexp_helper(command, &squirrel, argv_expanded);
9461  if (rcode == 0) {
9462  if (!funcp) {
9463  /* Do not collect *to old_vars list* vars shadowed
9464  * by e.g. "local VAR" builtin (collect them
9465  * in the previously nested list instead):
9466  * don't want them to be restored immediately
9467  * after "local" completes.
9468  */
9469  G.shadowed_vars_pp = sv_shadowed;
9470 
9471  debug_printf_exec(": builtin '%s' '%s'...\n",
9472  x->b_cmd, argv_expanded[1]);
9473  fflush_all();
9474  rcode = x->b_function(argv_expanded) & 0xff;
9475  fflush_all();
9476  }
9477 #if ENABLE_HUSH_FUNCTIONS
9478  else {
9479  debug_printf_exec(": function '%s' '%s'...\n",
9480  funcp->name, argv_expanded[1]);
9481  rcode = run_function(funcp, argv_expanded) & 0xff;
9482  /*
9483  * But do collect *to old_vars list* vars shadowed
9484  * within function execution. To that end, restore
9485  * this pointer _after_ function run:
9486  */
9487  G.shadowed_vars_pp = sv_shadowed;
9488  }
9489 #endif
9490  }
9491  } else
9492  if (ENABLE_FEATURE_SH_NOFORK && NUM_APPLETS > 1) {
9493  int n = find_applet_by_name(argv_expanded[0]);
9494  if (n < 0 || !APPLET_IS_NOFORK(n))
9495  goto must_fork;
9496 
9497  enter_var_nest_level();
9498  /* Collect all variables "shadowed" by helper into old_vars list */
9499  G.shadowed_vars_pp = &old_vars;
9500  rcode = redirect_and_varexp_helper(command, &squirrel, argv_expanded);
9501  G.shadowed_vars_pp = sv_shadowed;
9502 
9503  if (rcode == 0) {
9504  debug_printf_exec(": run_nofork_applet '%s' '%s'...\n",
9505  argv_expanded[0], argv_expanded[1]);
9506  /*
9507  * Note: signals (^C) can't interrupt here.
9508  * We remember them and they will be acted upon
9509  * after applet returns.
9510  * This makes applets which can run for a long time
9511  * and/or wait for user input ineligible for NOFORK:
9512  * for example, "yes" or "rm" (rm -i waits for input).
9513  */
9514  rcode = run_nofork_applet(n, argv_expanded);
9515  }
9516  } else
9517  goto must_fork;
9518 
9519  restore_redirects(squirrel);
9520  clean_up_and_ret1:
9521  leave_var_nest_level();
9522  add_vars(old_vars);
9523 
9524  /*
9525  * Try "usleep 99999999" + ^C + "echo $?"
9526  * with FEATURE_SH_NOFORK=y.
9527  */
9528  if (!funcp) {
9529  /* It was builtin or nofork.
9530  * if this would be a real fork/execed program,
9531  * it should have died if a fatal sig was received.
9532  * But OTOH, there was no separate process,
9533  * the sig was sent to _shell_, not to non-existing
9534  * child.
9535  * Let's just handle ^C only, this one is obvious:
9536  * we aren't ok with exitcode 0 when ^C was pressed
9537  * during builtin/nofork.
9538  */
9539  if (sigismember(&G.pending_set, SIGINT))
9540  rcode = 128 | SIGINT;
9541  }
9542  free(argv_expanded);
9543  IF_HAS_KEYWORDS(if (pi->pi_inverted) rcode = !rcode;)
9544  debug_leave();
9545  debug_printf_exec("run_pipe return %d\n", rcode);
9546  return rcode;
9547  }
9548 
9549  must_fork:
9550  /* NB: argv_expanded may already be created, and that
9551  * might include `cmd` runs! Do not rerun it! We *must*
9552  * use argv_expanded if it's non-NULL */
9553 
9554  /* Going to fork a child per each pipe member */
9555  pi->alive_cmds = 0;
9556  next_infd = 0;
9557 
9558  cmd_no = 0;
9559  while (cmd_no < pi->num_cmds) {
9560  struct fd_pair pipefds;
9561 #if !BB_MMU
9562  int sv_var_nest_level = G.var_nest_level;
9563  volatile nommu_save_t nommu_save;
9564  nommu_save.old_vars = NULL;
9565  nommu_save.argv = NULL;
9566  nommu_save.argv_from_re_execing = NULL;
9567 #endif
9568  command = &pi->cmds[cmd_no];
9569  cmd_no++;
9570  if (command->argv) {
9571  debug_printf_exec(": pipe member '%s' '%s'...\n",
9572  command->argv[0], command->argv[1]);
9573  } else {
9574  debug_printf_exec(": pipe member with no argv\n");
9575  }
9576 
9577  /* pipes are inserted between pairs of commands */
9578  pipefds.rd = 0;
9579  pipefds.wr = 1;
9580  if (cmd_no < pi->num_cmds)
9581  xpiped_pair(pipefds);
9582 
9583 #if ENABLE_HUSH_LINENO_VAR
9584  G.execute_lineno = command->lineno;
9585 #endif
9586 
9587  command->pid = BB_MMU ? fork() : vfork();
9588  if (!command->pid) { /* child */
9589 #if ENABLE_HUSH_JOB
9590  disable_restore_tty_pgrp_on_exit();
9591  CLEAR_RANDOM_T(&G.random_gen); /* or else $RANDOM repeats in child */
9592 
9593  /* Every child adds itself to new process group
9594  * with pgid == pid_of_first_child_in_pipe */
9595  if (G.run_list_level == 1 && G_interactive_fd) {
9596  pid_t pgrp;
9597  pgrp = pi->pgrp;
9598  if (pgrp < 0) /* true for 1st process only */
9599  pgrp = getpid();
9600  if (setpgid(0, pgrp) == 0
9601  && pi->followup != PIPE_BG
9602  && G_saved_tty_pgrp /* we have ctty */
9603  ) {
9604  /* We do it in *every* child, not just first,
9605  * to avoid races */
9606  tcsetpgrp(G_interactive_fd, pgrp);
9607  }
9608  }
9609 #endif
9610  if (pi->alive_cmds == 0 && pi->followup == PIPE_BG) {
9611  /* 1st cmd in backgrounded pipe
9612  * should have its stdin /dev/null'ed */
9613  close(0);
9614  if (open(bb_dev_null, O_RDONLY))
9615  xopen("/", O_RDONLY);
9616  } else {
9617  xmove_fd(next_infd, 0);
9618  }
9619  xmove_fd(pipefds.wr, 1);
9620  if (pipefds.rd > 1)
9621  close(pipefds.rd);
9622  /* Like bash, explicit redirects override pipes,
9623  * and the pipe fd (fd#1) is available for dup'ing:
9624  * "cmd1 2>&1 | cmd2": fd#1 is duped to fd#2, thus stderr
9625  * of cmd1 goes into pipe.
9626  */
9627  if (setup_redirects(command, NULL)) {
9628  /* Happens when redir file can't be opened:
9629  * $ hush -c 'echo FOO >&2 | echo BAR 3>/qwe/rty; echo BAZ'
9630  * FOO
9631  * hush: can't open '/qwe/rty': No such file or directory
9632  * BAZ
9633  * (echo BAR is not executed, it hits _exit(1) below)
9634  */
9635  _exit(1);
9636  }
9637 
9638  /* Stores to nommu_save list of env vars putenv'ed
9639  * (NOMMU, on MMU we don't need that) */
9640  /* cast away volatility... */
9641  pseudo_exec((nommu_save_t*) &nommu_save, command, argv_expanded);
9642  /* pseudo_exec() does not return */
9643  }
9644 
9645  /* parent or error */
9646 #if ENABLE_HUSH_FAST
9647  G.count_SIGCHLD++;
9648 //bb_error_msg("[%d] fork in run_pipe: G.count_SIGCHLD:%d G.handled_SIGCHLD:%d", getpid(), G.count_SIGCHLD, G.handled_SIGCHLD);
9649 #endif
9650  enable_restore_tty_pgrp_on_exit();
9651 #if !BB_MMU
9652  /* Clean up after vforked child */
9653  free(nommu_save.argv);
9654  free(nommu_save.argv_from_re_execing);
9655  G.var_nest_level = sv_var_nest_level;
9656  remove_nested_vars();
9657  add_vars(nommu_save.old_vars);
9658 #endif
9659  free(argv_expanded);
9660  argv_expanded = NULL;
9661  if (command->pid < 0) { /* [v]fork failed */
9662  /* Clearly indicate, was it fork or vfork */
9663  bb_simple_perror_msg(BB_MMU ? "vfork"+1 : "vfork");
9664  } else {
9665  pi->alive_cmds++;
9666 #if ENABLE_HUSH_JOB
9667  /* Second and next children need to know pid of first one */
9668  if (pi->pgrp < 0)
9669  pi->pgrp = command->pid;
9670 #endif
9671  }
9672 
9673  if (cmd_no > 1)
9674  close(next_infd);
9675  if (cmd_no < pi->num_cmds)
9676  close(pipefds.wr);
9677  /* Pass read (output) pipe end to next iteration */
9678  next_infd = pipefds.rd;
9679  }
9680 
9681  if (!pi->alive_cmds) {
9682  debug_leave();
9683  debug_printf_exec("run_pipe return 1 (all forks failed, no children)\n");
9684  return 1;
9685  }
9686 
9687  debug_leave();
9688  debug_printf_exec("run_pipe return -1 (%u children started)\n", pi->alive_cmds);
9689  return -1;
9690 }
NUM_APPLETS

◆ save_fd_on_redirect()

static int save_fd_on_redirect ( int  fd,
int  avoid_fd,
struct squirrel **  sqp 
)
