Definition at line 7903 of file hush.c.

7904 {
7905  if (avoid_fd < 9) /* the important case here is that it can be -1 */
7906  avoid_fd = 9;
7907 
7908 #if ENABLE_HUSH_INTERACTIVE
7909  if (fd != 0 /* don't trigger for G_interactive_fd == 0 (that's "not interactive" flag) */
7910  && fd == G_interactive_fd
7911  ) {
7912  /* Testcase: "ls -l /proc/$$/fd 255>&-" should work */
7913  G_interactive_fd = xdup_CLOEXEC_and_close(G_interactive_fd, avoid_fd);
7914  debug_printf_redir("redirect_fd %d: matches interactive_fd, moving it to %d\n", fd, G_interactive_fd);
7915  return 1; /* "we closed fd" */
7916  }
7917 #endif
7918  /* Are we called from setup_redirects(squirrel==NULL)
7919  * in redirect in a [v]forked child?
7920  */
7921  if (sqp == NULL) {
7922  /* No need to move script fds.
7923  * For NOMMU case, it's actively wrong: we'd change ->fd
7924  * fields in memory for the parent, but parent's fds
7925  * aren't moved, it would use wrong fd!
7926  * Reproducer: "cmd 3>FILE" in script.
7927  * If we would call move_HFILEs_on_redirect(), child would:
7928  * fcntl64(3, F_DUPFD_CLOEXEC, 10) = 10
7929  * close(3) = 0
7930  * and change ->fd to 10 if fd#3 is a script fd. WRONG.
7931  */
7932  //bb_error_msg("sqp == NULL: [v]forked child");
7933  return 0;
7934  }
7935 
7936  /* If this one of script's fds? */
7937  if (move_HFILEs_on_redirect(fd, avoid_fd))
7938  return 1; /* yes. "we closed fd" (actually moved it) */
7939 
7940  /* Are we called for "exec 3>FILE"? Came through
7941  * redirect_and_varexp_helper(squirrel=ERR_PTR) -> setup_redirects(ERR_PTR)
7942  * This case used to fail for this script:
7943  * exec 3>FILE
7944  * echo Ok
7945  * ...100000 more lines...
7946  * echo Ok
7947  * as follows:
7948  * read(3, "exec 3>FILE\necho Ok\necho Ok"..., 1024) = 1024
7949  * open("FILE", O_WRONLY|O_CREAT|O_TRUNC|O_LARGEFILE, 0666) = 4
7950  * dup2(4, 3) = 3
7951  * ^^^^^^^^ oops, we lost fd#3 opened to our script!
7952  * close(4) = 0
7953  * write(1, "Ok\n", 3) = 3
7954  * ... = 3
7955  * write(1, "Ok\n", 3) = 3
7956  * read(3, 0x94fbc08, 1024) = -1 EBADF (Bad file descriptor)
7957  * ^^^^^^^^ oops, wrong fd!!!
7958  * With this case separate from sqp == NULL and *after* move_HFILEs,
7959  * it now works:
7960  */
7961  if (sqp == ERR_PTR) {
7962  /* Don't preserve redirected fds: exec is _meant_ to change these */
7963  //bb_error_msg("sqp == ERR_PTR: exec >FILE");
7964  return 0;
7965  }
7966 
7967  /* Check whether it collides with any open fds (e.g. stdio), save fds as needed */
7968  *sqp = add_squirrel(*sqp, fd, avoid_fd);
7969  return 0; /* "we did not close fd" */
7970 }

◆ set_local_var()

static int set_local_var ( char *  str,
unsigned  flags 
)
static

Definition at line 2322 of file hush.c.

2323 {
2324  struct variable **cur_pp;
2325  struct variable *cur;
2326  char *free_me = NULL;
2327  char *eq_sign;
2328  int name_len;
2329  int retval;
2330  unsigned local_lvl = (flags >> SETFLAG_VARLVL_SHIFT);
2331 
2332  eq_sign = strchr(str, '=');
2333  if (HUSH_DEBUG && !eq_sign)
2334  bb_simple_error_msg_and_die("BUG in setvar");
2335 
2336  name_len = eq_sign - str + 1; /* including '=' */
2337  cur_pp = &G.top_var;
2338  while ((cur = *cur_pp) != NULL) {
2339  if (strncmp(cur->varstr, str, name_len) != 0) {
2340  cur_pp = &cur->next;
2341  continue;
2342  }
2343 
2344  /* We found an existing var with this name */
2345  if (cur->flg_read_only) {
2346  bb_error_msg("%s: readonly variable", str);
2347  free(str);
2348 //NOTE: in bash, assignment in "export READONLY_VAR=Z" fails, and sets $?=1,
2349 //but export per se succeeds (does put the var in env). We don't mimic that.
2350  return -1;
2351  }
2352  if (flags & SETFLAG_UNEXPORT) { // && cur->flg_export ?
2353  debug_printf_env("%s: unsetenv '%s'\n", __func__, str);
2354  *eq_sign = '\0';
2355  unsetenv(str);
2356  *eq_sign = '=';
2357  }
2358  if (cur->var_nest_level < local_lvl) {
2359  /* bash 3.2.33(1) and exported vars:
2360  * # export z=z
2361  * # f() { local z=a; env | grep ^z; }
2362  * # f
2363  * z=a
2364  * # env | grep ^z
2365  * z=z
2366  */
2367  if (cur->flg_export)
2368  flags |= SETFLAG_EXPORT;
2369  /* New variable is local ("local VAR=VAL" or
2370  * "VAR=VAL cmd")
2371  * and existing one is global, or local
2372  * on a lower level that new one.
2373  * Remove it from global variable list:
2374  */
2375  *cur_pp = cur->next;
2376  if (G.shadowed_vars_pp) {
2377  /* Save in "shadowed" list */
2378  debug_printf_env("shadowing %s'%s'/%u by '%s'/%u\n",
2379  cur->flg_export ? "exported " : "",
2380  cur->varstr, cur->var_nest_level, str, local_lvl
2381  );
2382  cur->next = *G.shadowed_vars_pp;
2383  *G.shadowed_vars_pp = cur;
2384  } else {
2385  /* Came from pseudo_exec_argv(), no need to save: delete it */
2386  debug_printf_env("shadow-deleting %s'%s'/%u by '%s'/%u\n",
2387  cur->flg_export ? "exported " : "",
2388  cur->varstr, cur->var_nest_level, str, local_lvl
2389  );
2390  if (cur->max_len == 0) /* allocated "VAR=VAL"? */
2391  free_me = cur->varstr; /* then free it later */
2392  free(cur);
2393  }
2394  break;
2395  }
2396 
2397  if (strcmp(cur->varstr + name_len, eq_sign + 1) == 0) {
2398  debug_printf_env("assignement '%s' does not change anything\n", str);
2399  free_and_exp:
2400  free(str);
2401  goto exp;
2402  }
2403 
2404  /* Replace the value in the found "struct variable" */
2405  if (cur->max_len != 0) {
2406  if (cur->max_len >= strnlen(str, cur->max_len + 1)) {
2407  /* This one is from startup env, reuse space */
2408  debug_printf_env("reusing startup env for '%s'\n", str);
2409  strcpy(cur->varstr, str);
2410  goto free_and_exp;
2411  }
2412  /* Can't reuse */
2413  cur->max_len = 0;
2414  goto set_str_and_exp;
2415  }
2416  /* max_len == 0 signifies "malloced" var, which we can
2417  * (and have to) free. But we can't free(cur->varstr) here:
2418  * if cur->flg_export is 1, it is in the environment.
2419  * We should either unsetenv+free, or wait until putenv,
2420  * then putenv(new)+free(old).
2421  */
2422  free_me = cur->varstr;
2423  goto set_str_and_exp;
2424  }
2425 
2426  /* Not found or shadowed - create new variable struct */
2427  debug_printf_env("%s: alloc new var '%s'/%u\n", __func__, str, local_lvl);
2428  cur = xzalloc(sizeof(*cur));
2429  cur->var_nest_level = local_lvl;
2430  cur->next = *cur_pp;
2431  *cur_pp = cur;
2432 
2433  set_str_and_exp:
2434  cur->varstr = str;
2435  exp:
2436 #if !BB_MMU || ENABLE_HUSH_READONLY
2437  if (flags & SETFLAG_MAKE_RO) {
2438  cur->flg_read_only = 1;
2439  }
2440 #endif
2441  if (flags & SETFLAG_EXPORT)
2442  cur->flg_export = 1;
2443  retval = 0;
2444  if (cur->flg_export) {
2445  if (flags & SETFLAG_UNEXPORT) {
2446  cur->flg_export = 0;
2447  /* unsetenv was already done */
2448  } else {
2449  debug_printf_env("%s: putenv '%s'/%u\n", __func__, cur->varstr, cur->var_nest_level);
2450  retval = putenv(cur->varstr);
2451  /* fall through to "free(free_me)" -
2452  * only now we can free old exported malloced string
2453  */
2454  }
2455  }
2456  free(free_me);
2457 
2458  handle_changed_special_names(cur->varstr, name_len - 1);
2459 
2460  return retval;
2461 }

Definition at line 10179 of file hush.c.

10180 {
10181  int idx;
10182  switch (mode) {
10183  case 'n':
10184  /* set -n has no effect in interactive shell */
10185  /* Try: while set -n; do echo $-; done */
10186  if (!G_interactive_fd)
10187  G.o_opt[OPT_O_NOEXEC] = state;
10188  break;
10189  case 'x':
10190  IF_HUSH_MODE_X(G_x_mode = state;)
10191  IF_HUSH_MODE_X(if (G.x_mode_fd <= 0) G.x_mode_fd = dup_CLOEXEC(2, 10);)
10192  break;
10193  case 'e':
10194  G.o_opt[OPT_O_ERREXIT] = state;
10195  break;
10196  case 'o':
10197  if (!o_opt) {
10198  /* "set -o" or "set +o" without parameter.
10199  * in bash, set -o produces this output:
10200  * pipefail off
10201  * and set +o:
10202  * set +o pipefail
10203  * We always use the second form.
10204  */
10205  const char *p = o_opt_strings;
10206  idx = 0;
10207  while (*p) {
10208  printf("set %co %s\n", (G.o_opt[idx] ? '-' : '+'), p);
10209  idx++;
10210  p += strlen(p) + 1;
10211  }
10212  break;
10213  }
10214  idx = index_in_strings(o_opt_strings, o_opt);
10215  if (idx >= 0) {
10216  G.o_opt[idx] = state;
10217  break;
10218  }
10219  /* fall through to error */
10220  default:
10221  return EXIT_FAILURE;
10222  }
10223  return EXIT_SUCCESS;
10224 }

2548 {
2549  char **s;
2550 
2551  if (!strings)
2552  return;
2553 
2554  s = strings;
2555  while (*s) {
2556  struct variable *var_p;
2557  struct variable **var_pp;
2558  char *eq;
2559 
2560  eq = strchr(*s, '=');
2561  if (HUSH_DEBUG && !eq)
2562  bb_simple_error_msg_and_die("BUG in varexp4");
2563  var_pp = get_ptr_to_local_var(*s, eq - *s);
2564  if (var_pp) {
2565  var_p = *var_pp;
2566  if (var_p->flg_read_only) {
2567  char **p;
2568  bb_error_msg("%s: readonly variable", *s);
2569  /*
2570  * "VAR=V BLTIN" unsets VARs after BLTIN completes.
2571  * If VAR is readonly, leaving it in the list
2572  * after asssignment error (msg above)
2573  * causes doubled error message later, on unset.
2574  */
2575  debug_printf_env("removing/freeing '%s' element\n", *s);
2576  free(*s);
2577  p = s;
2578  do { *p = p[1]; p++; } while (*p);
2579  goto next;
2580  }
2581  /* below, set_local_var() with nest level will
2582  * "shadow" (remove) this variable from
2583  * global linked list.
2584  */
2585  }

2587  set_local_var(*s, (G.var_nest_level << SETFLAG_VARLVL_SHIFT) | SETFLAG_EXPORT);
2588  s++;
2589  next: ;
2590  }
2591  free(strings);
2592 }

◆ setup_heredoc()

static void setup_heredoc ( struct redir_struct *  redir)
static

Definition at line 7749 of file hush.c.

7750 {
7751  struct fd_pair pair;
7752  pid_t pid;
7753  int len, written;
7754  /* the _body_ of heredoc (misleading field name) */
7755  const char *heredoc = redir->rd_filename;
7756  char *expanded;
7757 #if !BB_MMU
7758  char **to_free;
7759 #endif
7760 
7761  expanded = NULL;
7762  if (!(redir->rd_dup & HEREDOC_QUOTED)) {
7763  expanded = encode_then_expand_string(heredoc);
7764  if (expanded)
7765  heredoc = expanded;
7766  }
7767  len = strlen(heredoc);
7768 
7769  close(redir->rd_fd); /* often saves dup2+close in xmove_fd */
7770  xpiped_pair(pair);
7771  xmove_fd(pair.rd, redir->rd_fd);
7772 
7773  /* Try writing without forking. Newer kernels have
7774  * dynamically growing pipes. Must use non-blocking write! */
7775  ndelay_on(pair.wr);
7776  while (1) {
7777  written = write(pair.wr, heredoc, len);
7778  if (written <= 0)
7779  break;
7780  len -= written;
7781  if (len == 0) {
7782  close(pair.wr);
7783  free(expanded);
7784  return;
7785  }
7786  heredoc += written;
7787  }
7788  ndelay_off(pair.wr);
7789 
7790  /* Okay, pipe buffer was not big enough */
7791  /* Note: we must not create a stray child (bastard? :)
7792  * for the unsuspecting parent process. Child creates a grandchild
7793  * and exits before parent execs the process which consumes heredoc
7794  * (that exec happens after we return from this function) */
7795 #if !BB_MMU
7796  to_free = NULL;
7797 #endif
7798  pid = xvfork();
7799  if (pid == 0) {
7800  /* child */
7801  disable_restore_tty_pgrp_on_exit();
7802  pid = BB_MMU ? xfork() : xvfork();
7803  if (pid != 0)
7804  _exit(0);
7805  /* grandchild */
7806  close(redir->rd_fd); /* read side of the pipe */
7807 #if BB_MMU
7808  full_write(pair.wr, heredoc, len); /* may loop or block */
7809  _exit(0);
7810 #else
7811  /* Delegate blocking writes to another process */
7812  xmove_fd(pair.wr, STDOUT_FILENO);
7813  re_execute_shell(&to_free, heredoc, NULL, NULL, NULL);
7814 #endif
7815  }
7816  /* parent */
7817 #if ENABLE_HUSH_FAST
7818  G.count_SIGCHLD++;
7819 //bb_error_msg("[%d] fork in setup_heredoc: G.count_SIGCHLD:%d G.handled_SIGCHLD:%d", getpid(), G.count_SIGCHLD, G.handled_SIGCHLD);
7820 #endif
7821  enable_restore_tty_pgrp_on_exit();
7822 #if !BB_MMU
7823  free(to_free);
7824 #endif
7825  close(pair.wr);
7826  free(expanded);
7827  wait(NULL); /* wait till child has died */
7828 }

◆ setup_redirects()

static int setup_redirects ( struct command *  prog,
struct squirrel **  sqp 
)
static

Definition at line 8041 of file hush.c.

8042 {
8043  struct redir_struct *redir;
8044 
8045  for (redir = prog->redirects; redir; redir = redir->next) {
8046  int newfd;
8047  int closed;
8048 
8049  if (redir->rd_type == REDIRECT_HEREDOC2) {
8050  /* "rd_fd<<HERE" case */
8051  save_fd_on_redirect(redir->rd_fd, /*avoid:*/ 0, sqp);
8052  /* for REDIRECT_HEREDOC2, rd_filename holds _contents_
8053  * of the heredoc */
8054  debug_printf_redir("set heredoc '%s'\n",
8055  redir->rd_filename);
8056  setup_heredoc(redir);
8057  continue;
8058  }
8059 
8060  if (redir->rd_dup == REDIRFD_TO_FILE) {
8061  /* "rd_fd<*>file" case (<*> is <,>,>>,<>) */
8062  char *p;
8063  int mode;
8064 
8065  if (redir->rd_filename == NULL) {
8066  /* Examples:
8067  * "cmd >" (no filename)
8068  * "cmd > <file" (2nd redirect starts too early)
8069  */
8070  syntax_error("invalid redirect");
8071  continue;
8072  }
8073  mode = redir_table[redir->rd_type].mode;
8074  p = expand_string_to_string(redir->rd_filename,
8075  EXP_FLAG_ESC_GLOB_CHARS, /*unbackslash:*/ 1);
8076  newfd = open_or_warn(p, mode);
8077  free(p);
8078  if (newfd < 0) {
8079  /* Error message from open_or_warn can be lost
8080  * if stderr has been redirected, but bash
8081  * and ash both lose it as well
8082  * (though zsh doesn't!)
8083  */
8084  return 1;
8085  }
8086  if (newfd == redir->rd_fd && sqp) {
8087  /* open() gave us precisely the fd we wanted.
8088  * This means that this fd was not busy
8089  * (not opened to anywhere).
8090  * Remember to close it on restore:
8091  */
8092  *sqp = add_squirrel_closed(*sqp, newfd);
8093  debug_printf_redir("redir to previously closed fd %d\n", newfd);
8094  }
8095  } else {
8096  /* "rd_fd>&rd_dup" or "rd_fd>&-" case */
8097  newfd = redir->rd_dup;
8098  }
8099 
8100  if (newfd == redir->rd_fd)
8101  continue;
8102 
8103  /* if "N>FILE": move newfd to redir->rd_fd */
8104  /* if "N>&M": dup newfd to redir->rd_fd */
8105  /* if "N>&-": close redir->rd_fd (newfd is REDIRFD_CLOSE) */
8106 
8107  closed = save_fd_on_redirect(redir->rd_fd, /*avoid:*/ newfd, sqp);
8108  if (newfd == REDIRFD_CLOSE) {
8109  /* "N>&-" means "close me" */
8110  if (!closed) {
8111  /* ^^^ optimization: saving may already
8112  * have closed it. If not... */
8113  close(redir->rd_fd);
8114  }
8115  /* Sometimes we do another close on restore, getting EBADF.
8116  * Consider "echo 3>FILE 3>&-"
8117  * first redirect remembers "need to close 3",
8118  * and second redirect closes 3! Restore code then closes 3 again.
8119  */
8120  } else {
8121  /* if newfd is a script fd or saved fd, simulate EBADF */
8122  if (internally_opened_fd(newfd, sqp && sqp != ERR_PTR ? *sqp : NULL)) {
8123  //errno = EBADF;
8124  //bb_perror_msg_and_die("can't duplicate file descriptor");
8125  newfd = -1; /* same effect as code above */
8126  }
8127  xdup2(newfd, redir->rd_fd);
8128  if (redir->rd_dup == REDIRFD_TO_FILE)
8129  /* "rd_fd > FILE" */
8130  close(newfd);
8131  /* else: "rd_fd > rd_dup" */
8132  }
8133  }
8134  return 0;
8135 }

◆ unbackslash()

static char* unbackslash ( char *  src)
static

Definition at line 1473 of file hush.c.

1474 {
1475  char *dst = src = strchrnul(src, '\\');
1476  while (1) {
1477  if (*src == '\\') {
1478  src++;
1479  if (*src != '\0') {
1480  /* \x -> x */
1481  *dst++ = *src++;
1482  continue;
1483  }
1484  /* else: "<nul>". Do not delete this backslash.
1485  * Testcase: eval 'echo ok\'
1486  */
1487  *dst++ = '\\';
1488  /* fallthrough */
1489  }
1490  if ((*dst++ = *src++) == '\0')
1491  break;
1492  }
1493  return dst;
1494 }

◆ xdup_CLOEXEC_and_close()

)

1586 {
1587  int newfd;
1588  repeat:
1589  newfd = fcntl(fd, F_DUPFD_CLOEXEC, avoid_fd + 1);
1590  if (newfd < 0) {
1591  if (errno == EBUSY)
1592  goto repeat;
1593  if (errno == EINTR)
1594  goto repeat;
1595  /* fd was not open? */
1596  if (errno == EBADF)
1597  return fd;
1598  xfunc_die();
1599  }
1600  if (F_DUPFD_CLOEXEC == F_DUPFD) /* if old libc (w/o F_DUPFD_CLOEXEC) */
1601  fcntl(newfd, F_SETFD, FD_CLOEXEC);
1602  close(fd);
1603  return newfd;
1604 }
